description:
Work gets rough, head to Fly Trap. Work going well, head to Fly Trap to celebrate! New kid? Old problem? Lost love? Found love but lost your keys? Fly Trap's there for you. Valen and crew are the stewards of what little free time and sanity I have left. If you haven't been there yet go. If you're a regular, I'll see you soon. 

XOXO
author: Chell M.

description:
I cannot speak highly enough of the food, drink, and people at Fly Trap. 

Valen, the owner, is a neighborhood gem. 

Go here on a date night or after work happy hour. Sit at the bar and talk to the team working for the best personalized service. 

Order:
fries
burger
meatballs
brussel sprouts
author: Lizzie J.

description:
Here for a casual weekday dinner without a reservation and luckily, no wait.

Casual but cozy ambiance, great service. 

The food is tapas style and great for sharing! All the tapas we ordered were delicious and portions are on the generous end. A few of our favorites are the squid ink risotto with calamari (5 stars - must order!), chicken skewers (4.5 stars), and beef flank steak (4.5 stars) - which were all extremely rich flavor with the sauce yet tender in the meat. The bolognese (4.5 stars) and kale salad (4 stars) were both generously portioned and delicious. The bill came out to $100 for 2 ppl without pre tips so a little bit on the pricier side.

TLDR: great fun cozy place for amazing (but a little pricey) tapas
author: Nancy Z.

description: The burger was very good and staff friendly it's not a place you would go to unless you work in the neighborhood in SOMA. But if you're close it's a homey place for food and drinks.
author: N A.

description:
A 3 for me on food, but I'll round up to 3.5 for the excellent service and atmosphere. 

Good service feels personal, yet still professional. Our waiter was (almost overly) attentive, trolled my dining companion when he asked where the bathroom was ("I'm sorry, we don't have one, but you can go across the street..."), offered to help us take a picture, etc. The signage on the door (see photos) was also hilarious.

The restaurant is on the smaller side, but it's beautiful. Nice ceilings, dim lighting, and mirrored walls make the place feel bigger than it is.

I got the squash soup and had bites of the hanger steak. Honestly, the soup felt like someone dropped their white pepper shaker in.... The steak had been ordered medium, but it was definitely done more of a medium rare-- on the rare side, and a bit small. It lacked the meaty taste I prefer in steaks. The fries had a smoke seasoning on them that was tasty, and the lemon mayo was fresh and complemented these well.
author: Nicole H.

description: Worst meal I have had  in years. We had a large party. Many ordered the steak--arrived after a long wait cold, bland and grey. Was ordered medium rare but arrived well done. Everyone at the table had the same issue. The sides of mash potatoes and creamed spinach all cold.   The bread pudding was cold and tasted like it came out of a vending machine. The people who ordered the brownie dessert also received a cold thin slice that was one step down from store bought. Would not recommend!!!
author: sydney t.

description: Love this place. The drinks are on point and they have the most amazing quirky cups that will cheer  up your day. Amazing vibe. I've only gotten drinks but the food looks great.
author: Dayris F.

description: Pretty good spot for good food tapas style. The hummus which comes with crispy bread and 3 different kinds was good. Enjoyed the pistachio meatballs, braised lamb abgoosht (stew) and goat cheesecake. Good but not great overall.
author: Sunil R.

description: The Fly Trap sure did not bait me with its mediocre food. In fact, I managed to escape for a second dinner elsewhere. While the oysters were excellent and served with refreshing cucumber H20, everything else was lacking sparkle and pizzazz. The duck croquettes, bone marrow and tuna tartare were in desperate need of some flavor and spice, and the gnocchi was a little more dense than I would have liked. Although the service was nice, I decided that eating four subpar dishes was enough, declined dessert and walked my ass to another restaurant 5 minutes away for a sumptuous full meal...plus a decadent dessert.
author: Suany W.

description:
Service is friendly even if you pop in at a super random middle of afternoon time. 

The food is creative and delicious. Perfect spot to grab a few bites and some strong drinks. 

Bill may kind of eek towards the more pricier, but the ambiance and creative dishes are well worth it.
author: Kay H.

description: This is a hidden gem of the city. Expansive selection of liquor makes for an amazing craft cocktail menu - delicious. Staff is incredible. Definitely recommend.
author: Sam K.

description:
Came here for some drinks and quick bite to eat.

Good ambiance and great service. It was pretty empty for a Friday night which is always refreshing in SF. Got seated immediately and had our pick of the table (group of 5).

Had the tongue teaser which was really good (just a bit too sweet at the end). For food, had the brussel sprouts (AMAZING), duck croquettes, fries, heirloom tomato salad. Everything was delicious. 

Solid place in the soma area
author: Laura D.

description:
SoMa remains such an interesting place for good restaurants. 

Me and the bf were in town to hang with some friends and do some Christmas shopping. We decided to stay in a kitschy hotel near Union square (bold choice, I know). We didn't want to stray too far for dinner, but still wanted something nice. Fly Trap foot the bill! Tucked away in SoMa, the place was lit up on a quiet street after all the workers had left their jobs for the day. The place was intimate, not full but not too sparse. It provided an intimate, calm dining experience. We started with the scallops, which were nice! I then got the risotto and my bf the seafood linguine. Risotto was top notch! We both enjoyed our meals, the comfort food matched the vibe and the portions were pretty perfect. 

All in all, a lovely experience, a great price point for SF, and not just a place for after work drinks!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Ok, I've been to the Fly Trap twice now... I am trying to go as often as possible and become a regular there, since it's my neighborhood bar/restaurant. 
-I love the vibe there.
-The bartenders are great, professional, helpful and nice.
-The drinks are good. They made a mean Old Fashioned with my name all over it.
-The food seems good, although Ive only had take out one time, but I look forward to trying everything on their tasty menu.
author: Tati C.

description: This is such a pretty little restaurant. I got here early and loved the little alley way. The food is so delicious & service was on point. The interior was perfect for catching up with my girl friends. I can't wait to go back & get more artichokes!
author: Kari G.

description:
*** In Short ***

Decent Mediterranean with a New American fusion-y twist.

*** In Depth ***

I've known about Fly Trap for years, but never found my way here until it was on the company dime as a new employee welcome dinner. This was largely because of the $$$ price point, though if one were to examine the menu, they'd realize that at around an average of $20ish for entrees, they're more in the $$ tier of restaurants.

Now, how would one describe the food here? Many of the dishes are, at their core, very Mediterranean, ranging from lamb and kebabs, to hummus and risotto, while the rest are more typical New American dishes, with a strong Mediterranean flair to them, so, New Mediterranean, if that's a thing. Notable items include their truffle fries and kebabs, while their entrees, like the risotto and rack of lamb are solid, but almost a little too intense in their respective flavors.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Large venue consisting mostly of two tops, with a mixture of inner bench seating, and outer chair seating.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: Chef Hoss Zare sold The Fly Trap 7 months ago. Things have changed quite bit with the change of management. Less Persian items, a smaller simpler and for me much less interesting menu. The atmosphere and service are good, but the food is not what it was.
author: David T.

description: It's a heartwarming story when the female bartender becomes the owner. It's even better when the food, service, and ambiance are everything you might hope for. The tuna tartare and crispy brussel sprouts were to "die for." Apparently it hasn't been "discovered" yet as there were some open tables on a Friday night, but everyone there seemed to be enjoying the food, drink, and themselves - nice vibe!
author: Bob F.

description: Great for drinks and apps after work. Pleasant and attentive service. Good for causal work gatherings, too.
author: Vicki L.

description: In town for work and roamed into the Fly Trap after a 16 hour day.  Valen at the bar made me feel welcome and I couldn't have asked for a more warm place.  She introduced me to some local California Whiskeys and whipped a burger on me unlike the kind you generally see in a bar w such great service.  This place is top notch and I can suggest it enough.  If you're in town for work, it's a place that will make you feel at home regardless where you originate from.
author: Michael F.

description: I love the Fly Trap, classy without a lick of pretentious attitude. The ladies who work there are total fun badasses and it starts from the top with owner/bartender Valen West. She's got amazing cocktails and nerdy science knowledge. Brittni and Jalebi are full of fun as well and worth a visit for a rockin start to your Friday night. AND they are now open for lunch Monday-Friday! As someone who hates kale I can legitimately say that their kale salad is my new addiction. The burger is fantastic and the curry chicken Katsu sandwich is a great twist on your classic chicken sando. It will be your new favorite hidden gem. Impress a client. Do it.
author: Melania Z.

description:
Great cocktails and a nice location.

Cant speak about the food too much, we only ordered some fries which were satisfying but we already had reservations elsewhere.

4 stars because we had to ask for a few things twice since the bartender was pretty busy but otherwise it was a great experience.
author: Mario M.

description: Wowee, this place is the best. I must declare working in San Francisco has it's benefits. So just recently I came here with some coworkers and everyone of us thought we should take a luxurious break after working in public transport. I thought I was going to be disappointed but I was so wrong. On the weekdays they open at 3pm which is good for transit workers who finish their afternoon shifts. I heard about this place on Check Please Bay Area and are glad I was not lied to. It's a place where you should definitely come here with groups. Friends family or coworkers please stop by. For portions they are okay as long as you eat your food very slowly. If you eat a lot I highly recommend you do so. This place is so high end that it's better to not come here alone or else there will be a lot of regret in how much you spend.
author: Michael W.

description:
Had a mediocre date here (with a guy who ordered a $40 whisky during the round I offered to pay for*)... but that shall not take away from this cool spot.

Perfect lighting (dim, while still illuminating), two high top communal tables and a decent bar. Plus happy hour until 6p. Otherwise, cocktails are about $15.

Plenty of dinner tables, some outdoor seating, but bar seating is limited. So go early if you want a spot.

Service isn't super friendly, but you don't wait long to have your drink order taken. So, that scores well in my book.

*And in my own defense, I only realized the next day (when I saw my receipts) that that guy had committed such a heinous first date C-R-I-M-E. And it WAS a crime -- because he also happily split the dinner bill after ordering a $30 steak +beer (when I only had soup). Someone call the Tinder police and arrest that man for aggravated poor form in the first degree!
author: Pamela K.

description: Love this place near my office.  Always eclectic and old school while serving up great food. My favorite has to be the bone marrow plate.  When they have it on the menu be sire to order it.
author: Mike And Lorena Y.

description:
Most of the entrees here are lamb options, so don't come here if you don't like lamb I guess. I do enjoy lamb usually, but the braised lamb I ordered here was so underwhelming that I could not eat much of it. That's just me though; my friend ordered the same thing and ate it all. We wanted to see the dessert menu, but unfortunately no one was interested in the options (many of which were a bit odd). Service was slow/barely present, but they were patient with us while we were waiting for the rest of our party to arrive. Ambience was nice. That might be the only thing I would recommend. 

Taste | 2
Atmosphere | 4
Presentation | 3.5
Service | 2
OVERALL | 2
author: Lana L.

description:
A perfect neighborhood joint for lunch, drinks, or dinner. 
Great fries, nice folks, a well equipped bar. 
Most importantly it's about the ambience. It's the most intimate and shwanky spot for several blocks around.
I recommend the burger, the brussel sprouts, and let your bartender suggest something unexpected.
author: Al M.

description:
The Fly Trap is an upscale bar and restaurant in the SoMa district of SF. Clearly a popular choice for after-work gatherings, Fly Trap offers up some amazing, creative dishes that are very well-executed and have great flavor! We came with a group of four on a Friday night and started with appetizers--the trio of hummus came with a pesto hummus, squash hummus, and black bean hummus with lavash bread chips on the side. Each of the hummus dips had great flavor and were also topped with delicious garnishes like goat cheese, bell pepper, and peanuts. We also had the beet salad, which had the perfect dressing and, of course, fresh, juicy beets. Our last appetizer was the famous pistachio meatballs, which were fall apart tender and covered in a sweet and tangy pomegranate sauce. While these were good, I didn't think they were all that special or worth the hype.

For our main courses, we started with the rack of lamb, which was served over root vegetables and a pesto sauce; the rack of lamb wasn't all that flavorful--definitely not the best lamb I've ever had. We also had the seafood stew, which consisted of mixed seafood (including mussels, clams) served over a tomato broth and couscous--this was a savory, delicious, well-balanced dish. Finally, the stand out of the night for us all was the beef short rib served over a mixture of beans; this may have been the best short rib I've ever had--it was fall apart tender, fatty, and delicious.

Overall, an absolutely excellent meal with a few very memorable dishes, an elegant decor, and good service to boot.
author: David K.

description: really chill atmosphere. date night friendly! Im new to the area and this place really has me excited to try somethings else new!
author: Karleen S.

description:
They took my reservation over the phone and it was smooth. Food was decent-3.5 stars, and the vibe was cool.  Took a valued client there recently
Less than an hour into our time there, we were told that another table was coming in at six pm and we had to leave b4 then. I said no problem then was told by another server that the others party was there early and we had to leave soon. 
So needless to say, we felt rushed and it ruined what could have been a great experience.
Sort of felt like a bait and switch, because we weren't told  there was and END time when I initially booked the reservation. What restaurant does that without telling you in advance?!  If I had known that there was an hour time slot, I would have passed.
author: Lynn K.

description:
Hoss is the boss man there...and such an amazing person and host. He really makes you feel welcomed and at home.

And their food is absolutely amazing.
author: Gregory W.

description:
My boyfriend and I were meeting up with another couple for drinks. I had passed by The Fly Trap a few times before, so I was always curious about it. Luckily it was happy hour, so we stopped in for a beer. Seating was plentiful. The atmosphere feels classy. Service is fantastic. I love the use of mirrors to make the restaurant seem bigger than it really is. Décor is on point.

We didn't have a chance to try any of the food, so we still have yet to get the whole Fly Trap experience. Would recommend for happy hour, though. If you're just getting off work or need to arrange for a nice business dinner, I would recommend this cozy joint, conveniently located about 10 minutes walking from the Montgomery BART station.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I only came because my bf's Persian friend recommended this spot for great Persian food. I've walked by this place countless times on the way to/from the ballpark and to my friend's office and was always curious but it just looked like another 'fancy' place so I didn't pay too much attention to it.

Yes, the prices are, in fact, slightly pricey, but not ridiculous.. or do I just have SF goggles now? Entrees ranged around $20-35 which isn't that bad.. right..? The food is executed well, the service is stellar, the interior is beautiful, and the ambiance is quite intimate and dark.

Cocktails are about $12, and stiff. Good stuff!

The friend raved about the pistachio meatballs - so of course, that was a must-order. $10 for 3 mid-sized pieces.. but it really was one of the best meatballs I've had!! So tender and juicy and the harissa and pomegranate sauce gave it a lot of oomph.

We also got the rack of lamb, $36 for 4 chops -- and it was executed perfectly. They left some fat on it which only elevated the flavor and texture. SO. GOOD. Must get. I must be super Asian because all that meat juice and sauce would have paired so well with rice....

Can't wait to return to try other other dishes as the couple we had were executed so well!
author: Emily C.

description:
A must try Persian food. Every ingredient melts in your mouth. The unforgettable aroma and the taste. A must try place. Loved their 
Roasted Eggplant "kashk bademjam, 
Grilled Spiced Naan with Celery Root Spread and 
Goat Cheesecake. Supper yummy!!
author: Monika B.

description: Fantastic experience! If you are in the area stop in and seriously try the cocktails, all of them are extraordinary! Brittni is a fabulous host, mixologist and all around girls gal!
author: Charlie P.

description:
best beef jerky. . . 

. . . ugh said i need to post more to post review.... best beef jerky in town best beef jerky in town best beef jerky in town
author: Aaron M.

description: Awesome spot in downtown! Honestly can get pretty loud and is hard to have a conversation here, but that's a good sign for them. They were super nice when one of my entrées came out that was not to my liking, and the fixed it right up. Would recommend if your in this area.
author: Lindsey P.

description:
"The Fly Trap" is not a super appealing name of a place that provides you food, but the food itself makes up for it.

First of all, it was super easy making the reso through Yelp Reservations the night of. So I was excited already! My one qualm is that it's a small and very loud place. But luckily we were seated in the side dining room so I could hear my friend speak.

What we ordered:
- Spicy arancini: Nice big balls! Yay big balls! They had a kick to them but the risotto and cheese were not creamy on the inside. Still, they were good.
- Bone marrow: Delicious! Served with pickles and apricot preserves and some micro greens. Fresh, rich, sweet, and savory!
- Roasted rack of lamb: Gorgeous pieces of lamb cooked medium-rare. They were so tender and had a great sear. They were served with potatoes, root vegetables and pistachio pesto.

I wish I had ordered more food but I was saving space for a churro at the pier.
author: Kara D.

description:
I've probably tried every dish here, and have returned several times.  The pastas are amazing - the beet ravioli is soft, pillowy and melts in your mouth.  My non-beet-eating friend tried it, and her response was "wow, who knew?"  Equally melt-in-your-mouth perfect is the short rib.  I'm not much of a seafood eater, but I brought my mother in for a special occasion and she fell in love with the cartauccio.  Chef Chris' cannoli is the stuff of dreams.  Light, flaky and pure art.  My friends always struggle with the tough decision of housemade salted caramel ice cream vs. cannoli.  Not a bad choice to be made.

The bar is as impressive as the food.  Valen and the bartenders are artists, and the Fly Trap Mai Tai makes me too happy. A cocktail served in vintage glassware, a plate of garlic fries and some olives can render me quite happy for several hours.

The Fly Trap is certainly one of my happy places.  I'm taking some family there to celebrate my mother's 70th birthday.  It's that good.
author: Melanie K.

description:
Cool atmosphere and awesome service. My tequila drink was served in a Garfield cup - just the perfect size for a happy hour cocktail.  Happy hour was a big crowd 

Plus, I accidentally dropped my id and they went out of their way to get it back to me.  Would 100% recommend this spot for happy hour.
author: Amanda G.

description: love the vibe and decor in the restaurant. service was terrific, and a good spot for lunch and Happy Hour for those that work in the area, but also a good date night spot. i decided to go with a few small plates versus entrees (bone marrow, ahi tuna, shrimp and the duck croquettes), so it filled me and my friend up while we watched a game on TV. i'd go back to try the entrees next time.
author: Mike C.

description:
While looking at my photo album, I can't seem to remember the pictures I took for this restaurant. This goes to show that either I'm forgetful or this place was exceptionally not memorable. 

We ordered:

- Pistachio Meatballs = with red harissa, honey, and pomegranate. The flavoring was a little odd because it was too citrusy (weird, b/c I do like citrus & tangy flavors).

- Pan Roasted Cod = with red quinoa, roasted fennel, endive, grapefruit, arugula, tamarind, herbs, turmeric, and saffron. The cod was cooked perfectly, but the seasoning was lackluster. 

- Braised Lamb "Abgoosht" = with pulled lamb shank stew, potato, chickpeas, turmeric, preserved lime, lavash and torshi. It was hearty and good. 

- Goat Cheesecake = with candied almond and eggplant jam. I had better goat cheesecake elsewhere. Solely disappointed on this dessert, since the server raved about it...

Overall, the food was mediocre at most for a steep price. The service was friendly and wonderful. The crowd was loud and noisy, oddly for an early weeknight dinner.
author: Owie N.

description:
Great place, nice ambiance and of course I have to talk about the food. 

In fact, when I went to this place I was lucky enough to meet the chef/owner himself. I guess one wouldn't call it "meeting him" if he just walked by greeting. Lol. But you get the point. 

The food was delicious. At first I went there thinking it's an Italian restaurant but later found out there's this Persian Fusion taste mixed with it in a very interesting way. So the lest to say is that it's unique for sure. 

Prices were reasonable and location is great. Definitely lack of parking though so you'd want to Uber here. I assume it's the norm In the city anyways. 

Regardless, I would definitely go here again. I like restaurants with constant change in menu. It's always a surprise what you'd get next, but with this place a nice surprise for sure.

Next time I'll try to snap a pic with the chef himself .
author: Luca M.

description: I heard such good things about this place and now I wish I could say the same. First, my server was pretty lame to start with, he was distracted, not paying attention to any of his customers, etc. You know the type that is not genuine giving recommendations, continued to contradict himself, whatever. I didn't expect super honesty but I didn't  expect him to straight out lie either. He suggested a drink that did not even fit what he described, the first one came out disgustingly sticky and running over yet the drink started about an inch and a half below the rim which made no sense. A woman you could tell was a manager came over after she realized my steak was taking forever to get to me and instead of offering me something in the meantime she just wanted to know if I wanted to buy another drink while I was waiting. Are you serious, I've waited so long for my hanger steak the least you could've did was offer me one. It wasn't like the place was that busy either and she never once checked back in with me after she said it would be out in a minute and it took almost another 25 minutes. Not going back.
author: VeeMaria L.

description: In a part of SF with very few local restaurants and places to hang out, The Fly Trap really stands out.  The menu is classic, food is solid and the cocktails (and glassware!) are wonderful.  I've had many nights start here with happy hour and end with closing the place down.  We are fortunate to have this locally owned gem in our neighborhood.
author: David A.

description: Great spot for lunch, dinner & drinks. I just stopped in for lunch to try out the new menu. The burger was EPIC! Cocktails are also on point.
author: Dre D.

description: I came in for a Friday night dinner, and I didn't find anything standout about the food. The front space has a nice ambiance, but unfortunately we were seated in a back side room with little character. We shared the crispy brussel sprouts and duck croquettes to start, and I had the grilled ribeye. Unfortunately it was a bit too charred, and cooked way passed medium rare like I had requested.
author: Benjamin A.

description:
One of my favourite bars on 2nd street!
Dining and bar combined, nice crowd; not posh, not divey ... great wines and cocktails and awesome staff!!!
author: Carolin H.

description: Flytrap is so delicious and the most genuine and fun staff!! Always a good time every time I come visit. Whether for drinks or food or both! One of my favorites in the city. Keep up the amazing work.
author: Chea W.

description: The service was really good but the food could have been much better. I am sure I can find many more tastier food options for the price !
author: Tejashree M.

description: Second time at this eatery. Had the Pasta Bolognese & Duck croquets. They were both well executed dishes, I would also recommend one of their speciality cocktails as a treat.
author: John D.

description: This food is unbelievable! I got the rack of lamb - probably the best lamb dish I've ever had. The wine selection is decent, and the atmosphere is really cool.
author: Laura G.

description: Overrated ,food was OK the food is overpriced though and I would have to say it was not that good but I guess when you're in San Francisco you have to pay three times whatever the food is worth I mean five dollars for a soda that you can get a safeway for $1.50 I mean that's just extreme
author: Mat D.

description:
Came here with a group of friends for dinner on a Friday night. It was an interesting experience for me, given that I don't go out to eat Mediterranean food that often.

We ordered a few things to share:
- Beet salad: OK. Beets were prepared perfectly, went well with the greens and balsamic dressing (pretty ordinary), small portion
- Hummus: pretty good, came with three flavors
- Pistachio meatballs: a miss - very small portion and just tasted like an ordinary meatball
- Lamb rack: lamb was very tender, with fantastic pesto sauce
- Seafood stew: mediocre. Mixture of different seafoods and couscous.
- Beef short rib: amazing, very juicy and fatty.

Overall, there was a good variety of food and it was tasty. It did come with a high price tag, which for some dishes (lamb, beef) I felt was worth, but for others (meatballs, seafood stew) felt it was overly expensive.

I recommend giving it a try.
author: Alvin W.

description: Stopped by before the Giants game. About halfway stop between Montgomery St Bart and AT&T. They have a happy M-F $5 well, wine and beer. No happy hour food but they have food. Trying the iron steak kebab. Very tasty. Has that Persian Mediterranean flare with beef, herbs and lavash. Bartender remembered me from last week. Nice find! Stop by when you are in the area, 2nd and Folsom.
author: William R.

description: So sad to see this place go down but it's true.  We need Cher Hass back and his amazing use of spices and flavor.  Also a bit more hospitality and welcoming from the new owner wouldn't hurt
author: Clare W.

description:
What went wrong:
1. Table was sticky. Gross. 
2. Salad came out without vinegar on it. Super watery. Gordon Ramsey should've told whoever was doing garnishes to piss off.
3. Lamb entree was severely lacking in salt. C'mon. That's basic. Salt your meat.
4. Waiter never once checked in with us to ask "how is everything?" Or if we'd like another drink. He had a large birthday party (8) to handle, but they were right next to us, and it only takes a second to ask.

What worked:
1. Carrots were excellent. Some sort of spicy chili oil? Like.
2. Scallops were delicious. A tad overdone, but the flavor combinations made up for it.
3. Dessert was the best part of the meal. Brownie had this amazing white frothy sauce somehow made with wine and cream? Yum. BF's lemon curd was excellent.
4. BF's entree, the pork, was flavorful and the sides that accompanied it were also an interesting combination of tastes. This was yum.

But for $120+, I would not come back. Not enough selection on the menu also.
author: Catherine O.

description:
Our first time here and we were very happy with the food, wine and service.
First, we arrived in a staggered way, due to notorious parking issues in SF. The service did not bother or hover around us while we waited for our full party to show up. Meatballs, naan bread with spread and eggplant,bone marrow were all fantastic in presentation and taste. Good portions for appetizer. Lamb chops and beef cheek for entree was great. Beef cheek was especially succulent and flavorful. Goat cheese dessert was delicious. Baklava was ok.
author: Sridevi K.

description: Came here to check a new spot and redeem a $5 coupon from yelp. We were told that it didnt apply and honestly left a bit of a bitter taste. Nothing special here
author: Paul A.

description: Our party of 4 came in to the Fly Trap before the Giants game a week ago (my review of the Giants' performance that particular evening would be very different than my review of this great restaurant). Two guys in our party had the hamburgers and fries and said they were amazing.  The fries came with a dipping sauce which may have been a bearnaise-tasted just like the sauce served with pommes frites in Belguim.  One person ordered the 3 cheese toasted cheese sandwich (a special that night)which looked delicious, although he said it was super-rich and he couldn't finish it.  I ordered the calamari a la plancha with squid ink rice. Oh my gosh!  So fantastic!  The owner was super friendly and just genuinely seems to love her work.  Service was great. A few reviews complain about prices?  I disagree. Dining out in SF is a bit expensive but the variety and expertise offered in this city make it a unique experience. Thanks Fly Trap, for a great evening.
author: Lisa F.

description: The only reason I even gave a second star here is because my wife said the hummus was ok. So, we ordered 2 bacon cheeseburgers and fries, both medium well. 1 came out raw and the other was, well still bloody. To avoid confrontation I just ate mine and sent my mother's back because it was beyond eating. Now for the flavor, the fries were ok, but the burger tasted like a grilled meat ball with zero flavor. I have to say that coming from many other cities with delicious restaurants and pubs this falls very short of expectations. I can only say, I will not recommend the food here, but drinks are drinks at any bar.
author: Robert S.

description:
I came here for a double date with the roommate and a friend. This was actually my friend's suggestion since The Fly Trap was never on my radar. This was right before the foie gras ban back in May 2012. He had heard they had great foie. Unfortunately, they weren't serving foie that night, so we ended up getting:

*Smoked Trout http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco#qYMwf29OCeW5JuDj_e81WQ
*Bone Marrow http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco#OYh-fBiuqQNvRa0uEecxmg
*Crispy Saffron Risotto http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco#Bx_XLOcJP8yhYxTIJGoc1w
*Pistachio Meatballs http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco#LUAyvWAWTeXltGUbyHhImQ
*Mushroom Cake http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco#QXIclXgaceKFaXS7JKmRWg
*Diver Scallops http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco#1TvXefE8uoagpDHR8eUAoQ
*Special: Pasta http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco#Z7AjTN0lUUdBRBTEpMI6iA
*Poached Pear http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco#ySYPo8hoGSTxZrPBvsjUSA
*Beignets http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-fly-trap-san-francisco?select=sF0WOghWA9QHL_WZb9D8Lw#sF0WOghWA9QHL_WZb9D8Lw

I wasn't even a little versed in Persian cuisine, so I just picked dishes that appealed to me. Some seemed to have Mediterranean influences which I'm a little more familiar with, so at least I wasn't at a total loss. The food was great! I really enjoyed the crispy risotto, mushroom cake and scallops. Didn't see the allure of the meatballs, but to each his own. Everyone has different tastes.

Service here was amazing. Our server was attentive and super friendly. We were catching up and ended up having a nice long dinner. We never felt rushed. Good food, good conversation and good friends. Sounds like a great night to me!
author: Elena N.

description: Nice spot in SoMA. Been here few years back and recall having a good experience. Had great cocktails and good vegetarian options.
author: Nishank C.

description: Good place. I had the burger. They cooked it well but forgot my bacon. The truffle fries were great and the two apps (meatballs and brussels). Good spot to hit up.
author: Kristofer E.

description: Came here around 5pm on a weekday. Good service and solid old fashioned. Nice spot for a drink after work.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Authentic Persian style flavors with a modern twist. Multi course affair with incredible service in optimal ambiance and setting. Very impressed overall. 

So for starters we ordered the avacado dinner it had blood orange over arugula with cashews and a great sauce. 

Following our salad we ordered kashko bademjoon a Persian style eggplant dish with kashk (Iranian sauce) 

We decided to order Abgoosht with a side of cauliflowers and also ordered cinnamon braised beef shank which the beef texture was so superb and tender that I recommend it highly. 

And for dessert we ordered the faloode which is a Persian style citrus sorbet. 

Overall 20/20 absolutely delightful and memorable experience.
author: Mo A.

description:
Expectations were sky high for this stop. The staff was excellent and friendly. The sheer number of people there gave me hope, then the food showed up. 
Very bland. I was not looking for anything HOT, just tasty. 
We tried hummous, lamb and several dishes in the hope that we may have just ordered wrong, but this was food designed for the blandest palate. If those folks exist then they should enjoy the quality of the food which was very good. 
The flavors are what was missing. After eating in several Persian restaurants I know not to expect the spices of Lebanese or even Israeli food but something to bring this up in the flavor category. 
They even brought a spicy sauce that did nothing to bring up the taste quotient. 
Even the house pickles were just vinegary with no enhancement.
author: David B.

description:
Love, love, love this place! Fly Trap is right across the street from my work so I frequently visit for happy hour. Valin, the Owner is so attentive and really goes the extra mile to keep her customers happy. All of the staff is incredibly friendly and the interior is adorable.

PS - the fries and salmon are to die for!
author: Amanda B.

description: The fly trap is a unique place in the SOMA area. It was pretty dark when I came in and had lots of customers at a time when most places in the area are dead. The drinks were good but the food was just okay - sort of flavorless. I sat at the bar and the bartender never even glanced in my direction. I had to speak up for everything which was a little annoying after a while.
author: Kelsey C.

description:
Quite the delightful place, don't let the name fool you! Definitely a place to get a spread of plates and share like tapas because there are so many delicious things to try. 

Great service, speedy, but not rushed. They don't hover, which allows for mellow hanging out, eating, and drinking over the course of hours. 

Simple menu items (brussel sprouts and beet salad) prepared well, and with great presentation. By far, the best seasoned roasted brussel sprouts ever. Crispy but not overcooked. 

More exotic pickings: bone marrow, if you're into that. 

Libations are amazing. They do twists on the classics...mai tais, martinis, and the Blonde Manhattan is a must-try. Think a total mind trip like crystal Pepsi, only good.
author: Alison A.

description:
Amazing food, amazing service, and great ambience. It's a very classy restaurant/bar, but of course it's in San Francisco - you can come in wearing jeans and a plain T shirt.

Our table ordered the Braised lamb, Lamb sirloin and the Chicken breast. 

The wait staff was exceptionally accommodating, astute and delightful, they made my guests and I feel very welcomed at the Fly Trap - my glass water was never empty, and not in a bad way either. 

(The Meal)
-The Braised lamb was very sour and had a very overpowering pickle taste to it.
-The Lamb sirloin was just mouthwatering, the sauce they used had a very creamy texture to it which made the lamb have a homey taste.
-The chicken breast which had roasted garlic and sage was delicious with a bit of a mint flavoring to it.

This place is the reason why I started having such affection for Persian and Mediterranean Foods.
author: Marina S.

description:
The Fly Trap is a nice little restaurant tucked into a busy corner in the SoMa area with great flavors to taste and a rich history. I came here on a Friday night with a reservation for 4. We ended up deciding on ordering 3 appetizers and 3 entrees from their menu. Each of the 6 dishes were a joy to eat as none of it turned out to be disappointing at all! 

I started off by trying the beet salad which is very simple in appearance, but surprisingly bursting with flavor. The balsamic dressing coats the greens with a nice acidic flavor while the goat cheese melts on the tongue with its consistency of perfection. The beets also add a wonderful sweet and sour taste to the dish and is cooked to just the right texture to be bit into quite nicely. I then tried the trio of hummus which comes with three different types of hummus to be dipped into with the bowl of pita chips. The chips are nice and crisp, complimenting the hummus quite well. I didn't find the hummus to be all that special, though still delicious overall. One hummus dip did have bits of olives in it that packed a heavy punch to create a wonderful burst of flavor alongside the crunchy bits of the pita. The final appetizer was the pistachio meatballs. The meatballs are quite small to be split amongst four, but they are teeming with flavors I did not expect to make them all the more enjoyable. They are very moist, breaking apart easily with a slight push of the fork and have an element of sweetness to it, coming from the barbecue-like sauce and the honey. Bits of pistachios are sprinkled on top for a bit of a nutty flavor and crunch as well though I felt they didn't add much to the dish.

Done with the apps. Time for the entrees! We tried the rack of lamb which came with three lamb chops with some carrots and potatoes. The meat was prepared very well to produce a nice tender and medium cook. I found it to be very delicious, but more of a typical standard dish that was lacking that little punch of creativity and personality. The seafood stew was excellent with its couscous mixed in with the crab meat, squid, clam, mussels, amongst other pieces of seafood. The dish blended together very nicely with the tomato base and I felt the fresh pulled crab really added that nice seafood flavor throughout the dish which made it stand out from other seafood stews. The star of the night was without a single doubt, the braised short rib. Even before getting a bite, watching the meat separate and fall apart with the cut of the knife was a sight to behold. It just looked so right and so good. It'll make you want to run into kitchen and give a thumbs up to the master braiser of a chef. The meat comes on a bed of beans and vegetables which is perfect for balancing the dish and cleaning the palette with every bite. The balance of sweetness, sourness, and savoriness of the meat alongside its marvelous texture is a taste to behold.
author: Joshua M.

description: New chef, New owner, New vibes. Excellent service, attentive and gracious. Food was delicious and affordable (for SF..) especially happy hour! 5$ beer wine and well until 6pm.. the staff was overly accommodating to all our needs, and were super friendly. Can't wait to go back!
author: Brittni H.

description:
Food was okay, service was mediocre 
Ordered the fish and chips, lamb, risotto and flourless chocolate cake with salted caramel ice cream. We also ordered the garlic fries which never came! Server could not be bother with actual service!
author: Raymond H.

description:
Amazing Mediterranean food with a nice twist! Chef Zare is incredible. Our favorites is the pistachio meat balls ( koofteh). A must try. 

You can't go wrong with anything at this place!
author: Ghazal P.

description:
Exceptional flavors.. That is all about this place!
Super delicious Persian fusion cuisine by very talented Chef Hoss. Maximum creativity is what you see when it comes to ingredients. Taste is authentic and reminds me of my grandma's delicious food. You'll never leave this place without fun memories.. The cucumber drink is phenomenal and the desserts are unique like all the other items in the menu. The braised lamb (Abgoosht: a traditional Persian food) is a must order if you're a meat lover. Yet "Hoss-pitality" is something undeniable.. Chef Hoss usually spends a good amount of time to talk to his guests and generously shares his food knowledge and experiences with you if you have any questions.
This place's spectacular interior design and cozy and warm atmosphere makes it perfect for date nights or simply friend gatherings..
author: Shirin Z.

description:
4.5 stars. The ambience is a bit dark and avoid sitting in the same dining room as the bar during happy hour (the noise from the bar is a bit unbearable). I would recommend sitting in the smaller room around the corner. But the food is excellent and holds a unique place in the SF dining scene.

Every ingredient and dish is put together with care to delight.  The food definitely exceeded my expectations. 

Oven roasted cauliflower and romanesco appetizer - excellent. Perfect texture with interesting twist in the herb used. Visually with the white and purple cauliflower and green romanesco, the dish is quite pretty.

Bone marrow - quite good. I haven't tasted solid bone marrow since my days in Paris. And this one is comparable.

I think we had the pork belly main but can't seem to remember much - probably solid but not super memorable.

Excellent wine by the glass selection. I had the Failla pinot nior from sonoma coast and it was great!

------- 

A couple of additional recommendations from second visit:

Beet salad was fantastic, tasted farm to table, the beets are cooked just right. Loved the goat cheese. Soft and not too overpowering. Great dish.

Fois gras wrapped in smoked salmon - I was a bit skeptical at first but was a total convert at the end. The smoked salmon was not too salty therefore giving an interesting layer of texture for the Fois gras. The Apple side was quite interesting addition to cleanse palette between bites.
author: Rebecca C.

description: The ambience is pleasant and bustling as you would expect from a good bar. The service was very attentive and kind as you would expect. We absolutely enjoyed the appetizers and small plates we ordered as well as the creative cocktails. The farmer's tan especially was refreshing and tasty. I've never had a drink that featured basil water, but really enjoyed it. The big disappointment were the dinner entrees. I had the burger, hoping it would be an easy win, and I was really craving a burger. One thing that drives me nuts is when a restaurant asks you how you want your burger cooked, then terribly overcooks it or pays no attention. I asked for a medium burger, expecting a nice pink center, but got an overcooked beyond medium well dry burger. It's a shame. Especially for an $18 burger at nice establishment that should be able to cook a burger. The fries were great, and the toppings were fresh. The general consensus around the table for dinner was just sort of "OK" on the main course. I would come back for drinks and small plates again, but would not stay for dinner.
author: John W.

description: Fly trap is the neighborhood place. You can always count on a crowd, energy, and good food. Service can be a bit on the slow side, but always comes with a smile.
author: Maxwell W.

description:
Lovely ambiance, yummy dishes with a touch of persian flair, and the most hospitable chef!
Chef host uses a lot of creativity in his unique dishes. Best desserts ever!
Thank you Chef Hos for spoiling us last night. We had an awsome "cousin night out" at your lovely restaurant :))
author: G V.

description: Saturday Surprises are THE BEST! Tonight was the night I made the decision to walk inside the bar and restaurant I walk past daily in my new neighborhood. One of the best decisions I've made in the last six months. Service, food, ambiance, attention and skill were TOP NOTCH! This is my new place. Without a doubt I will be back.  So impressed. Thank you!
author: Charlotte J.

description:
Omg! The food is fkn DELICIOUS! Extraordinary service by Gabriel! And the owner is just a doll! 

Brother and I had beet salad (just the right amount of dressing and taste), bone marrow (to die for), fried chicken drum (mmm), and the risotto. Not to mention washing it down with a Mai Tai. Compliments to the chef and the staff! Simply amazing!

The energy and environment is a calm, relaxing ambience yet hip music to listen to while you're enjoying the time with whom you came with and scarfing down your food leaving no left overs! Nom Nom Nom ;)
author: Melissa N.

description:
Great cocktails.  Cute space and friendly service -- great for a romantic date.

The famous Pistachio Meatballs were indeed pretty unique.  Overall, good food and cute space.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Came here last night for an early dinner. There were plenty of seats and we did make a reservation in advance.

The bar looked a bit packed, so I guess they are pretty popular for happy hour.

For appetizers, we started with the the chicken stuffed meatball with lavash bread and the surf and turf appetizer (pork belly, gulf spot prawns and calamari). Both were good for sharing. The chicken stuffed meatball was just ok to me. It was a lot bread-ier than expected and I wanted the meatball to be meatier lol. The surf and turf was interesting. I believe the head chef came out and presented this to us and told us an interesting fact about how the prawns are male when they are young and then they are female when they are older. #themoreyouknow

For my entree, I went with the cinnamon braised beef cheeks. It was cooked perfectly and I enjoyed every bite! 

For dessert, we did share the baklava which was a great end to the meal.

I'd highly recommend this place for small bites and drinks. The drinks were really well balanced.
author: Christine W.

description: I liked it, really liked. Good food, nice interior, excellent menu! I advise everyone to visit this place !!!
author: Henadzi B.

description: Loved this place before.  Food now is awful.  Don't be fooled by the meatballs, Brussels, steak kebab.  A shadow of its former self.  Leaving there and saying 'that was disgusting'.  Never good.
author: A J.

description:
I came with a few friends for dinner. We arrived about 40 mins early (oops!) for our reservation, but they still seated us right away. The hostess was very nice and our drinks and appetizers were great, but it went downhill after that. 

I had the chicken breast Jerusalem, and the chicken was very over done and dry. There was one tiny piece of artichoke, and the rainbow potatoes were unrecognizable. They could have been cream of wheat for all I know, not appealing. The sauce, very disappointing, smothered the whole dish. I had the Baklava for dessert. What the menu neglected to say was that it was not traditional Baklava, but their play on it, which was triangles of very dry phyllo, a scant portion of a nut mousse (? still not sure) a very salty Persian cream, and some rose jam, which was the only saving grace. At least label it "deconstructed" or something. It was ok, and the service was good, but I won't be back.
author: BettyLou H.

description: This is the best cocktail bar in SOMA, and arguably the best in town.  Didn't have anywhere to park, but once we were at the bar, the rest was a fabulous evening.
author: Andrew T.

description:
The interior is cute, was a little over-crowded. Despite of all the noise and hustle, I had quite a good experience there. The waitress and the hostess were both super welcoming and helpful, bringing out each course with perfect timing. 

I liked my grilled salmon and had a bite of the abgoosht (lamb stew), which was very hearty and delicious
The appetizers, entrees and desserts were all beautifully presented and tasted amazing. 

Following the recommendation from our waitress. I can only guess going there on a less busy night would only make the experience better.
author: Marina S.

description: Ok, so I come in during happy hour asking which cocktails are available for HH, and am told none of the cocktails on the menu,  just well drinks,  beer and wine.  Fine, so I order beers only to be later charged full price. Asking what happened to happy hour prices I was told "oh, no, that doesn't apply to draft beers". WTF?
author: Eric W.

description: Great atmosphere. Great staff, fun attitude. Good food. Had to wait a long time between courses, but that was ok as the drinks were great!! I've always been curious about this place and would definitely go back.
author: Yvonne G.

description: Over rated. Fish was not fresh and waited for one hour for the food. The bone was good. Lamb and rib were good.
author: Anya C.

description:
When I say that I'm craving Mediterranean food, I'm usually thinking of tzatziki sauce, moussaka, gyros, lamb everything, some dessert incorporating phyllo dough. Basically, I'm just thinking of Kokkari Estiatorio (still my number one). While The Fly Trap had some of those things, none of the entrees particularly caught my eye. I opted for 2 smalls (the pistachio meatballs and naan w/ fava bean spread + ricotta) and a drink (agave's inferno), which was a perfect amount.

The pistachio meatballs are interesting and tasty; I haven't had something like those before. The naan was not a traditional naan, but much more fluffy. The fava bean spread was very light and the ricotta had a drizzle of balsamic on it. As for drinks, you could either blindly point at the libations mix (because you probably won't understand what any of the ingredients are - what the hell is velvet falernum), or you can take my waiter's/my recommendation for the agave's inferno! I don't usually drink tequila mixes, but I love spicy and this one packed a punch.

Friendly and non-pushy service. One of the servers asked me if I'd like a small/medium/big spoon to lap up the sauce that came with the meatballs (because if I had asked, I would have looked like a starving child). He came out with a tray, carrying a small, medium, and big spoon. What a homie.

However, I didn't find a dish that I really wanted here, and I didn't really like the ambience ("ritzy" is how my friend described it). The price is also a huge drawback, so I would still give 3 and not 4 stars for those reasons.
author: Stella A.

description:
We were a group of 8 people celebrating our bachelorette.
The owner was very polite and friendly and tok a few moment to explain the history behind the restaurant and some of the dishes.
The place has a good vibe with warm ambiance.everybody loved their food.
Appetizers: roasted eggplant, sautéed cauliflower , french fries..... They all were delicious and very tasty
The French fries are SUPER GOOD( crispy and fresh)
I had pomegranate daiquiri, which very refreshing and balanced in taste! All ladies were happy with their drinks as well.

For main dish: we had sheet steak( recommend it highly, the meat was so tender that it melted on my tongue ), lam burger( everyone loved it), vegetarian dish,rack of lam.

Try their cucumber yogurt on their dessert menue, what a refreshing ,light. Yet delicious dish.

Portions were bigger then we expected, so you can share if you like.
The price is good considering quality of food, drink  and service you get!
We had an wonderful evening there and all ladies enjoyed their food and drink and each other's company!
Keep it up The Fly Trap!!!!!!you for sure trapped our interest!!!!
author: Afshan L.

description:
My friends and I ate here recently and really enjoyed the meal very much. The menu is Mediterranean but with fresh & modern interpretations of the food. The food was very well prepared, fresh, exciting flavors and very interesting. 

The service was excellent, the prices were very modest and reasonable. Excellent value for the money. The decor was beautiful but the biggest negative was the noisy room which seems to stay noisy even when the restaurant is not crowded. Otherwise, we really enjoyed our meal.
author: Tina S.

description:
Luv the vibe, super friendly service by Valen.
I wish more places where this friendly in the city.

Try Four Point Kolch.
author: Peter G.

description:
Terrific food. Great ambiance. Stellar service. The servers were so personable and really took time to make recommendations based on our preferences. Wonderful signature drinks! I went with my daughter and her boyfriend. Not many places appeal to 2 generations the way The Fly Trap does. We all loved it! Oh and free street parking at 2nd and Folsom was very easy to find at dinner time which was a bonus.

- - - - - - - - -One tip for The Fly Trap management responsible for your yelp presence ...... CHANGE YOUR PROFILE PHOTO! Before you click on it, in close-up whatever that food item is looks like the eyes of a sweaty, nasty, oily fly. That photo is unappetizing for a restaurant of any kind, especially one as good as yours! Evokes that image because "Fly" is in your name. 

(I'm not even going to ask how you chose the name!)

So in summary:
Don't look at the horrible profile photo.
Do go there and eat their outstanding food served by lovely people in a great atmosphere.
author: Mindy M.

description:
This place is very near our work And there are a few on our team, myself included, who like to hang out here. 

Last night we ordered the burger cooked medium. What we got was burned on the outside and rare on the inside. 

If you order food , it can be good but the quality to price ratio rarely meet.
author: Scott H.

description:
WAS IT CROWDED?
Reservation was needed on a Tuesday night for a large group, but I saw plenty of open tables for smaller groups when we sat down.

AMBIANCE
Dim lights with some Mediterranean flair. Restaurant was really loud despite the fact that there was no rowdy crowd. Shouting was almost necessary with a group of more than 4.

SERVICE
Friendly and fast. We had a reservation for 8 people...but another 7 decided to join us last minute!! They were nice enough to move a group of people they knew to a smaller table to accommodate the extra people who decided to tag along with us from happy hour. 

SPEED
Appetizers and drinks came out really quickly but the entrees took a good 30 minutes to hit our table. 

THE GOOD FOOD
- Beef Cheek was AMAZING. Meat was so tender it fell apart without a knife and melted in my mouth like butterrrr. The mash on the side was perfect. Pickled cauliflower that came with the dish was a little too acidic for my taste.
- Pistachio Meatballs - This was a crowd favorite! Didn't really taste the pistachio though. 
- Trio of hummus - The roasted squash hummus was by far my favorite. Wish I could have had my own bowl of it!

THE BAD FOOD
- Roasted eggplant - Tasted like lukewarm baba ganoush. Not my favorite. I think it needed more texture.
author: Catherine C.

description: We had dinner and drinks at the Fly Trap this past week.  Great food and the waitstaff was outstanding!
author: Bruce Y.

description:
The drinks/cocktails were amazing!. We might just go there again for them.
The food was on  expensive side. The food was good. It wasn't something that blew our mind hence i would rate 4/5.
author: Tejal D.

description:
To echo what most Yelpers have said (aside from the dubious 5-star reviews from people who've written a total of 2 reviews): the ambiance is lovely, but the food is mediocre. It's supposed to be Persian fare, but it's more along the lines of American-Mediterranean-fancypants-fusion (if you don't know what that is, I don't, either!!). The dim lights and beautiful wallpaper make for a lovely dining experience, although perhaps you need to know what to order?

FYI - don't call the menu a menu; it's a "bill of fare." And despite the fact that this place only recently became a Mediterranean restaurant, they like to advertise that it was "established" in the 1800s - when the menu was entirely steak, beef burgers and eggs (which are no longer options, sorry!) Also, it's not in it's original location. Also, at one point it was an Italian Restaurant. Also, it's nothing like the place it used to be. In any case, we think they're a little confused. 

We started with the beet salad: greens, beets, butternut squash, kale, pumpkin seeds, goat cheese, balsamic dressing. It was good and had I stuck only to this for the main course I would've been happy (though hungry!). For "beginnings" (they don't serve appetizers, those are for plebeians) we had charmoula - smoked eggplant puree, walnuts, yogurt & turmeric cream on a slice of sourdough bread. Interesting combination of flavors; something like a baba ganoush sandwich, only it was mostly bread. We also tried the halibut, served with pomegranate, fava beans, kohlrabi, cashews, & fruit salsa. This dish was a disaster. The halibut was dry & chewy despite the strip of salsa on top, and totally lacked flavor.

Neither of us could eat it and both left craving a burrito.
author: Ray J.

description:
* 4.5 stars * 

I love having long dinners with one of my best girlfriends Z, she and I talk constantly about our favorite topic! 

Boys.

Due to scheduling/being sick/vacations/blah,blah,blah,  we haven't seen each other in half a year.  We made sure to go to a place that's sexy enough for our one on one time.

Zare fits the bill: bold colors, matched with neutrals and wood, a hard to ignore pressed tin ceiling and walls papered with world maps. The design aesthetic pleases the eye and sets you up for a relaxing and romantic time.  The bar area alongside the main dining room can get a bit noisy, but not rambunctious, so ask for the dining area towards the back. 

Their cocktails held some interesting combination of ingredients and were divided into those with Mediterranean flare and classic drinks.  The Cardamom My Dearest with gin, cardamom syrup and lime juice, would be the perfect floral drink for people who also love sweet cocktails, but the too much syrup overpowered the gin. I need to taste the nuances of my gin too!

On the other hand, the Blonde Manhattan was a knockout!  My girlfriend took a sip of it, looked at me ridiculously and commented, "you like old man drinks!"  If by old man, you mean, liking moonshine and cocchi together, why I guess I do like old man drinks!  ;-)

Zare's cuisine concentrates on Mediterranean and Persian flavors. Our meal presented our palettes with a mish mash of alluring tastes: smoked trout with shaved cucumber topped with tobiko and dill, a mushroom cake with kohlrabi, pesto and green harissa; arctic char with freekeh, parsley root, lebni and diver scallops with asparagus and prosciutto. The only disappointment were the fried donuts with cinnamon coffee -- a very run of the mill donut holes that I could've gotten from down the street. It was not worth the $9 price.

Service was flawless and friendly -- just wonderful! I wish I got her name!

Pick Zare for your next date night or rendezvous with that special friend, it'll take you into far away land full of exotic adventures.
author: Janice C.

description:
I'd heard great things about this spot and it was nice to finally try it out:

Pistachio Meatballs 
Hummus three ways
Beef Cheeks
Mai Tai Cocktail
Goat Cheesecake

Everything I had was fantastic.  Great, quality food, full of flavor and friendly yet attentive service.  Each dish was familiar to traditional Middle Eastern cuisine, but with a nice, modern twist.  

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great experience!
author: Ken G.

description: Cantanella salad was excellent!  Arugula eith fresh beets, crispy brussel sprouts-WONDERFUL!!!!!!
author: Ajay R.

description:
Very rarely do I leave a restaurant already wanting to go back! this place was absolutely amazing. From the sweet server, the warm greeting of Chef Hoss to the delectable food, everything was just on point! 

Order the Pistachio Meatballs! As a Persian girl with a huge appetite, this was something that really was fantastic and it had a unique twist in flavor from the one most Persians make. 

The trout salad and beet salad were good; I really love the trout salad though.

The lamb burger was delicious as was the beef cheek and the braised ribs. I tried a bit of the chicken and wasn't really that excited about it. 

Finally, the chocolate flourless tart was to die! 

I would recommend this place for a date, with friends or family or even for happy hour!
author: Yas G.

description: After Zare has left, this place is not the same. Food quality and taste has gone down significantly. Such a pity...
author: Peyman K.

description: Don't let the name deter you. This great food! Friendly staff too. We've been there a couple times and have always enjoyed it. It is on Folsom near the Financial District, so it is a good spot for a weekend dinner with less crowds. Brussels sprouts are yummy.
author: Gretchen L.

description:
This place was amazing, everything about it -- the service, atmosphere, and food!

The restaurant itself isn't super big, there's a decent sized bar, and then a bunch of tables around it. However, I thought the decor was really nice -- felt like a cafe you might see in Paris. Or something like that...

Service was awesome. We had a couple different servers throughout the meal, so I'm really not sure who our *actual* server was, but they were all very friendly. The one who took our order knew the menu extremely well, and provided recommendations based on the way each dish was prepared. They came and wiped off our table between courses, which was a nice touch. They were also VERY accommodating to special dietary requests. At the end of the meal, the chef came out and chatted us up. Definitely one of the best experiences I've had in a long time in regards to service. 

The menu was a perfect size -- about 5 or 6 apps, and the same amount of entrees. We got the bone marrow (first time I've tried it) -- amazing! For dinner, I had the lamb sirloin -- also amazing, and cooked perfectly!

I can't say enough good things about this place. Definitely try it out! You won't be sorry.
author: Derrick S.

description:
I was happy that I got a reservation on the same day and when I arrived the table was ready for us and the hostess was very friendly and accommodating. 

I ordered the abghoost which was loaded with flavor and amazingly tender meat. Unfortunately the chickpeas and green beans were not cooked fully and on the firm side but still edible.

I ordered the steak kabob for my daughter because it looked like it was the most simple dish (she's 4). I cut it up for her and she tried it and said it tasted burnt. I didn't believe her and kept telling her to eat her dinner. Finally I tried it and the outer layer had such a bad char/burnt flavor it was inedible. I told the waitress and she said the dish is like that bc of the sumac and didn't offer any replacement or discount. Sadly we couldn't eat it and we normally love sumac especially my daughter so I don't think it was that. 

My cousins risotto was not fully cooked either. And my sisters salmon was on the fishy side.

My mom and aunt liked their chicken dish. 

Ambience: loud, conversational and good for kids because they don't need to be super quiet but unfortunately no changing table in restroom.
author: Zeba E.

description:
This place is great! I loved the decoration. It's like an old English gentleman's quarters. 
The food is great (I got the stacked lamb, or something like that, and oddly the best part of my dish were the caramelized carrots!! I loved them!!! I was amazed of how good carrots can taste!)

Besides carrots, the food is good overall. Our waitress was awesome, she was lovely, thoughtful and made great recommendations.

I wouldn't recommend the Sherry. I order the "Gitana" and got really disappointing, it tasted like alcohol strait from the first aid kit! 

The goat cheesecake is also very good. Even if you are not a fan of goat cheese, it doesn't have a strong "gouty" flavor.

As they open til late, it's a great place to grab a late dinner after a ybca performance.
author: Maggie J.

description: Tried this on a quiet, rainy Saturday.  Nice relaxed atmosphere, service at the bar was excellent.  Steak appetizer as delicious and proportioned well, nice mix of herbs.  Special butter lettuce salad was very good.  Good wine selection.  All going well to this point.  Our entree - salmon special was bad.  Poor cut (end cut near tail) and seemed marginal relative to being out of date.  Fish was overly spiced and oiled as if to mask poor quality fish.  Unfortunate.
author: Glenn S.

description:
Loved it!  The waiter was especially helpful and really knowledgeable about the dishes.  I had questions about things because I'm gluten free.  He was honest and forthright, trying to get what was best for my diet instead of the check...appreciated!
I had a really nice salad with roasted veggies and we shared some pretty awesome calamari with a delicate filling-actually some of the best calamari I've had in the states.  It wasn't breaded and deep fried like most of the calamari you find here.  It was done the right way...highly recommended!
The atmosphere here is also very cool.  Relaxed and bistro/grille like.  Nice garden views too.  We'll be back!
author: Diana W.

description:
Cool spot to grab an old-fashioned and soak in some classy atmosphere. They know how to do classics right. 

It can get packed during peak hours (no kidding), but later on in the evening there's plenty of room to stretch out and lesuirely enjoy a cocktail.
author: Anthony A.

description:
Pistachio Meatballs - Just a tad bit dry but the sauce helps.  Other than that, it was pretty good.  The pomegranates were a surprising element.

Crispy Saffron Risotto - Still creamy.  The mushrooms were delicious.

Baklava - I'm not really crazy about baklava but Zare's was really good.
author: Rose A.

description: Amazing service from beginning to end, our server was beyond helpful and attentive, the recommendations were wonderful. The rack of lamb we shared perfection.
author: Su B.

description:
Service- check! we made reservations, the service was great, they knew every little thing on the menu and described it perfectly so we knew what we were getting.

We ordered this huge meatball the size of a huge grapefruit stuffed with yummy surprises. 
The pistachio Meatballs are amazing as well! 
Even the way they toast their bread is delicious.
The flavors were just divine and they take great pride to display the food just perfectly. 

The atmosphere is dark, chill, relaxed, and classy.

We didn't order drink but they seemed to have nice alcohol selection.
author: Stefanie F.

description: I've always been loved the food at Fly Trap, although as a Persian, nothing on the menu resembles anything Iranian, but regardless the food and service are generally on point. After last night, I will never return there and go out of my way to make sure no one I know does. The service provided by Nina was atrocious, discriminatory, and I think she may have been under the influence. We ordered 6 appetizers, 1 of which she forget to bring and had to be reminded to remove from the bill, which took almost two-hours to be served. Multiple tables sat after us and left before us ordering the same dishes we did and being served ahead of us. Once we kindly reminded Nina and asked her about out hummus, which alone took 45 minutes to be served, she got snippy, short and inattentive going forward. All four of us have worked in the service industry, mistakes happen, you apologize with a smile, and move on, but not once did Nina apologize or care to change her tone. Needless to say her tip was nonexistent. Next time any of you go by, make sure to avoid being seated in her section, unless you want to be treated like a second class citizen.
author: Sawandy S.

description: There are nights when the stars, dollar signs, service, drinks and food all align to create the perfect evening. Then there are nights when the planets and service are both in retrograde, the food is barely ok, and the drinks are hit and miss. Last night at Fly Trap was one of the latter. First, the service - we arrived on a Saturday night around 7:30pm (with a reservation) and about one third of the tables were taken. We were seated and waited, and waited, and waited. Ok, three "waiteds" is about 6 - 8 minutes but when our wait was over and the server came to the table it was straight to "do you know what you want for dinner?" Hmmm, how about asking us how we are doing and asking us if we'd like a drink? So, we order dinner and drinks and, if the service was the first miss, then the drinks were a hit/miss and the food was mostly a huge miss. Starting with the appetizers - we tried the burrata plate, the avocado salad, and the brussel sprouts. The good - the brussel sprouts were a bit too chard, but good, the burrata (with asparagus and italian ham) was delicious. Not so good - the AVOCADO salad had a quarter of an avocado and greens poorly, if at all, seasoned, the aioli that came with the brussel sprouts had no taste at all (bland mayo, emphasis on the bland). Hit and Miss Drinks - Manhattan looked like a glass of pomegranate juice (oh, I mean half a glass of pomegranate juice) = Miss. Glass of Cab Sauv = Hit. AND back to service - a server, not ours, noticed that we didn't get bread with our burrata app (we were almost done with it). Heard the same server tell her table that there was a menu item that they didn't have but that there was a fava bean dish. Our server hadn't mentioned either. Main Courses - Beef Kabob, Rack of Lamb, and Fish and Chips. The only dish that we finished was the Beef Kabob which wasn't difficult, the skewers were very small (at $10, it should be listed as an appetizer). Main comment on the entrees - WHERE is the SALT? Nothing tasted seasoned and there was no salt at the table. Asked for Malt Vinegar for the fish and chips. "We don't have any". WTH? What restaurant doesn't have MV with Fish and Chips on the menu. The fish was heavy, oily even be Fish and Chips standards, and tasteless. The lamb was chewy and tasteless. We left most of both dishes on our plates (asked twice if we wanted boxes . . . no thank you). Folks in other reviews have called this an upscale place, not sure what they are comparing this to but not upscale. I gave it a third star for the guy who refilled our water and asked us if everything was ok - he was nice and cared more about our experience than our own server.
author: Kristen A.

description:
DO NOT COME HERE FOR GROUP PARTIES! 

Their contract was very misleading and the management was not as accommodating. I came here for my friend's birthday. we had a party of 17. I requested certain things such as a menu title, which the restaurant just ignored and did not add on. The wording of the contract was very vague and unclear. However, that's still bearable. 

What wasn't bearable was the attitude the manager that night showed to my friends when they asked about all the extra charges. That is no way to treat your customers who have just spent a large sum of money at your restaurant. I understand there are rules, but the right thing to do is to calmly explain them to your customers and treat them with respect. I can't believe he told us "maybe it's the alcohol." He even told my group that we're lucky to even be eating in the side dining room. Funny thing about that is I specifically requested one long table, but instead they gave us two anyway.

Also! I did tell the manager a week in advance that my party was going to be 18, but when I found out one friend wasn't going to be able to make it, I let him know immediately a couple days in advance. He still charged our party for 18 people. Now did they really start preparing for our party 2 days in advance? I think not! Nowhere in the contract does it state you have to give a confirmed head count and stick to that head count for an entire week. We're not planning a wedding here. Future diners, beware! 

The food was hit or miss. There were a couple of good dishes and some of the other dishes were not so spectacular. Aside from the manager, I really liked our waiter. He was very attentive to our group.
author: Annie Z.

description:
Every dish is a master piece composed of taste, look, and creativity. The chef is an artist who is truly passionate about what he does.
It is a "must go" place!
author: Nazila K.

description: Cute little place. Service was very good. Don't remember her name but she had a foreign accent & was very tall :) food was good. Came out fast and tasted good. We've tried the roasted Brussels sprouts & chicken wings for appetizer &  rack of lamb & salad. All the drinks were well made and had a generous pour. Definitely would like to go back here again.
author: dj g.

description:
I came here with my colleagues for dinner

Great atmosphere and setting for dinner 

Meatball appetizer was fantastic.   
Lamb was cooked perfectly .. And the portion was large. 
Wine list was pretty good too.  Flowers Pinot for $72
author: John R.

description:
One of the most tasteful food and appetizer i ever tried in my entire life. 
Amazing ambient amazing hospitality and also the owner (chef Hoss) is super inspiring and kind. He gives a great hug called Hosshug
Love him and his artistic plates
author: Shell B.

description: It will cost a lot of money, you'll leave hungry, and the food will only be adequate.
author: Lucullus L.

description:
Once upon a time, Zare was a nice northern Italian bistro hidden away on Sacramento in the Financial District. I'm not sure what caused chef Hoss Zare to move his operation into the former Fly Trap deep into SoMa where he switched his menu up and made it more purely Mediterranean. I still haven't tried dinner here, but I did try his lunchtime Grill & Grain menu twice over the last couple of weeks. He describes it as a food truck with no wheels since you order at the bar, and the limited menu offers only soups, wraps and salads. 

Nice try but I have to say the results are underwhelming. Thus far, I've tried the $9 Lamb Wrap and the $10 Sardine Wrap (see photo). I just felt the lavash was too dry and the ingredients a little too competitive with each other, especially the sardine wrap where there is broccoli rabe, anchovies and tomatoes competing mightily with the sardines. The walnuts, however, provided a nice contrasting crunch. I had better luck with the $8 Vegetarian Orzo Salad, which managed to taste fresh thanks to the roasted squash, cauliflower, watercress, and harissa-spiced yogurt (see photo). 

I have to say the bargain of the menu is the $5 Chickpea Salad (see photo). which mixes eggplant, parsley, barberries and hazelnuts with the marinated chickpeas. The consistency had a greater crunch than I expected. Overall, while I find the ingredients interesting like the use of a Persian pickled vegetable called torshi in the lamb wrap, I think the execution needs work to bring me back a third time to the "truck". But I wouldn't dismiss an opportunity to try dinner here either.

FOOD - 3 stars...a Mediterranean "food truck" in a bar hasn't found its groove yet in the wraps, though salads fare better
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...certainly nicer ambiance than a food truck can provide
SERVICE - 3 stars...fast and adequate
TOTAL - 3 stars...think I'll be shopping around some more for lunch
author: Ed U.

description: Love this place. A must whenever in San Francisco. Went with the specials tonight. Pork shank on creamy polenta. The food is always interesting and well-prepared.
author: Jim R.

description:
The door is hilarious. I'm sorry, I had to take a picture of it. "Use the other door." "This is the other door"

I get it!

Anyway

Of the 3 appetizers my friend ordered, I loved the pistachio meatballs the most. 
I think my friend thought they were a little too sweet but I felt the sweetness of the harissa honey and the tart pommegranate were excellent together. Found myself cutting my meatball up and slathering that sauce all over it. 

My friend had the salmon and he said it was good, but I didn't try it.
I had the special of the day which was a pasta dish w/ lamb ragu. 

DELICIOUS.

There was soooo much lamb! I honestly didn't expect THAT much meat. I really enjoyed the English peas as well. 

I'm definitely coming back to have the pistachio meatballs again and to try a few other things on the menu.

I just didn't like how long it took from appetizer to entree, it felt like a good long while.
author: Susy C.

description:
It was my second time eating at The Flytrap and it was just as good as the first time. I was given a warm welcome upon entering and seated. My water was never empty, which is a sign of great customer service. I also didn't feel rushed . But I knew I had  to have the bone marrow appetizer again cause it was amazing! I wanted to try more so I got the scallops and the beet salad. Mmm Mmm Mmm the lamb was on point and the short ribs tender! 
I was so full I couldn't even order dessert
