I would definitely come again. The staff was great! Valen the owner was just the sweetest thing.She came over to check on us and let us try something new. Yummm! It was something vegetarian. And come to find out, Half the menu was vegetarian, literally!!! U won't be disappointed. Bartenders stayed ready during happy hour(Monday thru Friday 3-6)  to pour a drink. So even if u don't try the food, the place is nice and chill for winding down after a long day at work with some friends!
author: Victor N.

description:
Really loved The Fly Trap!  We visited The Fly Trap on our last day in the city and we were so glad we did!  First, the decor and "vibe" of the place is really nice.  All I can say is it was "just right" for us.  We brought our two boys and never felt like we were imposing as there was enough background sound from the bar and other tables to drown out our silliness!  The food was really good!  Everyone but me had the lamb burger, which was amazing.  The lamb was fresh and cooked just as ordered.  It came with a nice salad and a generous portion of the best fries i've eaten in a while...I ordered the rack of lamb, which was also amazing, but next time i'll have the burger!  

All that said, what made our experience so nice was the service.  Truly great service is hard to come by these days but Daniel our server  was exceptional.  Truly, everyone working in the restaurant worked as a team making sure we lacked for nothing.  

Can't wait to go back!
author: William W.

description: Amazing service every time I go. Food is delicious. Desserts are super inventive. Celiac (gluten free) friendly.
author: Esther J.

description: I wanted to like this place but it fell short of expectations. The portions are just toooooo small for the price. I ordered short rib on the bone and literally it was about 8-10 bites. My friend ordered fish and it was about the same size of a filet o fish at McDonald's. Both entrees are$24. Also if your order the appetizer meatballs for $10 you get 2 just slightly larger than a golf ball. The food is just ok and doesn't justify the price. We left totally unsatisfied!
author: Claudia L.

description: I have to give a so-so rating.  I wanted to really like this place.  The decor is fabulous albeit the restaurant is very very loud. The place is warm n welcoming and has a very charming courtyard where people were sitting sipping wine when we arrived.  The menu looked interesting.  We asked our waiter what he recommended - he of course suggested the priciest thing on the menu.  No matter. We ordered the meatball w pistachios in a pomegranate sauce for a first course. The sauce was fantastic but the meatballs were very dry to the point of crumbling.  I had the beef cheek that was described as flavored with cinnamon and my date had the short rib.  My dish had some wonderful accompaniments- pickled cauliflower that were beautifully pink and pureed parsnips that were heavenly but the beef cheek was very bland. It had zero flavor - no hint of cinnamon and was seriously in need of salt. My date's short rib was more flavorful and surprising had a hint of cinnamon or star anise but the bed of black eyed peas n pintos it sat on were not fully cooked, some hard in fact.  I didn't drink and my date had two cocktails.  The bill came to a little over $100.  We gave the waiter a $100 and a $50 in payment and he asked if we needed change.  I'll chock his impertinence up to his young age.  I might go back to sit at the bar and try something from the libation menu but I probably wouldn't go to seek out the food or attempt to have conversation.
author: Suzy Q.

description:
Of all the restaurants that I have been to in SF, The Fly Trap has been the best in every possible way. A lot of it has to do with the fact that the husband & I had a very special date night here and the bar tender on duty made it even more special. Suffice to say, customer service here has been impeccable.
The Fly trap looks like a hole in the wall from the outside, but it has the perfect date night setting on the inside. They usually do reservations for dinner. I did try giving them a call, but since no one answered, we decided to walk in. And while they didn't have tables available, the seating at the bar is just fine. It gives you the opportunity to sample the liquor you are about to consume and switch it up if you don't like it :) Between the husband and I, we tried four of their custom drinks, a take on the usual suspects and walked out rather happily buzzed.
Now onto their menu. The food here Mediterranean for sure, but with a twist. In that, it's not just kebabs and rice and eggplant bademjans. There's also Risotto and Linguine, ergo, the Italian side of the Mediterranean.

We decided to stick to a "light" dinner. Between us, we ordered the Vegetarian kufteh, Pistachio meatballs with pomegranate, two whole plates of the Shishito peppers, Parmesan coated brussel sprouts, eggplant bademjan and the risotto.
We licked our plates clean. Nuff' said.

Price-wise, you are looking to fork out quite a bit of money. But the meal is completely worth it. And you do get a sufficient amount of food. So, the other reviews that complain about the $$ and that this isn't authentic Mediterranean, y'all need to get your facts right.
author: Ranjani S.

description: I hosted a happy hour for my team at The Fly Trap and we had a wonderful experience.  All of the staff were super accommodating and attentive.  We were a really large group but rarely had to wait more than a few minutes for our drinks and the food was excellent.  They have great dishes for sharing.  I will definitely be back and look forward to hosting our next event there!
author: Sara T.

description:
Fabulous food.  We came here with a large group, and everyone got something different and loved what they had.  The meat balls were amazing.  Lamb burger delicious, although it could have used more in the way of toppings.

Our service was great, the beer list covered all the basics.  The menu was simple, but the flavors complex.  Ambience was a little dim for early evening.

Nothing bad to say.
author: Matt R.

description:
Having dined here a few times over the years, I feel sad writing this review.

Alas, if you have the guts to toss your regular menu and charge $100/pp for a Prix Fix menu on Valentine's Day, you should deliver food of an equal caliber. At the very least, treat your guests accordingly. 

I made reservations for Valentine's Day at 9pm. My girlfriend (whom I see only once or twice a month) and I were taken around the corner, past several empty candlelit tables, to the back room of the restaurant, which was cramped, stuffy and loud. This is a first for me here as I have always been seated in the main room.

Our server, Brette, was charming and sweet. But after we ordered, we were quickly forgotten. My second martini (which would have helped me through the extremely overpriced and underwhelming dinner) was also forgotten. 

Here goes:

My crab cake was hardly warm and way too salty. A lifeless clump of cold, raw crab meat was placed next to it. Was this on purpose? My girlfriend's salad was literally a bunch of arugula sprinkled with pomegranate seeds. It looked like a giant Christmas tree and could have probably fed both of us as well as our neighboring table.

My lamb chops were unpleasantly presented and unevenly cooked. They were on the verge of cold. One bite was decent and the next was bland and rubbery. The description read "pistachio crust" but the pistachios were sort of sprinkled over the whole dish. Had I been given the chance to send it back I would have.

(My girlfriend's sea bass was decent but the bed of quinoa was very acidic. I had no idea what was going on.)

What upset me more than the $100/per person Prix Fix excuse for cuisine was that we weren't acknowledged for a half an hour after our main courses came out. What kind of service is that? I saw the chef come out and schmooze with a table next to us while our water glasses were bone dry. 

Michael B. said it best. 
"I, too, hope to forget this meal soon. Not just the meal but the entire experience"

Thankfully, this city has other ways of charming disappointed valentines.
author: Jen K.

description:
I have a weakness for Mediterranean food... Kebabs, grape leaves (traditional dolma), hummus, pita bread, falafel. Well, forget all you know about Mediterranean when you are at Zare! Zare has re-invented and re-defined Mediterranean for me! We started with hummus trio, not your traditional bowl of plain hummus with oil on top - we received nicely plated beat hummus (red), squash (guessing it was squash, green color) and their version of a traditional chickpea (yellow), all of them were very different in consistency from the typical hummus; served with crispy lavash chips... Such a great start! 
Also order meatballs and roasted eggplant, both delicious and I believe every other yelp review talks about them, so... Just order and trust me and a bunch of other Yelpers. 

Now, the mains... Lamb ragu served with warm lavash and some kind of sauce is great and come with an eating instruction: take a piece of lavash, pick up a piece of meat from the plate, dip in the broth, put sauce on top and loose yourself in the explosion of taste! 
Also great is their Mediterranean inspired pasta (vegetarian option is amazing), someone at our table just couldn't stop eating it. Also notable was the boneless short rib served with very delicious spinach and polenta, the meat was just falling apart when touched with the fork. 
Also tried tomato soup, some salad and brussel sprouts with super tasty sauce. 
Dessert - chocolate date cake, rich, nice, but overshadowed by other food served. 
Overall, the food is just out-of-this-world amazing and creative, screaming Mediterranean but unique. 
Service is good, atmosphere too. Full bar and espresso. 
Do come here if you want to try some unique food!
author: Marianna K.

description: Last night was probably the 7th or 8th time I have been to this restaurant. It is unfortunate that the food has just gotten more and more ordinary. It's not that the quality is bad, but this place used to be really Innovative with its Fusion of different Cuisines  (Persian) and items on the menu. It has progressively gotten bland and unimaginative. It really is a true shame that this place has lost its unique touch. Side of Brussel sprouts is huge but our dish was over fried and not very appetizing. Everything else on the menu was just OK. I used to love love love this place, but I don't think I will be back very soon.
author: Niloufar M.

description: Unique ambience as the unique food & drinks.... Being a vegetarian, they gave me plenty of options. Must try brussel sprouts & trio hummus.....will definitely come again...
author: Meera M.

description:
I have definitely been here twice already and have had almost everything on the menu! They are so creative with the tastes and flavors here, I'm always happy to recommend it to coworkers looking for something close to the office and really good

The service here is always top notch and the restaurant ambiance is for the slightly quieter, trendy crowd..that doesn't get too rambunctious even though they have a full bar.

What I've had here:
1. Fall Salad - This salad seems simple, but the flavors together create a really amazing blend of tastes. You kind of feel like the rat from Ratatouille..when he's trying the cheese and grape together..and colors swirl all around..

2. Warmed pears and figs - The portion on this dish is kind of a joke if you're trying to split it, but what they do give you is absolutely nomsilicious.

3. Bone Marrow - This is probably one of the highlights here, the bone marrow isn't too greasy and has the perfect kick paired with the bread. Mmm, so good.

4. Pistachio Meatballs - No, this is not a pistachio stuck to a toothpick and called a meatball. This is probably another one of their "must try" dishes. They only come in three, so order wisely!

5. Tomato Beginning - This is literally a tomato stuffed with a big of yumminess. Great to splitting with two people, but not so much for three. It has a good texture and flavor from the cheese and tuna...this was a close 3rd to items #3 and #4

6. Trio of hummus - I honestly only liked one of the three hummus..but my coworker loveeeed it. She was definitely a fan...especially if you order the fries as an appetizer and eat the hummus with fries. :)

7. Black Cod - the cod here comes w/ a ton of random beans and greens. I liked the way the cod was seared and was happy overall with the dish. Not the best i've had, but definitely far from the worst.

now...DESSERTS:
1. Goat Cheesecake - Still one of my favorites of the night. It was really light and fluffy..and the goat cheese gave it a li

2. Chocolate Pistachio Torte - This was still warm and broke apart easily. On first glance, you'd think it was a dry looking brownie..but when you sink your fork into the torte, you know its going to be decadent. :)

3. Baklava - This was a slightly deconstructed baklava that was perfectly crisps and sweet..mmm, this was the waitresses favorite and may have been my 2nd favorite!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Good food, lively bar all at a reasonable price. The atmosphere is lively but chill place...great spot to grab drinks or dinner if you are in downtown.
I loved their crispy brussels side dish, the portion was also big, so great for sharing. Their pan roasted cod was good as well. Light and crispy outside and super tender and done more on medium rare side. 
Only thing I didn't like was their dessert: faloodeh. It was okay...needed to have an ice cream or something to add to the noodles.
author: Nancy Z.

description:
The food was good, but not mind blowing. A few of us ordered the lamb shank and both my friend and I had to send ours back. I asked for medium, she asked for medium rare, but both of ours were alive and kicking, blood and all. It took forever to come back and we enjoyed it once it did. My boyfriend had the beef cheek which he loved, but oddly his mashed potatoes were really sweet. It's fooling the eye a bit because these were not sweet potatoes, but plain potatoes. Our table also ordered sides of brussel sprouts and french fries. These were not sides my friends, but almost near platter size. It was an insane amount of food and pretty wasteful. The brussel spouts were overly charred and had a deep fried oily taste, but it's yogurt aioli was good and cooled it a bit. The french fries were easily delicious.  Get the dessert with the watermelon and rice noodles. It was unique and delicious! 

All in all it was nice for my mom's birthday and could be a good happy hour, but I wouldn't go regularly
author: Victoria B.

description:
What an amazing experience.  Delicious food and amazing staff.  It was my gf bday n she's been a long time fan of chef Hossein Zare and been following him on Instagram n admiring his cuisine arts.  We've been trying to go for some time n finally tonight, the night of her bday, I got to surprise her.  
The food was absolutely amazing.  We had the opportunity to try so many new things, and everything was just delicious.  The meatballs, ab goosht, short ribs, salad, pickled grapes and the cucumber yogurt desert.  Everything unique, flavorful n tasty.  The staff were super nice and attentive.  We also had the great pleasure of meeting the chef himself!  Great guy.  We'll be back!
author: Shayan T.

description:
The service here is like the eternally pleasant spouse you dream about coming home to....so calm, pleasant, friendly and attentive. Five stars for that. 

The food was good--not mind-blowing but solid and, like the service, dependable.

Cardamom My Dearest: Tasty cocktail with my favorite spice. Get

Pistachio Meatballs: Way too dry and tasteless, which was surprising considering all of the oil that was used

Housemade Pink Peppercorn Pasta: Delicious. The pasta was chewy, the sauce was creamy and delicious, and the crispness of the accompanying vegetables was the perfect complement

Braised Eggplant: My friend made a meal out of two appetizers and this was one of them. It was quite tasty, and I normally don't care for eggplant

Salad of Asparagus: Incredibly fresh, tasty and healthy. I loved the bite my friend gave me to try and seriously thought about asking for another
author: Josephine L.

description:
I have had lots of persian and middle easter food. But not much fusion of those foods.
The Rack of Lamb is sinfully good. You probably want to share it with someone if you are dieting. To me the soul of the food is the sauce. This dish has got soul. The Cod is also not light, but you get a very light and healthy quinoa to balance it with. The service was great. They remembered it wa our anniversary.
author: Arash Z.

description: The happy hour bar tender during the week is incredible. She's always super friendly and helpful without being pushy. She always remembers my drink order and today did something that compelled me to write a review. I ordered the fries and ate all the saffron aoli. Without even asking she brought me more. This is highly rare in a restaurant and even more so in SF where servers are anxious to upsell the extra sauce. So so soooo appreciated. I would have eaten the rest of the fries sauceless and quietly died on the inside. She's incredible and her drinks are delicious. I'm coming back any chance I get.
author: Taster B.

description: I highly recommend this place. This place is amazing. The staff was very friendly and professional. I ordered a lam burger and it was so tasty and atmosphere is really cool. The prices are very reasonable. he owner was very polite and friendly.
author: Benito C.

description: We started with the hummus sampler and the fig and prosciutto bruschetta and both were quite tasty. I had the salmon for my main and it came with cucumbers and tomatoes and it was all very light and fresh. We also shared the Brussels sprouts which were flash fried and delicious. The service was very attentive and helpful too.
author: Debra R.

description:
Came here for an early birthday celebration dinner tonight. I don't know how busy it gets here on the weekend, assuming yes, but even on a weekday at 8:30pm, it was extremely packed. In other words, make a reservation. 
This restaurant had a delightful ambiance. Lights were dimmed and definitely, if you're here during happy hour time, it gets pretty loud. 

Anyways, we decided to get seated outside in the corner. The lighting outside gets prettier when it gets kinda dark. Unfortunately, I think the waitresses forgot about us for a good 15 minutes until we had to signal them via the windows lol 

For food, I ordered - along w a glass of wine of course, the Lebanon 2012:
1. Pistachio Meatballs (so good. You can def. taste the citrus flavor of it) 
2. Pan Roasted Cod (eh...mainly because I think the quinoa wasn't fully cooked...??) 
3. Didn't have much of an appetite for desserts which I was kinda bummed out about. Guess that's a reason to come back :) 

I'd say for my first time, I enjoyed it. Great staff, prompt service, good food, good company, nice weather. 

PS. Parking can be a pain in the butt. You can do street parking/parking garage.
author: Bup N.

description:
Here are my reasons why The Fly Trap earned a 5 Star Review:
1. Food - not your typical meat and potatoes. This place has a lot of interesting selections that are cooked to perfection. We started off with the Braised Lamb Tongue (hella delicious), my beautiful wife had the Grilled NY Steak with this butter bone marrow on top, and I went with the seared Sea Bass. All came out great!
2. Drinks - my wife had their Dirty Martini that was accompanied with a variety of pickled goodness (grape, almond, cauliflower, olive and pickle). I had the Remy VSOP straight up. (Strong pour!)
3. Ambiance - very clean look, lighting was not too dark, but not too bright. Restrooms were very clean.
4. Service - our server Gabriel was AWESOME! Very informative, attentive and gave good insight. Took the time to get to know us and our pallet so he could provide helpful suggestions. 
All in all, first class all the way through! This was the PERFECT meal to end 2014. We'll definitely be going back soon.
Cheers!
author: Adrian D.

description:
Here for the BF's B-Day dinner & definitely treated to a delish meal

Pisco Sours were sweet yet tart & the egg white was so foamy & goooood!  Too bad no one ever came back around to see if we wanted more.....'cause we DID

Starters included Mushroom Soups all around the table & omg was this delightful!  Shrooms all pureed up - no cream action going on around here.  This was a vegan soup that let the shrooms do all the talking.... the almond bits-garnish included in the soup provided a little bite of crunchy yet chewiness.  I would have stuck my whole face in this bowl to lick up every last drop if I could have

Sis chose the Little Gems salad w/ homemade yogurt cheese, in a balsamic glaze - constant comments around how creamy the cheese was & crunchy the lettuce was - huge fan!

Buddy #1 chose the Chicken & I forget what it was paired with & their online menu is from last season so can't jog the old memory.....but she definitely liked it & said the chicken was really tender

BF & I chose the Crispy Polenta w/ Trumpets & Collard Greens in an Avocado Puree.  I asked if it was possible to eliminate the collards but add more mushrooms & my wish was granted - WOW was it good!  The polenta blocks were crispy as all get out on the outside but super-creamy & smooth on the inside & when paired w/ those shrooms - we're talking heaven!  BF said he liked the collards but wished there had been less of an abundance

Too full for dessert & knowing we had an ice cream cake from Mitchell's waiting for us when we got back home, we passed but so totally want to come back & try that Goat Cheese Cheesecake.....next time my pretties!
author: Adrienne G.

description: Lamp chops were perfect. The quality of the lamb meat was high. Very tender. The carrots and small potatoes pulled the whole dish together. Also had the rani broccoli. Liked the spice added to the dish.
author: Ilene S.

description:
Salad was very good, the two main dishes were not good.
We ordered the linguini pasta with salmon special and the chicken Jerusalem.  They both used the same cream sauce which turned to paste after a few minutes.  The artichokes in the Jerusalem were undercooked and inedible...  I won't be going back.
author: David B.

description: Awesome menu! Persian good with an elegant twist! Only reason I can't give 5 stars is that the desserts tend to be a bit off.
author: F S.

description:
So.. to be fair, we booked for Valentines Day with expectations of not being ripped off for a Prix Fix menu.  Boy, we were wrong.  $400 for 3 people (2 adults, only one cocktail but we did have medium price bottle of wine).  Apps were the best part.  Main course was nothing to remember, deserts were ok. But $400 for a meal I can't remember?  
 
Rating is based on meal (good - not fantastic),  Service (very good), Atomospher/Ambiance (very good), Libations (Interesting but misleading), Value (lousy).  

I hope to forget about this place soon.
author: Michael B.

description:
Eek, it was a bit disappointing here.  The dishes are beautiful and unique, but tastewise, it just wasn't there.  I think we only ate half the amount that we ordered, and we got a lot of food, including the trio of hummus, roasted eggplant, pistachio meatballs, flat iron steak kebab and bone marrow.  I'd say my fave was the steak kebab.

The service was superb, however, and the space is nice!
author: Lili K.

description:
Scrambling to find a place to host a birthday party for a large-ish group on a busy Friday night? Look no further. Zaré was the perfect venue for my group of ten friends. It's easy to find parking in FiDi after 6pm and the restaurant was very accommodating to our needs even though we were making a reservation the day before the event. Now that's what I call customer service done right.

We started off with the plate of three pistachio meatballs glazed with a honey and pomegranate sauce. Crunchy on the outside with the chopped pistachio topping; tender and moist on the inside - these were a real treat to the taste buds. I don't think I could ever tire of eating these meatballs, although at $3/meatball, my wallet certainly would. For those who are looking for a cheaper appetizer that had bigger portions, I recommend the french fries served with saffron aioli. I know, I know. Fries? At a fancy restaurant?! What are you thinking? But trust a self-proclaimed fry expert on this: the fries were seasoned well with a perfect blend of spices that would make anyone salivate just thinking about them.

I highly recommend any of the lamb dishes, even the Zaré lamb burger. I ordered the braised lamb ragu (abgoosht is just a fancier word for a meat stew), and it came with a side of lavash and pickled vegetables. Our waiter gave us some helpful recommendations for eating the lavash and lamb together, and I truly had a great experience here. Try the goat cheesecake for its novelty, but honestly, don't expect it to be anything too special besides the strange goat-esque aftertaste.

Verdict: pretty pricy fare, but a very nice way to celebrate any special occasion.
author: Maggie W.

description:
Food was good but not exceptional. Service was phenomenal. 

For appetizers we had the vegetable kufteh. I can't believe we paid $13 for that - it was 3 tiny pieces of a semi-fried falafel kinda dish. There were some sauces on the plate that were interesting. Still - nothing extraordinary. 

For the main course, I had the grilled salmon. Once again, was not too happy with the seasonings. The salmon felt a tad overdone. The couscous on the plate stood out - was delicious. 

I'd go here for the service but look elsewhere for the food.
author: Partha S.

description: Came here for Valentine's Day with a group. +1 for accepting group reservations a bit last minute, which I know is hard in SF. We were only able to try their prix fixe menu which was wildly over priced for the holiday. Everyone did find their meals good though, and I loved the qual as well as the goat cheese cheesecake for dessert! Service was also great. We paid about $130 a person for 3 course menu and 1 glass of wine each.
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place has some good food. The sauces are outstanding for the few meals we had--meatballs and scallops. Also great desserts. The goat cheese cheesecake was excellent. I wish they would have had Persian rice, but I recognize that is hard to make correctly. But they should try.
author: Kristopher W.

description: Amazing meal. Lots of great new stuff on the menu. We had the Day Boat Scallops appetizer, grilled tiger prawns & rack of lamb. Finished  with the warm date cake with caramel sauce--all delicious.
author: Mark E.

description: Absolutely amazing. The chef here is an artist. The service is excellent, the location is convenient and the ambience is lovely. One of the best restaurants in San Fran.
author: Me G.

description: This place doesn't even have 1 Persian dish. It's got traces of Mediterranean food but it's not Persian as they advertise it. It's a nice restaurant but the food isn't great. It's average at best.
author: Fred F.

description:
Great service, fantastic drinks and delicious.  The restaurant was smaller than we were expecting, but this was a great thing. A nice quaint atmosphere perfect for conversation among friends.

If you only order one thing here, make sure you get the brussels sprouts with tartar and parmesan. I know it sounds like an odd combo, but trust me, it's so good it's making my mouth water as I type up this review. Order. It. Now.
author: Trevin C.

description: Amazing service, excellent choice of drinks and delicious food in a cozy and elegant environment.
author: Creme B.

description: I love this place! Aside from the Persian influenced dishes, which obviously appeal to me, I love the ambiance. It has a French bohemian vibe which I like very much. The service is professional and un-rushed. Our waitress was there when we needed her and was not when we didn't. That is an art in itself. The food is simply delicious. I was a little hesitant about a Persian fusion menu but I was pleasantly surprised. Chef Zare does a masterful job of using his heritage in building modern and elevated dishes. I can't wait to go back.
author: Reza E.

description:
.......friends from various places around the world with varied food sophistication descend on my Hubby and I exclaiming "We are hungry.  Show us one of those eateries that you brag about."  And so a night to remember began with high expectations and, of course, no plan.

Where to go?  Soma is blessed with a few great places to eat but I'm glad we decided on the Fly Trap.  We arrived and were greeted by a friendly host and shown to our table.  We ordered a round and before the drinks arrived, Hass, chef and owner, made his way over to our table and immediately made an impression that lasted the entire night.....if you leave your decisions to him, you won't be bored or disappointed.

Don't miss this place.
author: Terrance A.

description:
Came here with high expectations and left absolutely disappointed! 

Ambience: Perfect.
Pistachio Meatballs: Flavorful and Tasty

Braised Lamb "Abgoosht: "Far from a real Abgoosht!" it was basically a lamb shank  in a tasteless watery tomato sauce with some undercooked green beens! 

Poached Apple: Aside from the beautifull look, the dessert was horrible. the apple was frozen and watery topped with icy iicecream
author: Evergreen1331 F.

description: Been here couple of times. Really enjoy the interior design and the creativity of the food. I heard they also get creative with cocktail as well. They also open late which works with our schedule. Good food later at night.
author: Saleh R.

description:
482 reviews at the time of this one.  Doesn't give me hope that I can contribute anything new, but I can just add my experience to the catalog of success that this restaurant is.

It's featured in a numerous guidebooks as a great place for crafted food, and I was not disappointed.  I felt very lucky to get a reservation on just a couple hours notice on a Saturday night, and sat down to the essentially candle-lit ambiance that Zare is.  Local/seasonal menu with handcrafted cocktails, great art and design, excellent service.  Everyone raves about the meatballs so I of course had to have that, but I also relished the opportunity to order goat, an underappreciated protein, in a format other than as part of a curry.

Great experience, reasonably priced.  

PS  For those of us who don't live here, it was interesting to see the light glow of iPads at various tables around of us.  If people weren't being pitched on investments, they were being shown how to use a loved app.  Interesting.

PPS  Minutes' walk from BART.
author: Stephen H.

description:
I give them well deserved 4 stars :) the saLad and appetizer were so tasty. We ordered roasted eggplant for appetizer and OMG, rich taste and cute appearance :) we also ordered blood orange salad which was the tastiest salad ever. For our drinks we ordered pomegranate Daiquiri and minted memory and they were so so so great specially the one decorated with mint and cucumber :) 
We did not like our main courses that much which were the lamb burger (too smelly for me) and a mix of seafoods ( I don't remember the name). I would recommend this place for their amazing drinks, salad s and appetizers!!
author: Sara K.

description:
What wonderful service! Helpful, funny and sassy wrapped into one.

I was excited for Mediterranean on this particular evening, but Zare was so much more than I bargained for. It is an exotic blend of Mediterranean and Persian. Not exactly sure what makes food one over the other, but the mixture sure did work.

We started off with an app that was an earthly medley of goodness. Shaped like a ball and accompanied by an avocado concoction, it was the perfect opening act. I ordered two more apps as my entree (pistachio meatballs and lamb sausage...what? I was feeling meaty!). The pistachio meatballs were divine and soaked in a pomegranate dressing that was extremely rich, and delicious! The texture of the lamb was too much like sausage to me, so I didn't eat a lot of it, but the taste was spicy and flavorful. No room for dessert, but they looked playful and full of sin! My sister did order one of their specialty cocktails and she loved every sip.

Wouldn't have found this bad boy on my own, so a big shout out to Yelp for being so yelpy!
author: Katie B.

description: Spent 10 days in San Francisco for Dreamforce and personal travel. Stumbled upon the Flytrap with a coworker and couldn't stay away. The bone marrow is splendid; the beef cheek and mashed potatoes are life changing; the poached Apple is "banging".  The service was phenomenal and I will miss visiting regularly as they were so welcoming and awesome! Till next year my friends!
author: Gloria P.

description:
I have been to Fly trap a few times alone and usually sit at the bar area. Bar tender is excellent and friendly and makes you feel at home.  This time I was able to take my wife and we decided to eat at the bar.
We had the humus and calamari for starters and we both had the short ribs. Amazing food. The pomegranate drink was very good. This place is a bit outside of the restaurant row near union square but worth the Uber ride. Ambience is warm and inviting.
author: Cordero F.

description:
The food was awesome here!  I was first exposed to this place since my friend worked around the corner.  I came here for Happy Hour previously, but decided to come for dinner last week.  Quick tip: The FRENCH FRIES are amazing!  It's no joke - they are super crunchy on the outside and delicious on the inside.  You need to get their special aioli dipping sauce and a side of ketchup.  With a beer, you'll seriously be in heaven eating their fries.

The restaurant is quite dimly-lit, which gives it a classy feel.  I ordered the Lamb Stew, which was amazing...  And I love stew!  The manager came to the table himself to deliver the plate, and advise me on the different methods to eat it.

Overall, great experience for both Happy Hour and for dinner, so I'm going to have to give this place a 5 star rating.  :)
author: Andrew H.

description:
Delicious food, in a very nice place. Everybody is really kind there.
It is a must go restaurant.
The wine list is ok, but has room for improvement.
author: Jose Geraldo V.

description: Mixed emotions. Really cute atmosphere, pretty good food, and pleasant service.. Why don't I love this place? Maybe it's the slightly limited menu.. I would definitely come back for a cocktail.
author: Anna S.

description: Food here is fairly good, but I think the prices are a tad high and that's why I went with 3 and not 4 stars. I also tried to come back here for a second meal and they were randomly closed (to be fair it was holiday party season so that's probably why). I don't remember too much from my meal here but I shared a few dishes with a friend and then moved to the bar for some after dinner drinks. The cocktails here are great, well made and I would come back for them. Pistachio meatballs were probably a 3/5, pretty good but not the best meatballs I've had by any measure. The honey and pomegranate combined to make them a little too sweet for me, and I normally am a fan of sweet and savory dishes. I did enjoy the bone marrow and would come back to order that again, along with maybe another appetizer and their cocktails. My entree was not too memorable (I actually don't remember what I got) and I would probably skip the entrees next time. I will perhaps write a more detailed review if I come back here but the jist is stick to the cocktails and appetizers and probably skip the entrees.
author: Seema U.

description:
Fantastic food... I've been here half a dozen times and it never fails to impress. Great pairings with the wine list, wonderful appetizers and desserts. You won't be disappointed! 

Plan at least 1.5-2.0 hours for your meal and enjoy the experience.
author: Ben P.

description: The food was amazing, the wine list is good.  The service was fantastic.  Would definitely return.
author: Cari N.

description: Absolutely phenomenal experience! My friend and I sat at the bar for 4 hours laughing and eating and enjoying every minute of our experience at The fly Trap! The bartender was friendly, knowledgable, prompt, and offered suggestions. I have Celiacs Disease and therefore have to ask questions about gluten. The bartender and chef were extremely thorough, knowledgable & accommodating. We literally ate half the menu and enjoyed everything we had. Drinks, appetizers, salads, sides, & entrees were all tasty, creative & unique. On top of the great food we enjoyed, we also had amazing service. If I'm ever in San Fran again, I'm definitely going back and I'm going to tell all my clients to go to The Fly Trap when they are there as well!
author: Jenn M.

description:
What a wonderful place. The menu was so interesting we asked the server to chose and surprise us. A terrific meal - every dish was different, flavorful, and a real treat. We had the flat iron steak appetizer, short rib entre, and the Kufteh Tabrizzi which I would recommend everyone try.

Will look forward to returning, very comfortable room with a low enough noise level to enjoy conversion with your dinner partner. 

Thanks for the great evening out!
author: Ken K.

description: I came into town for a conference and my friends recommended for all of us to go come check this restaurant out I being Iranian myself was very surprised by the type of food on the menu we ordered the pistachio chicken meatballs and eggplant dip as appetizers. For dinner had the lamb burger which was flavorful and not games and for dessert we had this traditional Persian ice ice cream or faloodeh which was sour and sweet. Really cool ambiance and vibe. I wise we had one here In LA!
author: Ben P.

description:
Fly Trap is an intimate yet casual dinner spot with unique California-Mediterranean food. You can bring a date here, or a gaggle of friends. I came with 4 other friends on a Friday night and we were seated almost immediately, but the restaurant was pretty full otherwise.

- Pistachio Meatballs ($14): Three meatballs, topped with pomegranate seeds and honey. I'm a big sucker for savory-sweet, so this was all my jam. I'm not a big meatball person, nor am I that fond of pistachios, but this combination coated with the sweet sauces was a thoughtful balance of Mediterranean flavors, cooked in a California method.

- Bone Marrow ($15): The actual bone and bread was kind of whatever compared to other places (a bit too oily/fatty), but whatever seasonal jam on that plate was amazing. I'm pretty sure it was apple jam. The sweet flavor cut through the heavy fat, and now I am 100% convinced that fruit is the best thing to have with bone marrow.

- Cinnamon Braised Beef Cheek ($28): Beef cheek is a new discovery of mine, and like anywhere else, Fly Trap's beef cheek is a tender delightful lump of meat with the texture of pulled pork. The spice from the cinnamon added a great earthy base, and the mashed potato-esque pile on the side is actually mashed pears (I'm pretty sure it's pears. Definitely not potatoes).

I've never had food prepared quite like this before - it's innovative yet simple enough that you recognize all the ingredients. Love the thought and attention that goes into each dish!
author: Jessica F.

description: Wonderful place, Fantastic food! Always super warm welcoming from Chef Hoss Zare and the entire staff. We love it there!! One of our Top 3 favorite Restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Aykut A.

description:
Found it overrated. 

Expensive fare. Okay service. 

The chicken 'fesenjoon' two ways, roasted breast, confit legs, walnut, mint, cocoa tagliatelle was not good though -- especially the cocoa tagliatelle. 

Can find better value and tasting Mediterranean.
author: Aakash G.

description:
We had dinner here Saturday, 1/24/2015. I chose it off of Yelp! based on its proximity to AT&T Park (we had just seen Cirque du Soliel's KURIOS and had a going-away party for a friend waiting for us, so proximity was important). The name is odd, but the reviews convinced us to try it. It was a longer walk from the show than I realized, but that was no big deal. 

I love fun cocktails, and this time by gosh I was having one. I had "Minted Memory" which I enjoyed very much. I believe, but am not sure, that JR had the Abarino wine. 

Since we had a party to go to where there was an anticipated home-cooked nacho bar & treats, we decided to go light on the food. We shared a blood orange salad that was delicious. 

Choosing from the "Beginnings" section proved challenging, because so many of them sounded good. We ended up having the Roasted Eggplant "Kashk Bademjan" and the Pistachio meatballs. Both of these were appetizers were terrific. Everything we had was presented beautifully. 

My guy is a history buff, and middle-East buff, and so I got a pretty detailed education about Persia/Iran, etc., ,etc., etc. during the meal, including food ingredients, common dishes, and things like that. :-)

The waitress was great--pleasant, friendly, attentive, and fun. I think it was the chef(?) that came to the table with our meatballs and asked how we liked the food. It looked like a chef's jacket, anyway, but my fellow said maybe he is the owner. I liked the decor, the ambiance, all of it.

I heard my guy on the phone to his brother, telling him about The Fly Trap--that alone is testament. I heard him say he thought the food was excellent, that it was comfortable there, that the atmosphere was relaxing, classy but not at all stuffy. It's a keeper! Can't wait to go again.
author: Java G.

description:
Great pre-party spot. Came with 3 without a reservation and were able to get a seat at the communal tables near the front. Our bartender took our food and drink order and we were able to get served pretty quickly. The Mules and Mai Tais were plenty strong and the brussel sprouts were killer. 

Also enjoyed the hummus trio!
author: Nikki M.

description:
I have gone to Fly trap twice and both times
 have been wonderful experiences. The atmosphere and food harmoniously match to create a fun,classy and enjoyable atmosphere and meal. The fusion foods offed here are always a delight and highlight the best of both the Persian and other cultural delicacies that are being offered on the menu. I have tried the beef cheek, burger and an array of appetizers and salads, each one has a delightful twist incorporating Persian cuisine and flavors. If you have enjoyed traditional Iranian cuisine in the past and are looking to try something new, i would highly recommenced dining at Fly trap.
author: Kevin Y.

description: I really don't know what I was expecting coming to this place. However, everything from the wine to the ambiance and the great service made dinner with my family very special. We ended up ordering a varied selection and all sharing. It was fun tasting a little bit of everyone's dishes. My favorites were the "huge meatball" special, lamb burger, chicken dish, and  the spring salad. I would definitely try this place again if I'm in the area. :)
author: Colleen H.

description:
The restaurant is charming and the food was amazing! I live nearby and have been meaning to come for dinner for a while. So happy I finally did and will be back again and again. 

We tried the argonaut cocktail which was light and fruity. For starters, we had the fall fattoush salad and the risotto cake. LOVED. For mains, we had the "abgoosht" and the short rib. AMAZING. Both were so delicious. The abgoosht was like a comforting lamb stew which came with lavash for dipping and sopping up all the goodness. Can't wait to have it again. 

We didn't stop there; for dessert, we had the goat cheese cheesecake. Ahh so good. 

Basically, we couldn't stop eating because everything was so good.
author: Annie C.

description: We were here for our anniversary. Experienced amazing food and service. The goat cheesecake is a must to top off the food
author: Madhu M.

description: This place is amazing! Place does get crowded, so try to get a reservation if you can. The bar does stay pretty empty if you don't mind sitting at the bar. To start we had the pistachio meatball. Everyone in my group was against it because it had pistachio, but in end they all loved it. I thought it was excellent. For my entree, I got the pork chop special, which was very good, especially the persimmon salsa. To drink, I had the herb and smoke, which was good as well. Overall, great food, drinks and service. Would definitely come back here again.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Food, service and ambiance = 5 stars.

I came here for their prefixe menu 4 course menu on NYE for $65. Considering most of the other nice restaurants were charging $80+, we got a good deal. Add in the fact that they didn't skimp on the serving size (they did tell us the steak was smaller than normal, but it was still sizable). 

The atmosphere here is lovely, romantic and the place is small. Our server was very attentive and they changed out our utensils after each course.

Starter: sunchoke soup: 3.5 stars- Google tells me sunchoke is a Jerusalem artichoke. The soup was creamy and tast. 

App: dungeness crab cake: 5 stars: The crab they used was fresh and unlike cheaper places, you could actually taste and see the crab because it wasn't mashed with a bunch of other things to mask the low quality. 

Entree: roasted duck breast: 4 stars: tasty

Goat cheesecake: 3 stars: The goat cheesecake was interesting, thicker than normal cheesecake with a strong flavor.
author: Emily C.

description:
LOVE the food, the Customer service and atmosphere. The most amazing, HOSpitable, friendly CHEF I'v ever seen. His food is a peace of ART, a persian fusion cuisine with taste of heaven. He usually serves one of the dishes himself and most of the time followed by a complimentary dish on the house. I totally recommend the Sikanjebin cocktail, the fried eggplant, bone marrow, koofteh tabrizi and my favorite dish in the restaurant, a dessert called Faloodeh ( dressed with edible flowers and pistachio). 
Even the french fries in this restaurant has been made with much delicacy and perfection with a twist of Zafron ( an expensive Persian spice).
I recommend to everyone in town or Bay Area to check this place out, and I'm sure you are going to fall in LOVE with this place just as I did.
author: Niki N.

description:
The best Mediterranean  food that you can try in SF, the ambiance is just perfect.  
The food is super delicious.
They have great cocktails , the sekanjabin cocktail is my favorite. Don't forget to check out their happy hour.
Their service is remarkable.
If you love good food and great ambiance you should definitely try it.
author: Yass N.

description:
I rarely write Yelp reviews, but I have to make an exception for Flytrap. This is one of my favorite places in the city. Hoss is such a gracious host, and the food he prepares is always phenomenal. 
The bone marrow is to die for - a must-have (even if it doesn't sound good to you, order it and thank me later). Drinks are fantastic, service is great, and the ambiance is inviting and fun. I've never been there without Hoss coming out to greet me and chat for a couple minutes. Truly a one-of-a-kind dining experience - the staff make you feel right at home. Highly recommend.
author: Ariana K.

description: It was a very nice surprise. I was looking for a middle eastern restaurant and this is one with a twist. The place looks more like an irish pub but the food is inspired by middle east flavors and they bring a lot of modernity to eat. There are plenty of options for vegetarians and the staff (still not middle eastern) is friendly. Don't go if you're looking for something more authentic.
author: Nellie A.

description: Phenomenal! Creative flavor combinations and perfect execution of presentation and service. We always come back when we are in the City.
author: Mariah R.

description:
It was very easy to make a reservation with them, i was given the option to sit at the bar, or an area where it was more quiet and intimate. 
The food was excellent, and the service was amazing. The lady that served me was quick with my food since i had to head back to work.
The front of the restaurant can get rowdy because it is next to the bar and people can get loud after a couple of drinks (i highly recommend making reservations to sit in the back) which is more quiet especially if you take a date.
author: Stefany L.

description:
Went here last night with my boyfriend and my father. The food was marvelous! I had the braised beef cheek and the Sloe No cocktail. I found the cocktails to be good, but not spectacular.

This place is very noisy, luckily they agreed to move us to their back seating area that is a bit quieter.

The staff were all very good.

I highly recommend this place!
author: Yael S.

description: Brett was an amazing server. Even on NYE she was super friendly and in good spirit. The special menu was delicious and everything was spot on!
author: Natalie D.

description:
Zaré was where my wife and I had dinner the first night that we traveled to San Francisco together. We had an excellent meal served by very attentive staff. The cocktail list is creative, our entrees were rich in flavor, and the wines suggested by our waiter were a perfect match.

We went back recently to find that the service was chilly and the menu had lost its vigor. (What's posted on their website seems out of date.) We had the dolma appetizer, which was presented well but was not very flavorful. For dinner we ate the lamb and the roast chicken, both of which would have been better with less sauce and less salt. Wait staff was courteous, yet somehow unfriendly at the same time.

Still, it is a reasonable choice for a quiet weekday dinner in SOMA.
author: Alex L.

description:
I am really surprised that I haven't written a review for Fly Trap yet! Especially since I've been here at least 4x!

It is a restaurant like no other in SF... Has a very European Bistro feel, great ambiance and buzzing energy... Yet it's so Romantic and quaint. 

It's hard to single out any one dish in particular as there are so many unique yet familiar dishes on the menu. Definitely has a strong Iranian influence as far as spices and ingredients go but it is a more contemporary california fusion and seasonal menu.

For starters, salad shirazi, pistachio meatballs, and stuffed calamari 

Entrees- braised short rib and braised lamb are just wonderful. I recently tried the seafood couscous dish and I'm still dreaming about it. Btw- the Abgoosht (braised lamb) is crazy good. Didn't know it was possible to make a classic Iranian village dish into an elegant masterpiece. Was pleasantly surprised!! 

Oh I forgot to mention the French fries... You just have to try them. They are like McDonalcds fries but freshly made, crispy and the saffron aioli is perfect! 

And if you leave without dessert... You're missing out. Goat cheesecake is fantastic.

One of the most special parts of the dinners here is when Mr Chef Zare comes and says his hellos to your table. You can see him in and out of the kitchen throughout the night and his smile and energy is contagious.

I think the servers could be more attentive.. But again, that's the strong European bistro vibe.. It is a definite 2+ hour meal. They aren't rushing to turn tables around, which I respect. But sometimes I felt the waiting service was inadequate to the standards of the restaurant. 

And ps. This is NOT by any means traditional Iranian food ... As there is no koobideh and rice dish to be found on the menu, however, the menu is definitely inspired by the Chef's culture and his own favorite dishes... And he is a true Persian chef. As an Iranian, it is easy to see the familiarities of his dishes to classic Persian Cuisine.
author: Shanna N.

description:
Came here with high expectations. Used to pass by this place on my way to work and always wanted to try it, as I really like mediterranean food. I think I might have come here on an off night, because my experiences differs from most of the reviews I read on here that made me want to try this place. 

The waitress was extremely rude. The entire time we got an 'eat s--- and die' vibe from her facial expression. The restaurant was half empty and our table was ignored for much of the meal. It took a long time to order and just to get someone's attention to order.

The noise level was great. It was low enough to be enjoyable. The ambiance of the restaurant was enjoyable. 

We had the hummus, risotto, chicken, and flourless torte. The food was ok, but not worth the amount we paid paired with the service we received. We came here specifically to celebrate an accomplishment (new job) and were in high spirits until we had waited 15+ minutes just to order a glass of wine and were met with an unfriendly vibe. I was disappointed with the overall experience and don't see a reason to return just due to the sheer amount of other establishments I'd like to try (and ones I'd like to go back to). Oh well.
author: Abby D.

description:
Amazing restaurant. 
This is one of my friend's favorite restaurants in SF. She suggested we go there when I was visiting SF last week; and now I know why! This place is beautiful. The setting, the bar, and the decorations create a wonderful ambiance, very intimate. The cocktails were fantastic; really original, creative, and full of flavors. And the food... Oh my the food! Amazing. The menu has such an interesting take on Persian food. While the dishes are not traditional Persian, but the flavors are dead on! We tried their pistachio meatballs, the lavash cup (eggplant dish), and the vegetarian meatballs. They were all amazing. The portions were great too. I really enjoyed the experience. If I am ever back in SF, I would definitely pay another visit to Zaré at Fly Trap!!
author: Sonya M.

description:
I have been to Fly Trap numerous times over the past few years and each time I visit this restaurant the more I fall in love with the warm and inviting ambience, the impeccable  service, and the unique tasting food that is the fusion of tastes taken from the east and west and married together into something magical that only chef Zare seems to be able to create. 
This is a unique gem of a restaurant that once you try it, you will be impelled to go back again and again.
author: H. S.

description:
Zaré is one of those small little gems of a restaurant that I knew nothing about a week before going and walked about being so thankful that I had discovered it, because now I'm going to have to make up for lost time!

The cozy yet elegant ambience of the space is gorgeous, it makes for a perfect romantic dinner or just a fabulous night out with friends, though I would definitely recommend a reservation on any night of the week.  The service is great, extremely attentive, friendly, and knowledged staff with regards to both food and wine offerings.  Now onto the food - AMAZING!  

The mushroom cake was one of my absolute favourites, and has convinced me that mushroom rather than crab is the best kind of cake.  It is served with this to-die-for pesto sauce on top, and a side of arugula.  While it is an appetizer this was a perfect entree size for me.  

For dessert it was hard not to want to try everything, but we opted for the goat cheesecake and the cardamom panna cotta, and had no regrets.  I am in no way being hyperbolic when I say that the goat cheesecake is one of the best desserts I have had in my entire life!  I am a profound lover of all things goat (cheese, yogurt etc), and often find goat cheesecake to not be 'goaty' enough if you will.  Zaré's however was perfect - the taste, the texture, the date topping and side of kiwi and pineapple chunks, it was utter perfection!  We couldn't get enough of it yet savour it at the same time, and probably had other guests wondering what was going on in the corner because we were very vocal about all of the above!  The panna cotta was also sublime, perfect texture and smoothness as well, and great topping of honey drizzle and pistachio.  

Needless to say, I can't wait to go back and try more!  A great find in SOMA!
author: K. N.

description:
This is how every food experience should be like! Great food by Chef Hoss Zaré who dropped by and told us about the his experiments with meatballs- just amazing to be able to look thru a window in the past and learn about food culture experiences that drive a passionate chef. We ordered the meatball, grilled lamb, and seafood dish among other and everything thing was cooked with passionate perfection! 

Our host Gabriel was probably our favorite host in a long time- giving us recommendations, making us laugh and really making the night special for all of us!
author: Sharika S.

description:
Took my gf here for a Saturday dinner date, and it was EXCELLENT.

Walking by we thought this place was some wine or trendy hipster bar but its actually a persian gem of a restaurant. The executive chef was handling the front and he was more then helpful with the menu. Eggplant app and braised beef entree was to die for. Very unique flavors and a great atmosphere. Highly recommend for dinner.
author: Devin E.

description:
Persian food at it's most exquisite level! Persian-Franch fusion?
I grew up in France and in Iran. Dining at the Fly trap is bringing me the best of 2 cuisines. The flavors and spices, are unforgettable, the presentation and wine list as in fine restaurant in Paris, the etiquette of the staff is impeccable, the ambiance very New York.
My favorites are the kashkeh bademjan, the pistachios meat balls, abgousht (Iranian Goulash soup), Koufteh Tabrizi and my favorite desert out of this world is Faloudeh.

Mmmm! My favorite restaurant in San francisco
author: Mass S.

description:
Stop readings the reviews.  Book a reservations and you will surely enjoy a nice meal.  What was ordered:

Lamb tongue with falafel
Beef cheeks
Goat milk cheesecake

To top it off, they were gluten-free friendly.  Service was attentive without being overbearing.
author: Thang H.

description:
Lunch at Zaré is a very casual and delightful affair. The menu is simple yet satisfying. You step up to the bar to place your order, take a number, find a seat and wait for your meal to be delivered to your table. The options are quite light - I rather enjoyed my order of a cous cous salad. However, there are options to make it a little more substantial and to that end I highly recommend the French fries because they are accompanied by a delicious aioli. We always had Brussels sprouts to share, but they were on the daily specials menu and so may not always be available.

Lunch here isn't exorbitantly priced, but neither is it cheap. Expect to pay between $15 - $20 per person for an entrée and a drink.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
I did not like their food at all, I ordered grilled lamb, and a plate of Hommus. 

FIrst of all, the Hommus was shockingly very little, you can call it "drops of Hommus" and it did not test good at all.  the Chips that comes with it was very oily. 

Second, I ordered the lamb to be well done, and it was very rare and there was blood coming out of it.  and the test of the grilled lamb was disappointing

I left the restaurant hungry and very disappointed, the bill was $110 for 3 people.  I mean seriously?!! you pay that much money and you are still hungry?!  It is not worth it at all, and definitely I will not come back again.

PS: Why the Hell it is considered Persian food ? nothing about it is Persian at all!!
author: Angel S.

description:
I brought my sister from out of town to Fly Trap this weekend and couldn't have asked for a better experience!!! 

Everything we had, we loved!  Grilled Spiced Naan with Celery Root Spread, Pearl Cous Cous Cacciucco, Grilled Lamb Sirloin, Crispy Brussels.  All amazing, great quality and flavorful food.  I'd come back every night for a plate of those brussels!!!! 

My sister had never tried Foie Gras and although it wasn't on the menu, The Fly Trap staff sent out a special surprise; a beautiful plate of Foie Gras served with smoked salmon, lentils and Mountain Rose Apple that was TO DIE FOR!!!     

Amazing service, delicious food and great atmosphere!  

Thank You Fly Trap, you are one of SF's finest in my book!
author: Kim P.

description:
I was really looking forward to dinner, but I think this place really need to focus on what cuisine it's serving and develop the flavors and dishes accordingly. The service was OK but frankly after coming back from France I found it a bit rushed, I enjoy taking time between my dishes and even when we asked to slow it down it was still a bit rushed.

The dishes: 
The meatballs were great, tender, nice balance of flavor and a interesting take on the sauce, a nice surprise. 
The kashk bademjan was just a mess, the dish had no flavor to me, it was very bland, messy, nothing was nicely plated, the eggplant was just piled on the bread, we had no idea how to eat it. 
The bone marrow was nice, but the baguette served with it was just not good and the preserve that was served with it was more sweet and didn't really cut the richness of the marrow.  I would have liked to have something more citrus or even berry that would complement it.
Then the scallops I think for us were the most disappointing.  There was only three scallops in the entire dish, then there were both roasted and mashed potatoes and asparagus.  It felt more like the protein was the afterthought not the center of the dish and the flavors again were all flat and bland. 

We also had a few glasses of wine, while the sauvignon blank was great the reds were overpriced and not very good selections by the glass.

All and all for the $120 tab we've had much better dinners and definitely are not looking to come back here.
author: Inga W.

description:
I am so delighted to have found this little gem and cannot wait to return!  My only regret is that we hadn't time to eat a full meal.

I simply adore inventive cocktails - but too often, in an attempt for originality, mixologists create overly complicated, unappealing drinks making me fearful of wavering from a gin and tonic.  The cardamom, lime, and gin martini was perfectly balanced, not overly sweet, and was a entirely rare species that rather than competing, complemented the food.    

Mediterranean food is anyways a favorite for me, but I was delighted to see fragrant spices like bergamont in the foreground in the delicious bone marrow dish.  

The manager recommended his favorite, the Kashk Bedemjar Eggplants with yogurt and walnut crispy onions, which was amazing! I wish I could have eaten three orders! 

The Pistachio Meatballs with the Pomegranate Glaze, was a tad dry to my preference, but had delicious flavor.  I was particularly pleased that as there were two of us sharing the dish and they thought to ask if we'd like two or four as it come with three - delighted by the attention to detail!  

Baba Ghanoush was also delicious and the tarragon garnish complimented the dish beautifully.  Can't wait to go back and taste through the menu!  

I hate to be critical of other reviewers, but found the majority of pictures to not do the chef or restaurant justice... Cameras and lighting... I do understand... just saying.
author: Anna N.

description:
Salmon was fabulous. The wait staff is excellent. 
The cucumber and smoked salmon salad is cool, fresh and perfect for a palate awakening
author: Francisco M.

description:
One of the best Mediterranean places I have been to .. Their eggplant and risotto cake appetizers are great. 
Will def be back to try out other dishes
author: Varun A.

description:
Really nice place and great meal.  Met friend for a drink at the bar and then dinner.  Drinks were generous (great vodka martini) and bar is comfortable.  

The wait staff is really exceptional.  Genuinely friendly without being overly chummy.  Made us feel like valued guests.

The food was uniformly excellent.
author: Michael G.

description:
Great fusion Persian food. 3 of us arrived on a Friday night ahead of our reservation and the place was packed. We were starving because it was late and we abandoned the wait for the table for spots at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and made us a mixed scotch drink as well as a sage mule. I like moscow mules very much but the sage mule was too tart for my taste. I ordered the braised lamb which was just what I was looking for. The meat was tender and flavorful. We also got the chocolate torte with pistachios for dessert which was moist and slightly crunchy. 

This was probably the fifth time I've eaten at Zare and the food has always been consistently good. Will definitely come back again in the future.
author: Judy L.

description:
Lunchtime in SF - especially in SOMA, can be a heck of a gamble. There are plenty of good, well-known spots and tons more mediocre and overpriced spots. Thanks to the Yelp app, I've been lucky enough to avoid bad lunches in the area, and find spots like Zaré that offer up tasty options with friendly service in a chill setting... and for CHEAP. 

The lunch menu at Zaré is short and to the point: healthy wraps with fries, arancini and chickpea salad on the side. Well, as optional sides. The plates themselves, which run around $8, are just a wrap and a salad. A delicious wrap, and a tasty salad made from fresh greens. I sampled the steak wrap a compatriot was eating, but had to go with the sardine and anchovy option myself. Both were tasty, filling, and served up by some super friendly and genuine guys. They also offer chicken and salmon wraps as well as some other options. 

And the best part?

We were able to walk in during the middle of lunch rush and get fast service and an open table for 5. It's not packed. It should be, but it's not. At least for now. I'm sure that as soon as these folks get discovered, that part will be ancient history.
author: Don B.

description:
**DECENT MEDITERRANEAN BISTRO IN SF**

Street parking was a bitch on a Saturday night.

We were 15 minutes late and so we had to wait an additional 10 minutes for our reserved table.

I ordered a mojito at the front bar and it was muddy brown. It was still refreshing despite its color and lack of fresh mint leaves.

Ambiance was noisy, romantic, and intimate.

Our waiter, Ryan, was friendly and efficient.

We sat in the back room which was oddly very warm. My date and my girlfriend was sweating profusely.

My date and I ordered tapas-style:

*GRILLED LAMB SAUSAGE - Sausage tasted very good with the roasted squash and fennel. Very flavorful. Recommend. 

*YOGURT MARINATED FLAT IRON STEAK - The steak came with herb salad, cucumber raita, and lavash. I thought the combination was good, but nothing spectacular and could be made easily at home.

*MUSSELS - Came with 2 large toasted bread pieces for dipping. The mussels were juicy and fresh. The broth was slightly on the salty side and not as flavorful as I would like.

The staff refilled our water carafe promptly and our dishes came out within 15 minutes.

We didn't stay long enough for dessert.

Overall a good experience.

RECOMMEND.
author: Betty N.

description:
The food is elegantly plated and presented, aromatic, sensuously spiced versions of what I like to call "peasant food." 

We started with Crushed Fava Bean Bruschetta - a fragrant smear of mint, buratta and black garlic topped with pea shoots and the Lavash and Tapenade. Both were delicious. My entrée, the Abgoosht of Lamb Ragu, served with potato and chickpeas was a bit too on the comfort food side for me. My friend ordered the Turkish Spiced Eggplant, which was superb.

I wish he had a "small plates," menu so that I could sample everything. Really wanted to try the spicy meatballs and the quail . . .next time.

Deserts are worth stopping by all on their own. We ordered the Baklava with Persian cream and rose preserves and the Citrus Lady Apples. I am definitely coming back to try the Ice Cream Sandwich made with saffron ice cream!
author: Brenda M.

description: We loved this restaurant.  The ambiance is nice, the service was delightful and the food was wonderful.  We ordered seared day boat scallops, roasted rack of lamb, grilled 8oz beef burger and Goat Cheesecake.  Every dish was cooked to perfection, and the goat cheesecake was better than expected.
author: Sue Ann L.

description:
This review is based on a take out experience, and would probably be a higher review if it was based on a dinning in experience. 
The beet salad was pretty good, but lacking greens. More greens! 
The trout salad with the cucumber "linguine"- good idea with the cucumber but the salad was drenched in a thick too creamy dressing. ewww.  Also the pieces of trout were super small and not substantial.  My friend got the lamb burger, and he asked for feta cheese on the burger, but they forgot.  Also we asked for no fries and they gave us fries.  The menu sounds pretty good and I would possibly try it again, but for the price it should be better /:
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I have been to Zare at Fly Trap several times by now for dinner and lunch when I traveled to San Francisco and this place is such a joy. From the food to the staff and the owner chef Zare every element is so inviting and charming and makes you want to go back again. ( Well, that's the reason I don't ever miss this restaurant when I travel to the Bay Area.) He gives his customers special hugs which he calls "hossy hugs" and he makes you feel so comfortable even if it is your first time to this restaurant.  I also thought it is it was a perfect place to take your date to since it has a nice romantic yet simple and elegant ambiance. 
Each time I have been there, the staffs have been amazingly warm and friendly. The food presentation is terrific, but what stand out the most are the flavors that just marry together so well. I have tried the wild mushroom cake and I absolutely loved it and highly recommend it. The green harissa sauce that was on it was not just an ordinary spicy sauce; it was a spicy sauce full of flavors.  The pistachio meatballs just melted in my mouth and I adored the pomegranate sauce that was on it. It was tangy and so tasteful and the cucumber linguini was so light and delicious. Let me tell you something. I don't what know what they do to their food, but I don't even like brussel sprouts and I almost ate the whole bowl of brussel sprouts with that delicious yogurt sauce next to it! One time, when I was there, they had a special "foie gras with smoked salmon" and I was a little hesitant to try it, but I wanted to be adventurous and gave it a try and on my God! It was heaven in my mouth! And of course for the dessert, I absolutely loved the goat cheese cheesecake. It is so light and fluffy you feel you are riding on the clouds. 
In general I love the concept of this restaurant. I never imagined Persian influence on Mediterranean food could be so modern and classy with such an elegant presentation.
author: Shima S.

description:
Fernando was such a great server!  He made the whole dining experience more fun!

My second time eating here, my homegirl wanted to come for a visit from NYC to surprise her mom and it worked!

We laughed, we cried, we just had plain old fun.

Meatballs, bone marrow, beef cheeks.

A carnivore's dream come true.

I mean the sides were good, but the yummy proteins were what made me a fan!

It's just a little pricey.  But definitely going back.
author: Susan C.

description:
One of the very best restaurant experiences ever!  

First of all, the food.  DELICIOUS!!!  If you like Middle Eastern flavors and spices served to you like dishes on Iron Chef America, this is the place for you!  The dishes I really recommend - 

kashk bademjan - very tasty and the flavors are true to the real dish.  however, the display of the dish is amazing and definitely worth seeing.  

yogurt marinated flat iron steak - 3 skewers of perfectly-cooked steak, served with bread and yogurt for a make-it-yourself sandwich

lamb 'abgoosht' - my parents were so pleased with this dish.  flavorful, fragrant, and very moist meat

We were also served a complimentary order of the vegetarian 'kufteh tabrizi', which was very flavorful and tasty.  I would definitely order it next time.

Next the service. Hoss Zare is a very personable, social, and warm person and really adds the personal touches to make you feel like you are a guest at his home.  I went with my family to celebrate and each of us left with a big smile on our faces.  Can't wait to go back again soon!!!
author: Anna M.

description: Solid four stars for this easily overlooked gem! On Folsom Street, must of driven past it hundreds of times but never knew of its existence. Glad I discovered it last  Thursday evening. It's such a romantic restaurant and the host and all the servers are sweet n very friendly. I requested window seating in the front. Dinner consisted of: bitter greens salad with the yummiest honey vinaigrette dressing, pistachio meatballs (came in three good sized serving) tender n juicy, pan roasted salmon, medium rare and crispy brussels. ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh, super yummy! Paired everything with a glass of white and you are in heaven!!! Burp...
author: Vee V.

description:
Somehow this restaurant as been off my radar.  They opened in 2008!
Anyway, my husband and I really enjoyed the food and the service.
We shared all:
Bone Marrow - excellently roasted with candied watermelon and house-made pickles
Meatballs - very good - wish they served (4)
Peach and tomato salad - fresh and excellent
Lamb shank  - very nicely prepared with lamb ragout - we didn't care for the "relish" on the side
Cheesecake - delish - the crust tasted like shortbread - they server said it was "light" - I would say it was not a light dessert
Overall - loved the food / experience.
We would go back for sure!
author: Kelly A.

description:
Supa dupa fresh! Thanks for the reco, Ruggy!

Zare is one of those extraordinarily pleasant places...lovely restaurant, chill atmosphere, creative and healthy menu. It was a great place for a low key lunch! 

The chicken quinoa salad was fresh and flavorful with bits of roasted chicken, clean flavors and nice sized portion. My only ish with this dish was that the quinoa was a bit watery...but that didn't really stop me from taking it down! The standout of my lunch, though, was a large, crispy, cheesy risotto ball with spicy tomato sauce. Balls from heaven, I tell you. 

Get yourself to Zare for wonderful service and a delicious, relaxed lunch.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I came here for dinner and drinks  with some out of town friends .The place is quaint and looks like a really good spot for a quiet dinner date.  The Roasted eggplant, the pistachio meatballs and the french fries are a must try. 

I normally don't like the fries that I get at restaurants, because they try and make it 'feel' healthy by going easy on the seasoning and keeping them pretty bland ,but these made us go for seconds . 

I'd definitely recommend trying this place out atleast once. If you are looking for a easy choice for a dinner date, this should be on that list.
author: Natarajan S.

description:
Always a solid spot for post work drinks and dinner. 

Stand outs:

- Pistachio Meatballs
- Flat Iron Kabab
- Braised Lamb
- The lamb burger - Fantastic!

Cocktails:

- Pisco sour
- agaves inferno 
- blonde Manhattan
author: Sareen Capital S.

description:
I mean, the food here is quite delicious. There's no denying that. However, even I think it's a little overpriced (but only slightly). I've had food of the same caliber that didn't cost me $60+ dollars (and that's without drinks included). I understand that this building is historic and that the rent is probably outrageous, but it's very obvious that this place caters mostly to Financial District-types who use their corporate charge card so that they can schmooze with their clients. 

Don't get me wrong, the food was great and the service was great and the atmosphere was great. That's why I give them 4 stars. It would've been a perfect 5 if I didn't feel that I was overpaying for the food. 

Some great things about this place was that the chef took the time to come out and ask us if the meal was going well and to wish my friend and I a happy birthday since we were there for a birthday dinner). This place, by the way, is great for groups. They have a long table at the front and a room towards the back of the restaurant that they usually use for big groups.
author: Rylan C.

description: This was very good. Several of us were in town for a conference and decided to give this a try. We shared the beet salad which was very good. A couple of us had the seafood linguini and while decadent it is not too large so a good balance. Service was very good
author: Donna R.

description:
Went here to celebrate new years eve. Prefixe menu, four-course meal: salad, crab cake, steak, and goat cheesecake. 

Price: the fact that it was new years eve, the prefixe menu at $65/pp was reasonable

Food: food came in good portions. My main entree was steak, was not overcooked. The crab in the crabcake tasted fresh from what I remembered. The goat cheesecake was interesting. I liked it personally, on the thicker side but others mentioned it had a lighter taste to it. 

Ambiance is intimate and nice for dinner. Dimly lit. Nice decor.  Great date place. Customer service was good that night. 

I would come back again to try their regular menu to get a better feel of the place.
author: Carol L.

description: Very good dinner - I had the short rib and my dining guest had the beef cheek's washed down with a bottle of Rioja.  The short ribs were very tender, braised perfectly, as were the beef cheeks.  Service was outstanding and ambiance was very good.  Overall a very good experience.  I wish yelp would adopt 1/2 star rating system - this would be a 4.5.
author: Stuart B.

description:
I haven't had many dining experiences where the Executive Chef/Owner personally brings the dishes to your table so this was definitely a treat. I wanted to kiss the man for his brilliance of creating such amazingly delicious food that I'd give my left boob for. 

With each bite of the beautifully prepared dishes by Chef Zare I would close my eyes and pretend to be Anthony Bourdain having the privilege of tasting amazing cuisine wherever he goes, but today being taken on a journey through the Mediterranean and Middle East. In my mind I was eating like a Sultan. Then I opened my eyes, looked down, and wondered what happened to my left boob.

I couldn't care less about the random creepers eyeing me from the bar as I ate dinner. Zare took me to my happy place and I didn't even need to bring my passport.
author: Jen Y.

description:
We came here to check out the 7x7-recommended pistachio meatballs.

Sadly, we thought that was the most disappointing part of the meals. Although we were a bit split in our views on the meatball, overall the meat was on the dry and crumbly side and we didn't particularly like that neither of us could figure out the type of meat it was from the flavor.
