The pomegranate sauce that came with it was powerfully acidic and sweet, but wasn't balanced with the taste of the meat. Mostly it left us wishing there was some spicy in the meatballs to tie the dish together.

We also had a wild mushroom cake which had pesto, green harissa, and arugula. The mushroom cake itself was great with a meaty salty texture (that we wished the meatballs had had) with a nice crunch on the outer shell. It went nicely with the paired greens.

The head to tail goat included quinoa, cucumber-yogurt with lavash, a bitter broccolini-like greens, and a sweet red sauce. We thought this dish was yummy and loved the lavash to make little wraps. The goat was flavorful but a bit on the dry side and again we thought a spicy sauce might have been better pairing for the dish.

The rare seared tuna came with cauliflower, lentils, and shaved fennel. It was well seasoned and tasty although we disagreed with how well the components of the dish came together. One of us thought the lentils blended nicely with the tuna (with similar texture) the other person just felt the different components didn't fit together. 

Lastly, we had a Persian Breakfast (Gin, honey, egg white, lemon, bergamot) and the Cardamom my dearest (gin, cardamom, lime). Both were tasty but the cardamom was lacking in cardamom and the Persian Breakfast was a bit too sweet.

For such an upscale restaurant, it was incredibly noisy and hard to hear each other even though we sat on the same side of the table. Overall, the food varied from okay to great (meatballs to mushroom cake) but we felt that the standard for the place needed to be higher for the prices charged. Overall, we would have given the place a 3.5 but the high prices led us to decide finally settle on a 3. (Note we consider 2 stars to be the average restaurant)
author: Amy D.

description: Modern take on pan Iranian, Arabic, Turkish food. Everything was delicious and the decor lovely.
author: Mmm M.

description:
They did a great job... late night eats delivered well. Dinner was terrific, the service was familiar but very professional, and the server was very in tune with the menu and what we might want.

White wine selection could be broader, but we still found what we wanted.

Overall a great place to go on a date or for a business dinner. I'd make a reservation, there isn't tons of seating.
author: Ian T.

description: Great bar tender and fabulous cocktails.  Very well stocked with broad selection of small batch and artisanal Liquors. Kitchen delivered exceptional appetizers and main courses. Great flavors. Not a me too place.
author: ross l.

description:
I came here with my co-workers for a client dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the quality and taste of the different plates. I'm not too familiar with Mediterranean food (although I know I love dolmas and spanikopita, and lemon chicken soup), but this place gave me a great impression and I know I'll probably be back sometime in the future. 

Their cocktail menu was interesting - they incorporate a Mediterranean twist into their drinks to keep the theme consistent.

We started with the pistachio meatballs (juicy, with a bit of sweet goodness, DEFINITELY RECOMMEND I can still taste it!), grilled lamb sausage (decent), the bread & lavash (interesting & tasty spreads), and the beets salad (flavorful). 

I ordered the grilled moroccan-style wild salmon which was amazing! All of the different flavors of the toasted fregola, green beans, charmoula complemented the perfected grilled salmon. I had to take my leftovers to go as I could not let any of such a delicious dish go to waste.

Service was a bit slow but perhaps they were a bit short-staffed.
author: Erin C.

description: Love this place....It's classy with amazing food and drinks.  Great selection of wine.  The owner and chef Hoss is the best and supper friendly.  Love going here.
author: Leyloon T.

description:
5 star service. The service was unbelievably great. 

3 star setting: I wish it were cozier. The vibe feels very business-y, uninviting.

3 star food:

ROASTED SQUASH WITH EGGPLANT: pretty good. different. 
LAMB TONGUE WITH FALAFEL: I found the lamb tongue kind of gross. Horrible texture. The falafel was OK. 
PISTACHIO MEATBALLS: The meatballs were dry, but the sauce they came in was bomb. 

CHOCOLATE DATE TORTE: Excellent. If I remember correctly from my last visit, the desserts here usually take the cake. (The GOAT MILK CHEESECAKE was divine on our prior visit).
author: Sylvie C.

description: Excellent mouth watering modern Persian.  The abgoosht is my personal favorite.  The service is also top notch.
author: Ghazal V.

description: Food was ok.  Don't come here if you have a tree nut allergy, literally everything from salads, entrees, desserts are full of nuts.
author: Melissa M.

description: WOW I really was pleased with this place. Excellent food, friendly service. We had a smoked trout salad that was tasty, and the soup was delicious as well. My friend had the salmon that she scarfed down. I had the lamb and HOLY MOLY it was great. I'm a bit of a lamb connoisseur and their lamb was really top notch. Nicely priced wine list, and a tasty selection of cocktails as well. Parking is plentiful as well. Persian influenced American/French is how I would describe the food. Well done.
author: M L.

description: Cozy restaurant with inventive menu and cocktail list in SOMA area. This place was on my list to check out for a while. We came on a weeknight and found it to be moderately full around 6, especially by the bar area. Service is fairly attentive. Food was great! I recommend getting the eggplant appetizer and the hummus trio. I had the braised lamb entree, which was ok but the broth was a little too watery for me. I LOVED the beef cheek special that someone else in my party had. This is a good place for after work drinks if you're in the area or for a romantic dinner!
author: J L.

description: Interesting and memorable drinks (I had a pomegranite and gin drink). Delicious meal (kufteh Tabrizi- chickpea based meatball stuffed with chicken, walnuts and currants). Appetizer was a fava bean and ricotta spread with great texture and flavor with lavash bread. The dessert was amazing and was made of a surprising combination of yogurt, cucumber and quince. It was original and fantastic. Attentive service. Elegant ambiance. Both times I have been here, the chef has been present and has come out to talk with the guests. Super warm and friendly.
author: Maria A.

description:
We started off with the grilled steak kabobs which weren't bad but didn't stand out at all. The bone marrow was tasty and came with a melon side that made an interesting combination with the marrow. 

For entrees we had the beef cheek and seafood with couscous. Both the marrow and the cheek were overly garnished with small green leaves that covered the entire dish to a point where when they were all collected together it made a small side salad. Again, the cheek wasn't bad but not memorable. The crab in the seafood medley didn't taste fresh. There was a large amount of couscous in it. Also, I was expecting fine grain couscous and they ended up being very large. The portions were pretty large and by the end of dinner we had no room for the goat cheesecake, which is apparently their specialty.

We ordered a house specialty cocktail which was watery and had little flavor other than lime. One major irritant for the evening was the dining was extremely hot and stuffy for all of dinner service. To top it off the window next to our table was broken and couldn't be opened. The best aspect of the restaurant was the wait staff which was friendly, prompt and helpful. They went out of their way to open a bottle when we wanted a type of wine that wasn't available on the glass list.

Overall, for the price of the restaurant the food was underwhelming.
author: Michael S.

description:
Amazing! I can just say amazing! For the food, for the cocktails and the most important thing for me, ambience! 
Love this place!
author: Mamak E.

description:
Really really good dining experience. I came with my family on a special night where they happened to be doing a cookbook signing so there was a live guitar player who was great. Service was good and efficient too; they brought sharing plates and utensils for all the mains we decided to share. To start, I recommend the pistachio meatballs are moist and flavorful. The asparagus salad is also nice, colorful and light. 

The meats here are done very well. The cinnamon beef cheek was so tender and delicious. I also am a fan of the half chicken, especially with the green sauce, whatever it is. It is tasty. The braised lamb is also a good choice. 

Also I'm not always one to go for dessert, but don't skip it here. The goat cheesecake might sound gross but it's not. The goat cheese is super light and it tastes like a regular delicious fluffy cheesecake with just the slightest hint of a different kind of cheese at the end. Very nice. Also, the baklava is not traditional but very delicious. Light, flaky with really nicely flavored cream, and a rose flavor that hits all the way through. 

Overall a great dining experience. It's not the cheapest dinner to go out for, but IMO a very worthwhile one.
author: Allie Y.

description: Nice restaurant although has not much to do with Persian food. The menu is very well thought and kept simple in choices while still delivering the variety of a very decent menu. The bone marrow is exquisite and old fashions are very well balanced. Nice atmosphere with relaxed yet cosy seatings.
author: Khash S.

description:
I think this is my best-kept SF secret, but I'm feeling benevolent, so I'll sing it loudly on Yelp.

I've been here 5+ times, always for dinner but with different permutations of my social circle: parents, date night, girlfriends, coworkers. Everyone's always had a good thyme (lol see what I did there) and the food and cocktails are consistently solid.

My favorite things about Fly Trap:

1. The history - ask where it got its name, I dare you. 
2. The ambiance - so un-SoMa, and therefore great. The annex room is a little unexciting but it's easier to hear so there's that.
3. Fly Trap's menu and execution balance innovation and delivery so well. Every dish is a little bit interesting (I mean, it is Persian fusion), but is always so grounded in the basics of California cooking that nothing goes awry. 
4. The service is amazing. They are so welcoming and friendly and willing to accommodate. 

Try the lamb shank, I dare you.
author: A O.

description:
We were able to get seated without a reservation at 7 on a Weds.  

They have some cool cocktails to choose from.

Cool ambiance in the restaurant - good "datey" location.

We ordered everything to share - food was OK, wasn't blown away with anything, and given the price of everything, would have preferred going somewhere else. Probably would not recommend or return.

What we tried:
* Brussel sprouts - nothing special, not very tasty either.
* Smoked Trout Cucumber Salad - very refreshing - cold cucumber strips with chunks of smoked trout. Glad we tried this
* Gnocchi (can't remember how they put it on the menu) - not sure what was going on with the gnocchi bits, but the broccoli was good.
* Yogurt marinated Flat iron steak - nothing special
author: Melody T.

description:
We came here to celebrate the lovely Sarah T's birthday. The ambiance was nice, quaint little place. They did a great job hosting a huge group of people.

I ordered the sea bass on top of a bed of gemelli and heirlook tomatoes. The fish was cooked extremely well, nice flavor with a good crust on their. I get slightly annoyed when restaurants try to label fish as "sea bass." I get super hopeful thinking it's the yummy Chilean type that I'm not supposed to be eating *guilty look* but it turns out to be some sort of other type of white fish masquerading under that label. Hubster got their duck leg dish. The rice that was paired with it was more interesting than the duck itself... Definitely 4 stars to them for dealing with our large group...
author: Vicky L.

description:
Oh my gosh. Basically, this place is amazing. My boyfriend and I just casually ordered a few appetizers to-go on a weeknight, not thinking we would die and go to modern Persian food heaven. Since we ordered to-go, we didn't get the dining experience here (although my bf did mention ambiance was sophisticated, nice bar area) so this review is based solely on food. 

We ordered kashk bademjan and pistachio meatballs with honey and pomegranate. Kashk bademjan was so flavorful, a bit heavy (then again, when is this not a heavy dish..) but was so worth kissing the calories goodbye. Pistachio meatballs were cooked perfectly. 

After writing this review, I just decided to go there again tonight. I can't wait to try everything else on the menu.
author: Beeta O.

description:
Really nice dinner! We pretty much went with what was recommended to us and weren't let down at all.

Service was on and off.. they were really attentive at the very beginning, but once we said we needed a few more minutes to look over the menu our server seemed to disappear for a long time. Not good as my friends were in town and hoping to catch the beginning of the Giants game. 

Still, enjoyed the food.. so flavorful, good use of flavors & textures.

Apps:
* yogurt marinated flat iron steak (herb salad ~ cucumber raita ~ lavash) $13
- The steak is delicious. It has a good charring, yet is so soft and medium-rare.
- These rolled into the mini lavash pieces with the delicious cucumber/ yogurt dip and the greens make wonderful little wraps.

Salads:
* dungeness crab salad (couscous ~ sumac ~ watercress ~ tomato ~ serrano chili) $14
- A delicious light salad! And so unique - its mostly a couscous column, topped with some greens, yet it's really light so yes I would consider it a salad too.
- The crab tops the couscous column and is really tender and blends well with everything in the salad. 
- I just wish the avocado pieces were cut smaller and mixed in more - rather than being three large chunks placed outside the couscous column.

Sides:
* crispy brussel sprouts (persian yogurt tartar) $6
- I'm obsessed with brussel sprouts and this is one of the best I've had. I always love it crispy and the yogurt / cucumber tartar is an amazingly unique addition.

Entrees:
* special: meatball with short rib/ duck, in peas/ lima beans $25
- This is basically a giant meatball with more rib inside! Really tender and delicious meat.
- The sauce is savory, and the veggies in the sauce a little plain (and a little undercooked - the lima beans were pretty hard.
- My friend had ordered duck but his meatball came with short rib, which he didnt mind nor complain about. But as he was finishing this, the server came and said they realized he had ordered the duck, and gave him an extra serving of duck leg in sauce, wild rice, cauliflower, and greens! The duck leg was extremely extremely tender and basically fell off the bone, yet kept the texture of the meat really well.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Good.  Some of the dishes are a little weird, but high quality.   The decor was nice.
author: Michael E.

description:
Chef Hoss Zare is breathing new life into Flytrap, a time-honored City institution, with his Mediterranean/French-inspired fare.

Upon entering, diners are immersed in a convivial, yet romantic, atmosphere.  The bar draws a good after-work crowd, which sometimes spills onto the ever-present "communal tables" in the front, while the long, narrow dining room holds closely spaced white linen clad tables arranged in intimate groupings.  A rear seating area is somewhat cave-like and devoid of atmosphere, so it's best to be seated in the main room.

From appetizers to scrumptious desserts, the food is delicious.  Topped with a tarragon-mustard vinaigrette, the crisp butter lettuce salad with crispy Parma prosciutto was a refreshing start to the meal.  "Yesterday's soup" was a cream of heirloom tomato topped with basil oil that was was the essence of summer.  Grilled Moroccan-style wild salmon served atop a bed of Israeli cous-cous and black-eyed peas was done to perfection--cooked all the way through, but still moist and juicy.  If only all vegetarian food were as good as the piquantly spicy vegetarian kufteh tabrizi with Mediterranean avocado salsa, mushrooms, and seven spice emulsion ...  Though delicious, it was the largest kefteh known to man and too large to finish.

The reasonably priced wine list is not extensive, but has selections that complement the somewhat spicy fare.  Consisting of bottles from France, Italy, and Spain, as well as other Mediterranean countries, it offers up a range of flavors and styles that will suit most diners.

The young, energetic wait staff was at once fun and knowledgeable about the menu.  Service was spot on.  Water glasses were always filled, and diners were never left wanting for wine.  Dishes arrived at appropriate times--not fast enough to be rushed, not slow enough cause patrons to fall asleep between courses.

Definitely not a tourist trap, Zaré at Flaytrap with its innovative flavor combinations is worthy of your hard-earned dining dollars.
author: CJ G.

description: Good food if slightly uninspired menu. The entrees were tasty enough. Friend said wine menu as good. The flourless chocolate cake was a bit dry.
author: Brian F.

description: Always a solid dining experience. The food is good, the drinks are great.
author: Drew P.

description: Great Mediterranean food with a twist with plenty of vegetarian options. Very fresh and delicious. Service was absolutely great. We arrived for an early dinner on a Sat. and the place still had plenty of seating. I imagine it is busier on the weekdays considering it's location. Most memorable dishes was the hummus platter with three kinds of hummus-beet, herb yogurt, and squash. Other dishes were great, just not as memorable. Minus a star for price, but definitely enjoyed the meal.
author: Parisha D.

description:
I was incredibly spoiled at my first trip to Zare at Fly Trap because I went with two regulars who knew the chef and the head bartender. Talk about first-class service! I was also impressed how much of an effort the head chef, Hoss, made to go to each table and meet all the diners.

Started the meal with their mussels and while decent and fresh... nothing to write home about. I enjoyed the mussels at Garcon (in the Mission) more. For my main, I got the pan-roasted cod and it came with mashed potatoes and some type of asparagus and fava bean gelee. It was delicious... everything was seasoned well (including the sides) and my fish wasn't overcooked.

My roommate ordered the short ribs, which came with a delicious Persian rice and some type of vegetable/bean stew. I found myself constantly picking at her plate. I really enjoyed the short rib and the whole combination with rice. I would order that again.

For dessert, I got the "not your grandma's pie" and it turned out to be a deconstructed pie! I was definitely surprised. The plate came with lemon curd, coconut meringue, coconut sorbet, and a drizzle of saffron-mint syrup. But everything was separate. While not bad at all, I think I'm just a normal pie enthusiast and would have enjoyed it more in its normal pie form. My roommate got the peach cobbler and that was amazing! I'm not a big crust person normally but it was super buttery and "homey" tasting. 

Our friend (the regular) described the food perfectly-- it's not Persian food, but it's more Western food with a Persian flair (and spices). I could not agree more. This isn't traditional Persian food at all.

I really enjoyed my dining experience here and would love to go back more often but it's definitely on the pricier side. It would be great to go back and celebrate a special occasion.
author: Jackie T.

description:
Persian / Mediterranean restaurant. Small, clean, welcoming, and very accommodating. Exotic flavors and well-balanced dishes. 

Highlights: The Mushroom Cake and Bone Marrow appetizers. Unique and extremely flavorful. Awesome!  A total delight. I HIGHLY recommend the 2005 Zind Humbrecht Alsacian White. Wild synergy with the Bergammon jelly on the Bone Marrow.  

The olives were just OK (need more Greeks). The Monday Meatball had a lamb, apricot and prune stuffing.  Just OK. 

Waitress Katie was personable, informative and prompt. A real gem. 

Amazing, eclectic selection at the bar. NOT your typical fare. 5 STARS!!

Definitely worth a trip for something more adventurous than your normal fare.
author: Bob B.

description:
They have a very unique menu with foods that you probably won't be able to find anywhere else -- bone marrow, pistachio meatballs, etc.

The flavors were very rich and exotic with many authentic flavored spices. They were definitely able to achieve the tartness in the sauces that are seen in many Persian dishes. It takes an adventurous tongue to appreciate the food here (and the prices).

Overall, it was a good experience, but I can't imagine myself coming back. The service was a bit slow, and they were only a bit crowded on a Thursday night.
author: Audrey L.

description: We love Fly Trap!  The cocktails, the food and most of all the staff make us feel completely at home and cared for whenever we eat there, which is often.  Valen, the new owner, runs a tight ship -- she was the bartender for years and knows everything about how to make a diner/drinker happy.  The food is exquisite, mediterranean flavors melding with European cuisine and California freshness.  We love everything we eat there.  The cocktails are carefully mixed and come out quickly.  There is nothing to complain about at Fly Trap.  We return often because it is like coming home to the best food , the best company and the nicest atmosphere.  In a food-frantic city like SF, Fly Trap is a shining gem.
author: Katharine H.

description:
Took my son here for his birthday! Sumtious meal, wonderful Lebanese wine, sinful dessert! We have all our celebrations here. Impress your friends! 
Lila C.
author: Lila C.

description:
Good ambience, good food, good cocktails. The kohlrabi soup was excccccellent! The kebab appies were a bit dry. Squids were pretty flavourful. Chicken was good, but not oh my god I'm having a flavorgasm good. It's like one of those places where you overall have a good experience, but you're not like BLOWN AWAY, you know? May be it is because I have had good tasting Persian food and it does not even remotely close to the taste here. If you are looking for Persian food, this certainly does not give you the right picture. If you're looking for food, yea sure, give er a shot. 

In short I'd say....nothing to complain about nor to write home about.
author: Reema M.

description:
We started with the bone marrow appetizer, it was soooooooo yummy and rich, definitely good fit for a savage carnivore. only thing was the bread was a bit on the hard/cold side...

For entries, we did seven-spice short rib, which was fork-pullable-delicious (although also not steamy hot...), and chicken with fessanjoon sauce, very moist and flavorful.

too full for dessert but the menu looked pretty good.

they gave us two virgin "minted memory" on the house cuz it was our anniversary. how nice! it was fresh and sour, very palate cleansing after a heavy meal ^^
author: Jenny Z.

description:
This place is absolutely delicious. I had dinner with a drink, an appetizer, the main course, and dessert so I was able to get a taste of everything. I had the Miveh Mule cocktail and it was fresh although a tad on the sweet side. 

My friend and I split the pistachio meatballs for the appetizer. The meatballs were moist and cooked perfectly. The sauce on top was just sweet enough to balance out the flavors and bring the whole dish together. 

I ordered the pan roasted salmon as an entree. The salmon was cooked medium rare and it was so delicate, and the crispy skin brought a different texture into each bite. The corn, tomato, and cucumber and the sauce made the dish lighter which I appreciated. The trofie pasta was perfect as well, chewy and enriched with the flavors of the entree.

The goat cheesecake is a must for dessert. It is rich so I would recommend splitting it with someone but it is such delicious cheesecake! You can definitely taste the goat cheese but it isn't overwhelming. 

Overall, Zaré has given one of the better meals that I have had at these kinds of restaurants in a long time. It delivered 100% on execution and flavors. I highly recommend it and will be coming back.
author: Brittany L.

description:
A mediterranean restaurant with a persian twist -- trendy, hip, unique, and fun! This restaurant is hidden in the SOMA, and had it not been for Yelp, I probably wouldn't have ever discovered it!

This cute little gem is warm and inviting with a hip appeal. The service is friendly and very professional. The food is unique and definitely worth coming back for!

We shared the vegetarian kufteh (a huge flavorful meatball-looking item filled with veggies), and the sourdough bread and lavash with feta-walnut and olive spread. Both were great appetizers and very filling! For entrees, I ordered the fulton valley spring chicken, which was really moist and delicious. The chicken sat on top of some fesenjoon (pomagranate-flavored curry sauce) and was accompanied with some wild rice. The best sauce I've had in a long time!! It was a huge portion that I definitely couldn't finish on my own. My friend ordered the lamb burger since it was a unique option on the menu, which was accompanied with french fries drizzled in olive oil.

The place was really cool and there was so much on the menu to try! I would even consider coming back and getting a variety of the smaller plates to share, tapas style. The quantity of food in each dish was generous, so sharing is easily possible.
author: Mansi A.

description:
The location is great, as you walk in you enter through a garden/patio area. Very inviting and serene. The interior has a great ambiance and the decor is that of a seaside cottage/french country. Enough about the decor, now let's get to the food....

Which middle eastern/Mediterranean place has spaghetti? I wish there would be more of a Persian influence than focus on the fusion. The dolmas appetizer was bland, the butternut squash spaghetti was overly spiced and lacked any other flavor, the dessert.....rose flavored baklava. WAY TOO SWEET it was dripping in sugar water. YUCK.

Oh and they brought out a hummus sampler while we were through our second course. Again focus on authentic flavors vs. fusion. Beet hummus?

I guess the lure of this place is that it can accommodate large groups, but what are you going to do when the food isn't palatable.
author: Kiran J.

description:
This place was really amazing. The decoration is so cute and unique. We had
For App-
bone marrow, turmeric, preserved lime, melon
pistachio meatballs, red harissa, honey, pomegranate 
Dinner
'abghoosht' braised lamb shank, tumeric, grilled tomato,
potato, chick peas, preserved lime 
chicken 'fesenjoon' two ways, roasted breast, confit l
egs, walnut, mint, cocoa tagliatelle 
Dessert
baklava

Everything was amazing.totally recommend this place
author: Semira J.

description:
Our meal here was excellent.  The service is good, the food did come too fast though, we prefer to enjoy our courses and rest with some wine in between.  Our waiter recommended the Lamb Shank, and it was definitely a perfect suggestion.  All of the food we had was excellent.  Chef Zare was in and out of the kitchen visiting tables and interacting, which made for a cool atmosphere.  We had delicious cocktails to start (amazing mixologist at the bar), and a delicious bottle of wine from the middle east.  Definitely would go back.

Our meal:

Pistacchio meatballs, Bone Marrow, and Eggplant appetizer to start

Lamb Shank for main course.

Goat cheese Cheese Cake for dessert.
author: Nic S.

description:
Prior to last night, I have had 2 meals at Fly Trap. While they were absolutely wonderful, nothing compared to my latest experience.

We started with appetizers of Bone Marrow (melted in my mouth), Pistachio Meatballs (what struck me the most was the consistency and oh that pomegranate sauce), the Kashk Bademjan (super flavorful), and the special Dolma (very good, but not mindblowing).

The entrees were something out of this world. We had the Arctic Char (and I'm still thinking about the crispy, perfectly executed skin, and the flavorful meat), the Lamb Shank (Perfection. Chef recommended wrapping the lamb meat in lavash and topping with pickled veggies. Super!), and the Duck (which I'm not a huge fan of, but this was beauty in my mouth). No dessert, unfortunately. Next time!

The service was truly impeccable. Our server was extremely attentive, yet not overbearing. These guys are wonderful. 

Overall, wonderful evening and I can't wait to go back.
author: Yelena E.

description:
The food is great with a spectrum of flavors exciting my pallet. Excellent, just in time service and quality drinks but extremely hot, sticky and humid. 

I can only assume they are trying to reproduce the conditions found in a Venus fly trap. I couldn't enjoy my dining experience sitting in a pool of my own sweat. 

Zaré at Fly Trap deserves five stars for well thought out dishes and attentive, knowledgeable service but its a sauna inside.  

I will be back and I'll update you on the weather.
author: Justin S.

description:
Disclaimer:  This review is for the bar/snacks only.

We come here about once a month for happy hour after work.  After Maya closed, we had to find a new place to convene and I'm so glad we found Zare.  The mixed cocktails are fantastic, the wine selection is good, and the small plates are perfect.  But the best part is the amazingly friendly and efficient bartender.  She is professional, funny, and bends over backwards to accommodate her customers.  It can get pretty busy, so I hope something new opens in Maya's space so that we can continue to find a place to sit at Zare!
author: Nicole G.

description:
Meh, not overly impressed by the food here. Service and drinks were good though!

I started off with a Pisco Sour; this is my staple and always my first tool to judge a bar. It was yummy so things started off good. Hubby had a dirty martini which I think he would have liked a little dirtier, but he didn't speak up on it so that was fine too.

To eat we had the hummus platter and calamari to start. Hummus platter wasn't awesome, we're perhaps a little snobby when it comes to hummus because we eat so often and make it so well at home. The platter had really small portions and was just ok, texture on two of the three just wasn't quite right. I also wasn't a fan of the chopped olives in one of them.  The calamari was awesome! Definitely recommend it, perfectly cooked and a lovely sauce/marinade with it.

For entrees I had the rigatoni, hubby had the beef cheeks. Cousins got the chicken and lamb. Rigatoni was ok, it had a nice kick to it, but the pasta was super plain, normally homemade pasta has this awesome richness to it and I found this one a little lacking. The beef cheeks were good, really delicious. 

Lamb was ok, I feel like Bay Area restaurants have a lot of great lamb dishes, probably because of the diversity of customers, so I have high expectations of lamb, this way just ok.

For dessert we shared the flour less chocolate torte cake, meh. Bland. Dry. Perhaps that's a flour less thing?

All in all. If I'm in the area I'll definitely stop by and have a cocktail and some calamari.

FYI - for the amount we are and drunk I feel the price was reasonable. 

Also, service really was good, friendly, informative, attentive. He made the night for us.
author: Kym P.

description:
The service here is awesome! Our group of 12 got to the restaurant 30 minutes early on a Saturday night (when does that ever happen, right?) and they already had our table ready for us. It helps that this place was not super packed like other 4-star SF eats, but don't let the emptiness fool you because this place is worth a try.

Food: The concept of Mediterranean/Persian fusion was definitely intriguing when I made the reservations. The food didn't blow me away, but everyone cleaned their plates. I would highly recommend their cocktails - Cardamom My Dearest was quite tasty.   
-Pistachio meatballs: Who doesn't love meatballs? I honestly couldn't taste the pistachio all that much but the honey pomegranate glaze was to die for.
-Beef filet tips: Tender cuts of beef in a spicy curry cream sauce. Yum.
-Bone Marrow: My first time officially eating bone marrow. Little fork. Lots of digging. Not much payoff. Creamy texture, earthy musty taste. Went well with toasted baguettes and salt. I would say this is an acquired taste. ;)
-Roasted cauliflower: This was unfortunately quite disappointing, lacked flavor that usually comes with roasted buttery anything.

Atmosphere: Dimly lit, charming decor, intimate ambiance. Tables are nicely spaced so you don't feel like you're listening in on your neighbors' conversations.
author: Connie C.

description:
Zare is wonderful. I love how Hoss has modernized Iranian cuisine-- the dishes are inventive, but stay true to their Iranian roots. I have come here 6 or 7 times and am always happy with my experience. 

Try the meatballs- they are to DIE for. The desserts too....oh just try everything!
author: Roxana G.

description: We came here for dinner while visiting SF. Good ambience and service! We ordered Marinated Chicken Breast Jerusalem and the Zaré Lamb Burger, both of which were great! Our server, Nina, was great and explained the items on the menu in great detail.
author: Abby Z.

description: The food here is ok. The service was very good. I don't think anything there was very memorable, so I don't think I would rush to come back. I got the pistachio meatballs, stuffed quail and the goat cheese cake. It was pretty good but nothing too exciting.
author: V N.

description: We enjoyed the beef cheek and spaghetti squash.  The rest was less memorable.  Dessert special of the day was unique and just right.  I think it was ice cream with pistachio, berries and white candy fluff?   The table was sticky and dining in the bar area was a BOOM.  Server was kind and attentive.  I think the chef brought out our fries but he didn't stay to smooze with us probably bc we only had eyes for the fries.
author: amee m.

description:
I can't understand giving Zare at Fly Trap anything less than 5 stars.  

I guess if you don't like Mediterranean food served by very attentive staff in a wonderful, small, noise free environment, then Zare is not for you.  Please go somewhere else.

Otherwise, this was one of my favorite restaurants in the neighborhood when I lived there, can't wait to go back.  I have been there at least a dozen times and each time it was consistently good. 

Bravo to Zare and the staff.
author: John H.

description:
I heart this place!

Can't believe that it has taken me this long to write a review. I always sit at the bar with friends and the bartenders are fantastic. Valen is a rockstar! All time fave orders are the following:

Pistachio Meatballs- Listed on the 7x7SF list. (need I say more) Was in love with them before they made the list! (for the record;-)

Smoked Trout and cucumber- Cucumber is shredded into a spaghetti pasta shape, so it feels like you're eating pasta. 

Salads- all are good and change with the seasonal freshness!

Those are my "go to" items, but have had just about everything on the menu! It's all good! I'm a share bear, so wish they had an app size lamb shank dish for when I am sharing with a girlfriend. Good to go when you're hungry because the top three items above are must orders!
author: Gina H.

description:
Started with bone marrow, moved on to potato and bacon soup, and finished with baklava.

Bone marrow was as expected, but the fruit accompaniment was very good. Pickles were unexpectedly strong, but good. 

Soup was ok. Thick. The bacon goes well with the potato.

Baklava was not traditional(fine by me!), with sweet cream and fruit between each sheet. I don't actually think the soft texture of the cream and fruit went very well with the texture of baklava sheets, but the flavor was good.
author: Nick C.

description:
I came here with a friend for dinner because I chose this place from the 7x7 list and the fact that open table  allowed me to make reservations. First off it was nice that they called to confirm reservations and when we walked in to give them my name, it felt like they were waiting for us and seated us immediately. 

The server was very friendly and made very good recommendations. I ordered the pisco sour which was very smooth and sweet. Just right for a starting drink. I had to try the pistachio meatballs because it was recommended by 7x7. My friend ordered the dolmeh because the server made it sound so good. It was delicious, the quinoa, greek yogurt, and everything else complemented each other very well. The pistachio meatballs were very good and I really enjoyed the sauce, but I liked my friends appetizer more. 

For the main entree, I ordered the braised rabbit pasta and my friend ordered arctic char. The pasta was very well made, it wasn't too soft nor too hard, the pasta had a very good texture. The rabbit was well made and a very good recommendation from the server. 

Dessert was also one of the best parts of our meal. I ordered the pistachio buttered crepe with pistachio ice cream. I was surprised that the crepe caught my attention more than the ice cream. I've never liked pistachios this much before. My friend ordered the baklava. She loved every bit of it and what really made it better was the fact that the chef actually came out and describe the makings of the baklava. 

The service was excellent, they always refilled our water carafe before it was empty and was very attentive to us yet respectful of our privacy and conversation. The host and chef both greeted us as we walked out. 

I will most definitely go back again to try the other items on the menu. ^.^
author: Jeffrey W.

description:
Yum! Had referrals to go to this place and it did not disappoint me at all. Tried the meatball appetizer and eggplant appetizer. Both savory and easy to share. Went with my gf and it was romantic but not too over the top. Price point was super fair for what we had. 

The drinks were delicious and very signature. Miveh Mule all day delicious!

Then shared the pork shoulder with Brussel Sprouts and tartar sauce which was also quite flavorful. 

For dessert had the chocolate tort and it was amazing. Great ambiance great food new favorite place to go.
author: Mike T.

description:
I've been to this place about a handful of times and have had great experiences. Most dishes are very tasty and flavorful. I really like the way they fuse the eastern and western cuisines - although stated as Persian, this is not a traditional Persian restaurant. 

My favorite dish is the pistachio-pomegranate meatballs, served as an appetizer - very tasty and not to be missed!
The lamb shank and the duck are also quite tasty. 

For drinks, if you are up for trying the mediterranean cocktails, try "cardamom my dearest" and/or "anar daiquiri" - you won't be disappointed. :)

And for desert, I would never say no to "baklava"! ...and theirs is good! The cardamom panna cotta is also great if you like cardamom. 

Overall, the setting, staff and food combination makes it a pleasant place to go back to.
author: Azi Z.

description: The arugula salad with avocado and cashews was flavorful and beautifully presented. Interesting wines by the glass. Attentive staff.
author: Karen M.

description:
Had dinner with a friend on Thursday at 5pm. It was very loud b/c there were people at the bar area for the happy hour (it was also on the day there was a Giant's game, so some people were hydrating before the game)...

Food was excellent - on a pricier side, but very very good. We had duck and salmon. Both were very flavorful and worth coming back for. 

Service was as good as it gets - 5 stars for sure! Great care, recommendations, seamless when not needed. 

Will definitely come back for more!
author: Natalie M.

description: Phenomenal in one word!  We ended up sitting at the bar in order to stay away from the front door and the evening chill.  The bartebder was attentive in just the right amountI had the special which was a large meatball stuffed with spices, chicken and small mushrooms in a mild lemon broth!   My sister had the roasted chicken which was moist equally as good!  Dessert of course!....the goat cheesecake....wonderful!
author: Tena M.

description: This is by far one of my fav restaurants in SF. The food makes your mouth water. All the ingredients are fresh and organic. The drinks are soooo delicious it is dangerous :). The owner is such and nice person and really gets to know his customers. An all are decadent experience.
author: Rosie F.

description:
What we ordered:

-lavash and 3 kinds of hummus
-pistachio meatballs
-braised lamb and lamb ragu

Pistachio meatballs were pretty good but not mind blowing.
Hummus varieties were really unique and tasty.
Braised lamb was very delicious. I would recommend this entree. 
Service was good.

Cocktails were great - try the minted memory!
author: M L.

description: Impeccable. Wonderful service. Inspired meals. Attention to detail. Feels seamless and effortless. Completely the way it should be.
author: Ann D.

description:
The menu was very unique - cheek and tongue on the menu. I had the chicken, my friend had the lamb dish, and another had the sliders. We were all happy with our dishes

Our server was friendly and recommended some great dishes. 

They had Petrus on the beer menu!
author: Colleen L.

description:
I have passed this place easily  100 times and always meant to visit. I really love middle east spices and they have those down here. Interior is cozy, kinds of a casual bar and some private tables for 2 or  4  in the back. We were lucky to do a walk in at  7:00 on a Sat  eve. no waiting, we tried 4 items, 
Spring Salad w/  roasted beets, butternut squash, kale, chicories, pumpkin seeds, goat cheese, balsamic dressing ( could have used a bit more kick but the  - the  seasoning was there) 
Pistachio Meatballs- Outstanding choice ,very unique complex flavors in a rich sauce def. a signature dish 
Braised Lamb w/ potato, chick peas, turmeric, preserved lime, lavash and torshi- Good not great, kind of depends what you  want from these dishes, a little more richness maybe. 
Pearl Cous Cous Cacciucco - Kind of an Iranian Cioppino, prawns, dungeness crab, baby octopus, calamari, clams, mussels, sumac aioli- The flavors  were great bright, fresh fish with a crispy toast on the side.  I could eat  2 of these. Another winner & signature dish. This is worth a 2nd visit.
The wine list  was  very good for the menu even by the glass.
Did not get to desserts , but they sounded really good.
Service  was attentive and friendly. 
Food is unique,and ethnic with a Cali sensibility,  professionally prepared, atmosphere can be romantic, not too noisy, perfect for couple or small groups of friends.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
Came here on a friend's suggestion when it was one of only a few options open late.  Glad we did!
- Some pretty creative cocktails: "cardamom my dearest" had - yes - cardamom, and it was surprisingly satisfying in a martini despite my expectation that it would be terrible.
- Bone Marrow: yes, at 11pm you can get a delicious plate of beef bone marrow for $14.  Will such wonders never cease?!
- We also had mushroom cake, a latte, and a cheesecake according to my receipt.  I wasn't exactly wasted from the martini so they must have just been OK.  
- Oh, wait a minute.  The cheesecake was GOAT cheese cheesecake.  I also expected this to be terrible (I sound like such a philistine today) but it was everything you'd want it to be: a little less overwhelmingly sweet than cheesecake can be, without "too much" of that tangy goat dairy taste.  I recommend it, but probably split it because this taste is too exotic for most.
author: Aaron M.

description: Really excellent food. They catered for us and they were really professional. Provided food for 300 people and even went back to the restaurant to get more when we started to run out! The hummus trio was fantastic. The lamb was so wonderful and tender. They are really so wonderful. Waiting to go to the restaurant but if it's anything like the catering, I know it will be fantastic!
author: Erica J.

description: We have always heard about Fly Trap, but never made it. Glad we finally had dinner there. Service was friendly and fabulous, and food has an Iranian/Persian twist. We were introduced to new flavors that the entire family enjoyed. We need to go back to try more of the entrees! Dessert (poached apple) was divine.
author: Denise C.

description:
While trying to plan my friend's Quarter of a Century B-day Bash this past Saturday, we came across Zare on YELP. We planned to go to Manor West that night and Zare was nearby, had good reviews, so Zare it was. 

DRINKS: 
Zare has a very unique cocktails like Persian Breakfast (grape vodka, honey, and egg white), Minted Memory (gin, pimm's #1, and malted vinegar syrup), and Cardamam My Dearest (gin, cardamam, and lime). 

I opted for the Persian Breakfast. It was ok; I didn't taste the grape in the vodka and it wasn't as stiff as I would like it to be. Although the egg white did add some oomph to the drink and made it taste like a light dessert.

FOOD: 
*Fries w/ Aioli sauce: The fries were skinny fries and were very crispy and light. The aioli sauce had a hint of garlic and spice and was perfect complement to the fries.

*Filet Mignon w/ Gorgonzola, Dates, Watercress, and Potato Gratin (which I substituted w/ green beans): WOW! The filet mignon was cooked to a perfect medium rare and had a nice outer crust which sealed in the juices. It was tender and full of flavor. The filet was accompanied with a wine mushroom reduction which was savory, and very rich in flavor as opposed to salty. The dates added just the right of sweetness to the dish and the watercress helped balance out the richness of the dish. I opted out of the gratin and got the green beans lightly sautéed in olive oil. They were a vibrant green color and was cooked to an al-dente. My only complaint--did someone steal the gorgonzola cheese from my plate b/c there were none?!?!?!

I would have liked to try the goat cheese cheesecake based on the good reviews, but we brought in a b-day cake. As a side note, there is a slicing fee of $3/person.

SERVICE:
The hostess (Mario?) is the most tolerant person I know. I must have changed the reservations about 4 times and he was very accommodating and never gave me the slightest attitude. Even when we got there, our party size changed again and I informed him and he said, "it was quite alright".

Our waiter had spilled a beaker of water on one of the guys in our party...and the resolution? The manager gave his sincere apologies and a half bottle of wine to boot! Wow...that's going beyond the call of customer service!!!

However, service can be quite slow esp with a large party. It took about 40-45 min for our party of 13 to get our entrees.

AMBIANCE: 
Zare is very charming, and quaint. There is significant room between tables, so you don't feel closed in or have to overhear your neighbors' convo.  Décor is very simple yet elegant; wooden tables, wooden floors, crisp white table cloths, red pillars, and antique style paintings that surround the wall.

PARKING: 
Easy street parking on weekends since surrounding local businesses/offices are only open from M-F. 

Overall, I would recommend Zare as a great date place because prices aren't too bad (entrees $20-$27), and you can enjoy great food while having an audible conversation in an charming, cozy environment.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Oxtail was awesome
Fries and saffron dip was awesome
Service was great
Food came quick
ambiance was great too.
author: Brian T.

description:
I'm impressed BIG TIME!!!
I go to restaurants a lot, fancy ones too. & I should confess I'm impressed with this Persian/Mediterranean fusion BIG TIME! We were a group of 5. Ordered the Grilled Naan, flat iron steak, & shishito pepper appetizers and were blown away by the taste, combination of different flavors, quality, and presentation.  We were talking about how good the appetizers were until we got the main dish: braised short rib, braised beef cheek, braised lamb abgoosht, and summer vegetable spaghetti. OH MY OH MY... You can cut the beef with a spoon it's sooooooo soft!! So flavorful so delicious!! With every bite you hear all your cells shouting "thank you thank you!" 
I couldn't believe i'd be more impressed after the appetizers, but I was... All of us were..! 
Then came the desert menu. We were all full but couldn't resist trying the chef's spin on the traditional deserts; yet again another fantastic experience. We got the baclava, yogurt pudding and the rice noodle faloodeh. We got a complimentary apple pudding too. Can't say enough how great this experience was. The baclava is the lightest you'll ever try. The yogurt pudding so mildly sweet. Faloodeh was tart, as we were told, and we loved it. The apple pudding was tender & of course delish like everything else. 
This is a must go place, & it just became one reason for me to go to SF!
I hope they open an LA location.
author: Jellie M.

description:
Overpriced for the quality of food.

I don't know if it was an off night for them but for the food was not up to par.

$13 for their baby octopus and calamari salad - octopus was grilled a bit too much making it a bit chewy. The watermelon side that came with it was refreshing but that was about it. The so called lemon confit vinaigrette that was pour all over the dish was really overpowering both in smell and taste, I wouldn't be surprised if they told me it was straight vinegar. 

$29 pork shoulder entree - way too fatty, there were chunks of fat that made it hard to eat and it was overcooked making the meat chewy. The veggies were nicely al dente and wild rice cooked well but it was too oily. Their rock shrimp was decent, some pieces a bit too salty. The banana sauce (it seems to have mustard seeds?) that came with it was interesting and I'm not sure how I feel about it. The dish didn't really feel like it came together very well... For this price, I expected a decent entree. One can argue whether the portion was right for the price or not but I'm someone who care more about quality than quantity so I'm not judging my review on the portion as much here.

1 star for nice ambiance and another star for the service.
author: Do K.

description:
3.5 stars

Fly Trap accepts reservations. Make one because it's very popular. We came here last minute without reservations because another Persian restaurant was closed for a private party. The hostess at first told us to wait at the bar (20-30 min), but she later found us and said she rearranged tables so that we could get seated. 

We had no trouble ordering a few things family style:
Persimmon and Wild Arugula Salad
- delicious
Pistachio Meatballs - really can't go wrong with meatballs
Grilled Stuffed Calamari - I'd skip this. Small quantity and I misread, and was expecting Fried. My friends liked it, but I didn't care for it. Tasted too smokey and charred.
Cinnamon Braised Beef Cheek - fall off the bone tender meat. Good!
Braised Lamb "Abgoosht" - this dish made family style worth it since it came with pita pieces to fill you up more. You can also use pita for the beef cheek dish too and mix everything together.

Definitely some of the pricier entrees at $28 (reason why they're 3.5 instead of 4 stars), but with three people it wasn't so bad sharing all the dishes. I didn't leave starving or full.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Unbelievable food! So delicious and so creative. Great service Gabrielle was so sweet.
author: Sahar G.

description: The decor inside was very nice and the cocktails and wine were very good and reasonably priced.  That's the upside.  The downside is that the food is average at best and for a $200 meal (with tax and tip), is massively overpriced.  My chicken was very average at best and my partner's seafood was over cooked and definitely not worth the $30.  Overall it was a very average restaurant trying to be something that it's not (i.e. a good restaurant where you leave feeling good about spending $200 on a decent meal for 2 people).
author: Justin H.

description: This is a cute restaurant but their food is definitely below average. perhaps its the area? we got the bone marrow app, lamb burger and lamb chops - bone marrow was gross, not because i don't like bone marrow because i do... but because it smelled and tasted like a certain male body fluid... (use your imagination). we couldn't eat it. my lamb burger was ok, nothing special - how can anyone mess up a burger? the lamb chops had the same hint of taste and smell to it than the bone marrow - yuk. the bill was almost $200 for two with drinks and tips - not worth it. we came out hungry.
author: Alex M.

description: Very disappointed of this place and I'm not coming back anymore.very unfriendly staff and one of them was very rude as we'll too.Food taste was horrible and yuk.not even close to persian food
author: Nastaran G.

description:
Zare was a surprise and a half...Seriously...my only disappointment came from me not realizing how amazing, yummy, cozy and fancy it was.  For if I did, I would have used it for an upcoming date night instead of some random monday night spontaneous date-esque thing when really we just needed grub.  

So, monday night...its after work and we are hungry...and lazy.  I was staying over in the financial district and we decided that was about as far as we wanted to walk for food.  preferably even drive.  Sadly no valet but luckily parking isn't too bad, on a non-giants game monday evening.   I yelped (obviously) the area and Zare at Fly Trap came up...never heard of it but when I got there and saw the red awning on the road I take regularly when I walk to work I was pretty stoked...

The ambiance is dark, mellow, kind of yellow, with great wall paper and dim lights.  The food is fresh...pistachio meat balls were yum (thanks again yelp) with some great spices...and the scallops with asparagus was incredible and I would order it again...and again.  It came with small red roasted potatoes that were dipped in mashed potatoes.  What do I love more than potatoes? Potatoes squared! 

The wine list was pretty decent...and the cocktails looked creative though I didn't try them.  We ended the night with lattes and goat cheesecake.  

This would be a great place for a date, an after dinner drink, or a place to talk business...if you were in that kind of business...where you met over food to talk business. Seriously, in my next life.  The place is not cheap but worth every penny.

I will most definitely be back!
author: Kierstan G.

description:
Zaré at Fly Trap has been on my radar ever since I heard about Hoss Zaré's giant meatballs. Alas, his meatballs are only available on Monday evenings but we bellied up to the bar anyhow for some cocktails and bar snacks. 

The menu is a virtual trip around the Mediterranean. We ordered the Arancini (saffron risotto balls with spicy marinara - Buongiorno, Italia!) French Fries with saffron aioli (Bonjour, France!) and the Zaré Lamb Burger with sumac and Persian pickles (Salâm, Iran!) The bar bites are reasonably priced and über tasty. 

The cocktail list is quite interesting, featuring both Barbary Coast and Mediterranean specialties - I was partial to the Agave Daisy but was tempted by many other selections. While the dining room looked inviting, the bar was definitely more my style. 

I can't wait to return on a Monday evening to tuck into those famous meatballs!
author: phil h.

description: Brittni at the bar is awesome!!! Great drinks and awesome conversation. The food is delicious too.
author: John R.

description: Wonderful little place in the heart of San Francisco. The food is amazing. I had the cod fish which was basically put together by god himself because it tasted like heaven. My wife had the sirloin which she described as being kissed by Jesus himself. The staff there is very friendly as well. We recommend this place to anyone visiting San Fran for the first time like us.
author: Leury H.

description: Everything from the fabulous food, to the cozy ambience, perfectly sized wine list and lovely service was perfect. Will absolutely be a repeat offender!! Bon Apetit!
author: Erin K.

description: just had a fantastic meal with my friend here tonight - I didn't know what to expect but it was all so well executed and creatively delicious! Our server was Gabriel who was super welcoming and sweet and answered all of my many questions (I'm on a restrictive diet). Food was superb and service was wonderful - you can't beat that combo!
author: Skye B.

description: The food and drinks were amazing. My favorite dishes were the hummus trio and goat cheesecake.
author: Hoda F.

description:
This review is long overdue- I went here a few months ago with some friends who were in town. We chose this place b/c it was supposed to have some veggie friendly options.  Well lets just say the vegetarians ate mostly french fries. The veggie options were actually kind of gross. 

The meat balls were really tasty. But thats about all I can remember from the meal. 

Call it a decent option if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Komal B.

description:
Positive: Minted Memory

The Minted Memory, is one of my favorite cucumber mint drinks. Refreshing, light, sweet, with just the right amount of citrus, it's a great drink for the sunny afternoon.
author: Sue Y.

description: This classy little bar is one of my favorite happy hour places. For a place with no TV, they can certainly pack it in after work. Valen is an awesome gal and will take care of you drink after drink. I can't say much about the food since I've only drank here (a lot) but I hear it's great...
author: James T.

description: Delicious food and great ambiance! Would definitely go back. Slightly pricey but one of the spots I'd actually be willing to go back for. Great brussel sprouts and lots of them too!
author: Jocy V.

description:
For some reason I thought this place was  bigger inside after having passed by it for years (yes, I said years) but never gone inside. Well, let me tell you, what a mistake this was. Both on the size and the never going in!

The bar area has really comfortable stools and the bartender even had an iPhone charger behind the bar for my friends dead phone. She made me cocktails that weren't on the menu just by me telling her what I liked and they were spot on. Not one complaint about the bar, drinks or bartender and I will now go back there regularly.

There were 4 of us for dinner. 3 meat eaters and one veggie. 

Appetizers: We ordered the dolma and the meatballs. The dolma wasn't your standard grape leaves (which btw I'm a huge fan of) but rather a poblano (or something of the like) pepper with tomato, onion and some other fillings with a creamy yogurt sauce. The lamb meatballs were to DIE for! That pomegranite glaze is just off the HOOK! Note: they have Meatball Mondays there. I think I'll be hitting that up soon! 

Mains: Ordered the lamb, arctic char, pork chop and the risotto. 
Lamb: I'm not sure why others had an issue with this. I thought it was perfectly done and flavorful. Loved all the veggies that came with it, too. They give you a side of this pickled sauce and some lavash so you can make your own lamnb "tacos". My mouth is watering just thinking about it!

Pork chop: The waitress said it was about 7 oz. She's on crack. This was a HUGE pork chop that was cooked to perfection. Juicy, succulent and perfectly seasoned. 

Arctic char: Never had arctic char before but it had really nice crispy skin and the flavor and color were reminiscent of salmon. Served with bulgar and some parsnips. Ont he lighter side. Very good though! 

Risotto cakes: HUGE portion. Lots of veggies and mushrooms to go along with these perfectly golden risotto cakes. It's really worth it!

Desserts: Skip the pistachio crepes. The ice cream was gritty and the crepes were blah. What stood out were the baklava and the cheese cake. Both were awesome! 

I can't wait to go back here again!
author: Amy B.

description:
What a great find! We yelped for top places close to our hotel. This place was #1 :) we walked less than 5 minutes from the Marriott hotel. With out a reservation we got seated at around 7:45 no problem. Everyone was very friendly. This place according to the menu is the 5th oldest restaurant in SF. First started by an Italian immigrant back in 1883 changed locations once due to the fire passed down through loyal employee's.  The current owner/chef has created a brilliant menu of Mediterranean food with a modern touch from his Persian roots. Excellent hand crafted cocktails. Through out our evening we had the chef and the bartender at our table. They take great pride in personal connection with the customer which was one of the original establishments
mantras.  The menus has plenty to choose from great dishes with excellent flavors. We tried the Lamb Tongue it was excellent, Warm Dates/ pear salad also very good. I don't remember what else we got but everything was great.  Pretty good value ( I love me some Value !) it would be hard but if you skip cocktails you can easily get a lovely dinner for two for a great price. But trust me you don't want to miss the drinks :)  The atmosphere was excellent also with some nice tunes playing in the background.  
Looking forward to going here again for sure !!
author: James F.

description:
Really good restaurant for trying something different. I was struck by the professionalism of the staff. We had brought a 2000 Chateau Musar that unfortunately leaked through the cork. The wine was pretty oxydized. Our server politely told us that it would probably be fine though it obviously wouldn't be. It was a wine we had been saving for a special occasion and I appreciated him letting us figure out if we would drink it or not anyway (we did). 
Central Asian food is wonderful for it's unusual use of spices and sauces. We had kashkeh bademjan, the pistachios meat balls, Pearl Cous Cous Cacciucco, Abgoosht and for desert Faloudeh. All of them were excellent. I knocked off one star for the one off note for the night. I ordered a Sauternes which came far too cold. A Sauternes very distant from room temperature is pretty amateur and puzzled me because everything up to that point had been perfect. After taking a few minutes to warm up the Sauternes so I could smell and taste it, I immediately understood the issue; the nose was good but it was probably the poorest Sauternes I've ever tasted. It struck me as wrong to simply chill a substandard Sauternes rather than sell the rest of your bottles to a local store and get some acceptable wines.
author: Marlin L.

description:
The Fly Trap is a hidden gem in SOMA.  It's small, quiet, with nice décor, good service and flavorful food.  We came knowing we want lamb (since Mediterranean lamb dishes are usually wonderful)...we ordered: 

1. Pistachio Meatballs:  one of their signature appetizers.  Couldn't really taste the pistachio in the meatballs, but loved the sweet/tart flavor pairing with the  pomegranate sauce 

2. Grilled Lamb Sirloin:  a simple grilled lamb dish, meat was nice and tender 

3. Braised Lamb "Abgoosht":  highly recommended by the waiter (think it was his favorite dish!)  It's a lamb stew with chickpeas & potatoes; came with flat bread on the side....eat DIY burrito style.  The meat was very tender and filled with flavors

4. Goat Cheesecake:  it was soft and fluffy with a very strong goat milk flavor.  Wasn't overly rich or sweet

5. Cucumber Yogurt Pudding:  a very unique dessert dish!  If you like yogurt, like cucumber, you'll enjoy this combination.  It's clean, refreshing, and not overly sweet.  And supposedly, yogurt helps with digestion after a heart meal (such as 2 lamb entrées!)

Our server was very knowledgeable, friendly, attentive (our water was constantly being filled, plates were cleared timely), and since the restaurant wasn't crowded on a Monday, we were able linger after paying the check.  It was overall a nice dining experience!
author: D C.

description:
The best part of my dinner at Zare last night was actually the wine.  We shared a 2004 Tempranillo, which had a great plumy bouquet, a chocolatey middle and a soft silky finish.  It went great with my lamb burger with sumac, persian pickles and french fries.  My buddy ordered the braised duck legs with basmati rice, almonds, candied citrus and barberries.  I tried part of his dish and found it to be much tastier than the lamb.  For dessert we split a a starter (men are so different than women).  We shared the cinnamon braised lamb tongue, which was amazing.  The wine worked well for the entire meal.  

The atmosphere at Zare on a Thursday night at 9:30pm was lively but not crowded.  Clearly these were patrons who like a good late meal and a glass of wine.      The service was very friendly and we were not rushed.  I may be back again soon.
author: John M.

description:
Great tasty food, with efficient (but sometimes too formal) staff. After a bill exceeding $500, one additional $3 coffee was ordered, the staff rudely insisted it be paid promptly, as there was another group due soon. 
Yelp says this is a good place for vegetarians, this is wrong. There were no vegetarian main courses available.
author: Ian C.

description:
Persian fusion -- who knew this was a new trend?!  Cool, I'm in to it...  

I visited Zare @ Fly Trap with two friends while visiting San Fran -- I would say it was pretty tasty, just over priced.  And, unfortunately, that does equate to lower stars.  When your food is at a certain price point ($30/ plate for smaller portions for entrees, etc), you expect AMAZING food.  Zare left us all wanting...  

Flavors just weren't what we expected (they all needed "a swift kick in the ass" as one friend said) and since when do you order mussels with little to no broth (the irony was that there was bread served with it, but no broth to dip it in, which is the point of the bread!).  We also ordered several veggie dishes and a salad with trout, which was unusual.  I am open to new flavors, but these dishes all needed more intense flavor...  we all felt like we missed out when we left and didn't feel the rush to get back there any time soon.

All in all, nice place, cute/ cozy, just too pricey for what it is.  If the price was lower, it would have easily gotten 4 stars..  (Honestly, I think I'm being nice with 3 stars, because it's probably really around 2 1/2).
author: Heather V.

description:
I would say only come here if you dont paying for your own meal

Food is overpriced and not that great. Yes their pistachio meatballs are interesting but not to die for. I went a couple of months ago for a company dinner and many of us got the fish thinking it'd be delicious but it was dry. We a party of 10 and most of us didnt finish our dishes because they weren't good (not because we were stuffed). the service was also extra extra slow. we waited a good 20 minutes just to get the check. the cocktails are decent- not sure if they have a bar only section but that would be an option for me since it had a fun ambiance.
author: Janet Y.

description:
Yelp calls this place out as great for vegetarians, but I must respectfully disagree.  As a veggie, there are all of about 3 things (all appetizers/sides!) on the menu that you can order.  Note:  They used to have a separate vegetarian menu that you could ask for, but stopped offering that earlier this year.

Went here with a few friends who decided to eat veggie for me so that we could all share.  The vegetarian small plates that we got were fine, but nothing to write home about.  The restaurant is very cute - great ambience and decent service.  However, if you're vegetarian, you'll end up paying quite a bit for a bunch of overpriced and mediocre appetizers.  AND you'll leave feeling hungry.  I won't be going back.
author: Gowri R.

description:
Zare at Fly Trap features Mediterranean cuisine with strong Persian influences. The menu is ever-changing, and produce is sourced from the Bay Area's farmers markets - keeping things fresh and local. I've dined at Zare at Fly Trap twice: once for dinner with my beautiful college roomies and another for lunch with my awesome coworkers. Both times were completely different experiences but equally satisfying. 

Lunch: It's a more casual environment, where you order at the bar and the server brings out your order to your table. Much like any other counter service. This time, we were in a larger group of eight and the place was semi-empty (word hadn't caught on of their new lunch hours), so the server offered to just take our orders from our table. They have a light and affordable menu, and I opted for a chicken wrap with a side salad. Only disappointment was my tea. I thought I'd get authentic Persian tea - with the rose water and all - but instead it was from a tea bag. However, it was a gorgeous day; the weather was perfect, the sun was shining and overall it was a great lunch. Everyone in our lunch group recommended Zare to the other coworkers planning out their lunch groups for the week.

Dinner: When the sun sets, the restaurant is a completely different experience. Dinnertime is sex-ay. It's dark, the restaurant has a rich aroma of Persian spices and light incense; and if it's a Friday night, they've got a full house. We started with a couple of plates of Pistachio Meatballs. Do order this. The texture from the pistachios is unique without the flavor being overbearing; but the highlight of this dish is the sweet, semi-syrupy pomegranate glaze. You'll find bits of pomegranate - and go ahead, it 'em with seeds and all. They're cook just right so you won't taste the bitterness of the seeds. There are plenty of fish entrees for the pescatarians in your group; this time, I went for ... wait. I can't even remember. I think it was the night's special scallops - but I honestly can't even tell you. Goes to show it was those meatballs that left a lasting impression on me. (We did have a few cocktails and bottles of wine).
author: Farrah A.

description:
I've lived in San Francisco for more than 14 years now, and honestly never heard of Zare at Fly Trap until this weekend.  After my overpriced and lackluster dining experience, I wish I never heard of it.  As a sales executive, it's my job to entertain my clients and know a good restaurant when I find one.  The ambiance is fine, however the food and service needs significant improvement for the price.  The bill came out to be almost $100 a person for an appetizer, entree, and dessert --alcohol not even included. For that price, I could have easily gone to another fine dining restaurant, and the food would have tasted much better.  

The one thing they did right is the name of the establishment, Zare at Fly Trap.  Trap is definitely the right word here.  

Yelpers and foodies beware!
author: Steve C.

description:
Awesome Mediterranean place.

5 Stars for service.
5 Stars for Mushroom "pie" (no flour) appetizer and Baclava dessert (best and fanciest I've ever had).
4 Stars for Brussel Sprouts (and I don't ever like them!)
3 Stars for Lamb Shank
4 Stars for Ambiance (a bit basic for this level)

They were out of the roast goat dish.

I will definitely go back (and maybe try the goat and the bone marrow).
author: Mike L.

description:
We went there for a friends bday and had a party of 18 and a set menu. We ordered drinks at the bar as well and we spent well over 2k as a group. 
YET,
1. they charge us for extra bread????
2. We had 17 people instead of 18 so they charge us for 18 plates and we try to reason with the general manager but he gives us a bunch of lame excuses and rules when we spend 2k at your restaurant?? What is $50 bucks vs 17 frustrated and angry customers about to go on yelp and tell everyone about it? Ridiculous. 
3. the filet steak was NOT GOOD. tender but flavorless! 

Poor customer service at the end and the general manager does NOT treat everyone the same. Maybe it was b/c we looked like young asian college kids but we were all 25-35 yrs old.
author: David K.

description:
Two words that sum up my experience at Zare: SAD TIMES

Here is the breakdown:

Pre-dinner:
Drinks: the drinks were really good, and the bartender was also very helpful and nice.

Dinner ( I was so hungry by the time the food came out):
Appetizers: I had the lamb sausage, which was also really good. This was the highlight of my meal.
Main Course:  The filet minon was just awful. It was so bland and rubber-like that I couldn't even get myself to eat it. ( This says a lot because when I'm hungry, everything tastes good. ) Sadly,
all I could think about was going to In and out for a cheeseburger.

Dessert: I had some chocolate cake, which was okay.. The cake tasted like this 3-layered chocolate cake I bought from costco.

After Dinner- the bill (the bill came out to be about $100/person without drinks):
We had questions about our bill, so we asked the general manager to answer them for us. To make things short, let's just say the general manager, Ryan, was very unprofessional and disrespectful. He behaved like a sassy, immature high school girl. 

Overall, I had a horrible experience dining here. I should have just taken my $100 and bought in an out burgers for my group instead.
author: J W.

description:
I absolutely adore this place and I have to thank Tiffany N for introducing it to me in July. Yesterday I returned it was just as I remembered - even better!

The vegetarian salad was terrific as was the side chick pea salad. $3 happy hour beer and the service was terrific and friendly.

I adore the decor with the energetic wallpaper and high paneled ceilings. Mediterranean food at it's best. One of my favourite lunch spots in the city, next time I will try it for dinner.

Wi-fi password is: zareatflytrap23
author: Annie L.

description:
Happy hour is amazing! 
The food is delicious! The service is smart and friendly. The ambiance is upscale but with out an ounce of pretentiousness. 
Finally, the bar is top notch.
author: Randy S.

description:
Amazing food and service!
We came here first for happy hour and then sat down for a nice dinner!

Drinks: 5/5
My husband got a few beers and apparently they were really good beer and affordable (vs what you would be paying anywhere else)
I got Absinte Frappe, daiquiri, they both were really good, specially daiquiri I think it's my new favorite drink! and it was on happy hour! I also got a rum + pineapple juice, their mix drinks are from high quality liquor. 

Appetizers: 5/5
pistachio meatballs (as everyone recommends they are awesome!) 5/5
fried Risotto 3/5 (not too special) 
Dolme: it was a potato dolme on the specials (4/5) 
Mixed Olives: it also had pickled caper berries in it, It was my first time having them and really liked them 5/5

Main Course: 
Braised Lam Neck 5/5
Jeweled Dock 4/5
I would get the Lamb again, the dock was a little too fatty for me and was hard to pick the meet out.

We where too full to get desert, but can't wait to go back and get desert!
author: Mina D.

description:
Go for a good cocktail and an appetizer - the entrees were underwhelming. Our waiter was knowlegeable with the wine list, which given the countries represented, was no small task. 

Good: Cocktails, Hummus appetizer
author: Scott T.

description: I came in to get a drink with some friends & we had mentioned that is was our friends birthday and within seconds the sweetest guy came out with a dessert. THE GREATEST dessert, goat cheese cheesecake. Absolutely phenomenal I highly suggest this place and can't wait to go back !
author: Natalie W.

description: This place deserves the 5-star. I had an excellent chicken dish and meatball app. I would describe the food as modern Persian inspired combinations with very rich and complex flavors. The chicken was moist and perfectly cooked. I also thought their Baklava was excellent.
author: Ryan L.

description: One of the best restaurants in San Francisco. Super cool and modern. Very creative. I would recommend it for sure.
author: Tina M.

description:
Zare at Fly Trap is literally right across the street from our new place and it looks so good from the outside that we needed to try it out.  Some good friends of ours took us out to celebrate our engagement and I must say it was one of the better dining experiences I've had.

The interior of Zare is very nice and the bar looks pretty cool.  The menu is pretty diverse but we've never had a more patient server who took the time to answer all of our questions and go through all of the options, what they entailed and what she would recommend.  She was excellent.

And all of the meal choices we decided on from our appetizers to our main meals were amazing.  The best part was that Zare came out and delivered the meals to our table.  I honestly don't think I've ever been to a place that does that before and it was such a nice touch.

We were so full from our meal but we had to have dessert which again was excellent.  I would highly recommend Zare and it's already one of my top favs in San Francisco.
author: Blake B.

description: Holy cow, if you were lucky enough to pick up the 6/9/2011 Blackboard Eats deal that granted you access to Zare's secret menu, you'd likely agree that Persian tacos are damn near the most delicious things you've ever put in your mouth. Crossing my fingers they decide to keep the tacos on their lunch menu permanently!
author: Ruggy J.

description: My boyfriend and I visited Fly Trap for the first time on Valentine's Day (and our anniversary), and we were so happy we had chosen this spot for our special dinner. Gabriel was our server, and he was just wonderful. He suggested some amazing cocktail and wine selections to pair with our choices, and he was very attentive and fun to talk to as well. Our food was amazing!! There was a special four-course menu that night, and everything we had was interesting, unique, and absolutely delicious.  Gabriel even brought us a special dessert wine from a local company that was just perfect to end our evening. We will definitely go there again.... I can't wait!
author: Chrissi T.

description:
(4.5 stars)

I had my birthday dinner here this year, and everything was wonderful. I called 2 days before to make a reservation for 20 people (which is usually a pain), but everything was surprisingly easy and painless - they didn't even ask for a credit card / deposit. They simply and politely asked us to  let them know if we have any changes, since they're a small restaurant (and we impact their business).

Food: I came here once before for the giant meatball on Mondays, so I already had an idea of what I liked. My favorites:

--Menage a Foie - trio of foie gras.... 5 stars. 3 different types of seared foie gras (my favorite)... if you come here, you MUST try this!

--Bone Marrow - 4 stars (minus 1 for tiny portions)....wonderful flavor/texture; another favorite
