--Things that missed the mark by a bit: My entree, the duck, didn't quite do it for me (although usually I love duck). Also, I ordered one or two of the more unusual sounding cocktails....some of them were a disappointment - I didn't want to have any more after the initial sip.

Service/Experience: Excellent - waiters were friendly, polite, and accomodating (esp. for our large group). They even brought out a birthday cake with a candle + a wonderful dessert wine, since we were celebrating my birthday. The ambiance was also nice - the perfect amount of dim lighting and dressy enough without being stuffy.

Overall, I'd highly recommend this place to anyone who hasn't tried it. Definitely get the menage a foie... you won't regret it!
author: Sarah T.

description: After years of passing this place by, I finally got the chance to go.  Everything we ordered was great.  We started with an alfalfa sprout salad with an avocado cream dressing that was amazing and also the bean croquettes and meatballs.  Also amazing.  The entree split between the two of us was the Chicken Breast with mashed potato and artichokes.  Loved that the menu items were modern with middle eastern influences.  The exotic ingredients really add to the dishes served there.  I would definitely add this to my list of restaurants to go back to.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
I came here with my friend Aditya and was able to get a tablet pretty easily on a Thursday night without a reservation.  Loved the ambiance of the restaurant and the diverse menu... it also looked like a great place for a large group.

Overall the food was delicious.  I had the Bone Marrow for an appetizer and the Lamb Shank for the main course and both were excellently prepared.  The service was fast and friendly.  Also not too loud so you can have a reasonable conversation over dinner.  Aditya is vegetarian and I think he was pretty pleased with their menu.

4 stars (and not 5) because it wasn't a tremendous value, but I'd recommend it to anybody looking for an intimate place with great food and awesome atmosphere.
author: Michael C.

description:
This review is only for the pistachio meatballs--ordered because it was on the 7x7 list. I was running from Off the Grid on a Friday, and really wanted to try the pistachio meatballs. I'm glad they do take-out because that's all I wanted. So, I called in while running, and they seemed super nice. For customer service, I would probably give them a 4. However, the pistachio meatballs that came with a harissa-honey-pomegranate glaze was disappointing. It came with only three meatballs at a total price of $13.05 (12 plus tax). Totally not worth it. I wish I could taste the pistachio in the meatball more as it didn't really shine in the dish. The sauce was too sour for me. The meatball was too much like the ground beef texture that I don't like. I'm sure their other food is good, but for this review, the meatballs were disappointing. 

The ambiance of the restaurant seemed nice though, as well as the servers.
author: Vera W.

description:
I very much loved the feel inside this cozy little space on Folsom and 2nd. Picked it because we were in the hood and because Yelpy insights tell us that vegetarians love that place... which I maybe take a bit of an issue with (like other Yelpers) because there is really only one veg option for dinner.

The host was magnificent, we really felt taken care of by him, while our server was a bit lacking in warmth but that's okay, it was a Monday night.

Wine list is good and varied, the brussels side that we had for an appetizer were far better than the famed brussel sprout chips from Marlowe down the street. The scallop dish was definitely tasty but lacking in substance and depth... the bacon was getting it there but it didn't quite hit a home run.

Dessert was the trio of ice creams, all very interesting and fanciful, none that I'd want more than a teensy taste of.

A very nice spot if you're in the area.
author: Lisa P.

description:
I do not have children and I am fast approaching the golden age of 40 and yet have not sent any swimmers into combat. 

The question frequently is brought up during casual conversation and am often asked "Who is going to take care of you when you get old, don't you want to have children so that they can care for you when you get on in years?"

Oh, ok...I understand, kind of like the way the Menendez brothers took care of their parents.

I jest. I love children and adore my nieces and nephews. And one day I hope to be able have kids of my own. But for now I hope to practice my parenting skills on a cute brown tabby who currently resides in Oakland.

Zare is one of those rare finds in the city of San Francisco that takes care of their customers like they were their own children. Yes, the food is spectacular and about as innovative as you will find anywhere. The menu is to say the least eclectic, but still remains true to it's roots and serves up some of the best Mediterranean food on the West Coast. As some of the other reviews mention, you can also find some kick your socks to max Persian dishes here as well.

Yes I love Zare, but like I would train my future son/daughter. I will for now award you four star and give you something to work for. 

Side note here, I had to learn from the street that my Yelp crush had written two Yelps  which delayed my UFC-ing of her wonderful beautifully written reviews.
author: V B.

description:
Lovely restaurant!
Started with the anar daiquiri: pampero anniversario rum, veev acai pomegranate, pistachio, lime
With dinner we had a bottle of Sean Thackrey "Pleiades", California XX!:
From the eclectic Bolinas winemaker, a field blend with over 5 varietals, juicy with eucalyptus notes

Shared the following apps which were delish!
Pistachio meatballs: harissa-honey-pomegranate glaze
Wild mushroom cake: asparagus ~ lemon confit ~ walnut pesto
Romaine dolmides with sour grapes

For dinner I had the special meatball (beef, veal and grain) stuffed with lamb neck and in a light au jus sauce with fingerling potatoes, oyster mushrooms and gooseberry (some strange currant like berry). It was huge and scrumptious!

I tried my collegue's skirt steak which was awesome too!
Grilled skirt steak: persian chimichurri ~ lima beans braising greens ~ harissa

For dessert we shared te goat cheesecake goat: cheesecake, medjool dates, toasted walnuts 
and the panna cotta and the apple dessert
author: Nicole O.

description:
I was pretty excited when my group decided to host our friend's bday dinner at Zare. Mediterranean food is one of my favorites because of its succulent juicy grilled meat, yummy hummus, and awesome pita bread. I usually eat it on special occasions and this was one of them. In summary, dinner serving my favorite foods + good company got me excited. But what seemed to be a slam-dunk event, turned out to be one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had.

The ambience of the restaurant set the tone for what I thought was going to be an awesome night. The restaurant was small and lightly dimmed, and it created an intimate dining atmosphere. When the birthday boys walked in, we ordered a couple cocktails at the bar. The lady bartender was very welcoming, and she made our drinks with loving tender care, but unfortunately she was the only one who took pride in her work.

Our dinner selection was a pre-set menu. Because I'm a guy, I went straight for the meat: Meatballs for appetizer, Filet Mignon as the main course, and "Not Your Grandma's Pie" for dessert. None of them were good, in fact calling it bad would be a compliment.

I know yelpers have raved about their pistachio meatballs, and I have no idea why. To me, the meatballs were emasculating. It took away every ounce of manhood I had due to the smallness, dryness, and tastelessness of the balls. I'm sure the few women in the bay area can testify that these types of balls are usually ranked on the bottom of the totem pole. Why waste money when you can have juicier bigger balls for free? 

The disappointing appetizer didn't faze me. I was looking forward to my filet mignon, and I rallied on to meet my piece of meat. Sadly, I don't need to do much explaining because my friend's yelp review described it the best:

"Main course: filet mignon. I say filet mignon only because that's what they call it on the menu - a more appropriate description would be "gravy drenched meatloaf". Curiously, the waiter never asked how I'd like the filet to be cooked. It appears he assumed I wanted "cooked until the filet tastes equivalent to meatloaf. "
~ Joseph

Finally, our dessert! I SWITCHED my order to the "Not Your Grandma's Pie" because the waitress said it was their signature dish. What she failed to mention me was that this dish came straight out of the Fear Factory show. It seriously looked like a glob of mucus, and it tasted like it too.

At the end of day, whatevers. I can live with eating bad food. What I can't tolerate is arrogance (mainly the GM Ryan). Our bill was charged for 18 meals, even though we had 17 people. This turned out to be ~$95 per person, not including drinks. Naturally, we wanted an explanation of the bill. 

According to Ryan, it was in our contract to pay for 18. Fine, but if we're paying, we should get the extra plate or get it in a to go box. He claimed the 18th plate was the one replaced by Joseph who sent back his first steak because it was cooked wrong. And let's again point out that Joseph wouldn't have had to send back the steak if the waitress had asked him how he'd like it in the first place ... or if the chef knew how to cook a steak.

His remark caused a huge uproar among my friends, and at end of it, he accused my other friend for being drunk and refused to give us our 18th meal because they don't do take out. If that is true, than your yelp info at the top is false advertisement.
author: JF K.

description: Hoss is a great chef. He is the best. I love his food....Hoss deserves to have his own restaurant!....Don't you think Hoss?
author: Jennifer L.

description: I went there for my anniversary and we loved it. Beautiful and classy looking place with great service and friendly staff. The food is a bit pricy but it totally worth it.
author: Erik H.

description:
Quite a nice fusion of influences from the Mediterranean to the Middle east. Very well done. I really enjoyed my Pan Seared Salmon dish as well as the smoked trout appetizer, eggplant appetizer, and the braised lamb I tasted from others. 

Amazing service!
author: Christina V.

description:
Sshhhh. Don't tell all the Persian women in my family, but Zaré at Fly Trap brings their cooking to shame. 

Hands down, the most delicious food and best dining experience I've had  in my 2+ years in the city. 

It's everything I've always wished Persian food could be: less starchy and stewy, and more embracing of fish and vegetables, the latter of which are allowed to stand on their own without being drowned in oils. 

Intrigued by the Persian-with-a-twist concept, I took my father here while he was in town for a day. We each had Persian tea, an appetizer (get the kashk bademjan [eggplant] dish!), an entree and a dessert, and the bill came to just above $100. Not too shabby. The chef also came by our table before we received our entrees to greet us. He and my dad had a nice chat in Farsi. 

The space itself is classy, warm and inviting. Not pretentious in the least.  Perfect for dates, dinners with (adult) family, or a nice night out with friends. 

Can't recommend it more highly.
author: Amy Z.

description:
Love this place! Great atmosphere, DELISH food and friendly service.  

When I asked about the lamb,  it was sold very well and made it irresistible to both myself and a friend. It certainly lived up to our expectations as I now have dreams about the juicy flavors. 

I would definitely recommend a reservation. I have tried coming here many times without and had no success. 

My only complaint is that the waitress did not suggest ordering sides with our lamb - she made it seem like it was plenty of food. Once we realized we were only getting meat, we quickly ordered 2 sides which ended up being perfect. She did the same with our app order, which ended up being fine. All in all,  I would not suggest asking the server (who probably eats less than a bird) for serving suggestions.
author: Yanet K.

description: Had a very enjoyable meal here last week! Pistachio Meatballs, short-rib and brussel sprouts. Everything was good but The brussel sprouts might be the best thing on the menu! The service here was awesome! Super attentive even though we came in near the end of the night and were the only diners on the patio. Patio is great, only a couple of tables but great space if you can get it. Great beer and wine selection was good, lots to choose from. They even had a really nice cider.
author: Marissa P.

description:
- Sat down at the bar while waiting for some friends to arrive and the bartender emptied about a 1/4 bottle of wine into my glass. 

- Pistachio meatballs & spice roasted bone marrow for aps. There are no words!

- Grilled lamb & orzo-stuffed squash for mains. Delish!

- Backlava & goat cheese cheesecake for dessert. Yum, yum, yum. 

Maybe I'm partial because I could eat Mediterranean food all day-everyday, but still it was very very yummy! Go! Enjoy!!
author: Alisa G.

description: Great food and Service. The Crispy Brussels are an excellent starter for the table. Agave Inferno cocktail is awesome if you like a little heat in your libations.
author: Gary M.

description:
The veggie kufteh was so good!  Super flavorful and filling!  We met the chef/owner, Hoss, who was incredibly nice.  I'm told that he didn't go to culinary school, he learned from his mother and grandmother.  I don't know if that's true or not, but you cannot argue with the delicious results!

Their wine list is also very good, they had my favorite pinot available by the glass, which was awesome.  Will I be back?  You can count on it.
author: Renae H.

description:
My friends and I  (there were 7 of us) went  here for a bachelorette dinner. I expected much better food and service (20% gratuity). To start with, the appetizers were very small (and this is coming from a petite Asian woman!) We order 4-5 different appetizers and they were mediocre. Not too great and I was hungry! I had the cod and that was also okay...again the portions were small (not enough for me to get full off of). My friend had the salmon which tasted better...I'd give that 3 stars.

Overall experience - they didn't do anything special for us service wise or food wise. I am about 108 lbs and I was hungry afterwards. I had to go to Mel's Diner and have ANOTHER meal! Yah...I typically have left overs when I eat out.  This is a First and my last time here!

Goodbye Zare Fly Trap...
author: Paul S.

description: Great place - love the menu, the creativity, the atmosphere and the wine list.
author: Sherrick M.

description:
Lunch at Zare was like having an upscale meal at an easy to swallow price. An array of wraps awaited us, a lamb wrap in particular awaited me. Anyone who knows me, knows I'm not turning down anything lamb when it's on the menu. 

I was surprised it wasn't busier. It was, after all, lunch hour. Could it be that more of you San Francisconites don't know about this delicious noon-time dinerie? If that be the case, I hope enough of you keep it in business for my next trip down, but not so many that it becomes over run by the time I get there.
author: Wendy P.

description:
Stopped by for a late dessert and nightcap
All of which were great
Really cool place 
Great service
Loved the menu
Will def go back
author: Nigel J.

description:
How fortunate are we? Had the awesome opportunity to photograph a series of restaurants and food and Zares Fly Trap was among them.


Not only is this place gorgeous Hoss himself is a sheer delight! His creations are beautiful, and simply real life recipes.  While paying homage to his roots he is delighting the palettes everywhere! 

Looking forward to returning and having more of this beautiful and tasty cuisine!  Cheers and thanks Hoss!  Staff was fabulous too!!
author: Bahvee V.

description:
Had dinner here a few weeks a go and it was quite tasty. I wish I remembered our waitress' name as she was awesome! She brought out an assortment of wines, appetizers, and helped us (me) navigate the food menu. 

It was a fantastic experience. I'm sure I'll be back and hopefully with the same friend!
author: Art A.

description: If you're expecting great Persian food, you've come to the wrong place. Nothing was authentic and the "fusion" was awful. It's hard to mess up Persian food but these guys managed to do it.
author: Neema Y.

description:
I am so glad that I get a chance to meet the chef, Zare. He is a wonderful, kind and welcoming person. 
The bone marrow is the best dish ever!!! 
I was here on Monday, so I had the Monday night specialty, the Giant Meatball which is surprisingly delicious and juicy. I am not a fan of meat ball, but this giant one got my heart. A tender, soft chicken leg warp by lots of juicy, flavorful veal and herbal seasoning. What a great combination. 
The ambiance is so elegant. All staffs are so hospitable. 
It was my first time having Persian Mediterranean cuisine which is so delightful. I would definitely come back for more wonderful experiences. :)
author: JustinE Y.

description:
Finally, a breath of fresh air!

Child!!!...Let me tell you, this spot is a gem.  I loved it.   

First, we ate at the bar and our peeps behind the counter were awesome.  They made us feel totally at home, vip style. The ambiance and crowd are both mature and positive.

Second, the food was fab.  The roasted baby eggplant and the marinated chickpeas were amazing. 

Desserts?  Pure yumminess.  That goat-cheese cheesecake was bliss and so was the warm chocolate cake.  

Last but not least, the cocktails were pure fabulocity.  Spanish Cobbler is the perfect description.

And yes, I love love love that they serve until midnight.  Great food, cocktails, and wine on the late tip.  How good can it get?!
author: Angella S.

description:
Good food but it didn't blow me away considering the reviews and the price range. It's kind of loud in here and the ambiance is very lively. The service is decent and not overbearing. I hate when waiters hover around like a helicopter. They leave you alone here but they show up when you want them to. 

The menu looked wonderful. A lot of the foods look so creative and appetizing. I ordered the lamb abgoosht and it was good but not particularly memorable. The dish is a combination of pulled lamb, potato, tomato, garbanzo beans, roasted garlic, turmeric, and dried lime broth. The combination of flavors is interesting but I probably wouldn't order it again and I wouldn't make a special trip out here just for the food.

The dessert was fantastic though. Seriously so decadent and sinfully sweet. I tried the chocolate cake and baklava with rose syrup. Both were good but the baklava really stood out. Absolutely delicious! If you come here, get the baklava. It's perfectly flaky and the pistachio garnish adds a delightfully tasty texture. The rose flavor brings the dessert to a whole other level. I'm salivating just thinking about it. Foodgasm inducing for sure if you love desserts like I do.
author: Nancy C.

description: I remember coming here when I started dating my husband. We loved coming here, I always had the flat iron steak, it's so juicy & tender. Great place to dine.
author: E G.

description: Have a terrible hangover but had a terribly good time at Fly Trap yet again! The vino is great and every food item we've tried has been fantastic, especially the sliders and the eggplant.
author: DJ S.

description: Wonderful. Thank you Meg (manager) for the excellent dinner.
author: Billy J.

description:
I came here for a company event and ordered off a set menu, so my review may be a little biased.

I ordered the butter lettuce salad with prosciutto for starters, followed by short ribs, and finished with a goat cheese cheesecake

The salad was alright, big pieces of butter lettuce, but only 2 small pieces of prosciutto. I wasn't too happy about that.

The short ribs were extremely tender and melted in your mouth, but it came with these dark beans and other veggies that were tough to eat. The beans were not very good and did not go with the short ribs too well. I only ate the short rib and did not touch anything else

The dessert was pretty yummy, very goat cheesy (a little sour). My other coworkers, got this chocolate mousse cake that made me regret my decision.

I was not able to see their normal menu, but their service was awesome, the waitress was extremely friendly to our whole group, even the ones that got a little obnoxious after a few drinks

The food was nothing special, but I think I would come back to check out their normal menu. The atmosphere was nice and the crowd was about late 20's to late 30's. Good amount of people were there to drink and chill.

I would check this place out again since I see it's been reviewed so well, but based off of the experience I had, I give it 3 stars.
author: Steven C.

description:
Absolutely fabulous!

Order "The Combo" as your appetizer to try the Pistachio Meatball and Cucumber Linguini. 

More to come . . .
author: Lauren B.

description:
Thinking they already started serving lunch, and I stumbled in the day before they officially started. Apparently they were starting early, so I treated myself to a Sardine/Anchovy wrap. You'll certainly have to like fishy fish to enjoy this wrap, but it was tasty to me. If that's not your thing, they also have more traditional lamb/chicken/vegetarian wraps, soups, and grain salads.

Dinner is also to die for, but you can't beat a dish that has fowl inside of a giant meatball. Bonus points for also serving Lingcod instead of some lame fish like "cod". Service stood out above the rest with the owner, Hoss Zare, personally checking up on us several times. The waiters are knowledgeable and friendly as well, which says a lot since I normally don't care about the service.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Persian fusion- this is definitely not trying to be authentic. But the ingredients are the same- pistachio, pomegranate, etc. It was all pretty good. I had a party of 8, I needed to make a reservation, and I suppose this is normal for SF, but I needed to give my credit card number to hold the place. We racked up a $272 bill, which was a lot because we were sharing about 6 meals. Nice service although our waitress didn't smile once. So everything was just ok.


The goat cheese cake is just to die for, it really was the best item we tried!
author: KM B.

description:
There's a giant National Geographic world map hanging on one of my closet doors. Every night when I brush my teeth, I look at it for a full two minutes (as required to let the fluoride in the toothpaste fully absorb), traveling visually through the shapes of countries and names of remote places. With a quick sideways glance, I leap from the Isla de los Estados in South America to Boosaaso, a port city along Africa's eastern coast, while along the way marveling at how the epic Trojan War was centered in that tiny little blot known as the Aegean. My favorite destination, however, is the Mediterranean. From Lebanon to the Pillars of Hercules, it housed some of the greatest civilizations of the ancient world. More importantly, it offers many of the world's most robust and savory cuisines.

Zaré at Fly Trap offers a culinary vacation of the entire Mediterranean coast. From Southern French and Italian to Moroccan and hints of the Middle East, the exoticism of their food (and drink) menu is wholly compelling. I ordered the Sumac Couscous Salad and it came piled with crab and dusted with delicious herbs. My friends' entrées were even more impressive, and their portions well justified the prices. Service was fantastic (Chef Zaré even came by to see if things were alright), the drinks were delicious and we all left feeling as if we had experienced something a little more than just food... like dining out but a damn lot further.
author: Keane L.

description: Delicious! Went there last night with six of my friends and we loved the food and the service. We shared 4 difft apps, including spiced naan bread with summer spread, which was so yummy, the meatballs, which were great, the trio of hummus, also tasty and the stuffed calamari -nice but wish the serving was bigger. Flat iron steak was ok. The entrees were delicious especially the stewed lamb and chicken. For dessert i would go For baklava and choc torte. The cucumber pudding was odd and the cheesecake just ok. We loved our waiter, who was so attentive and had a great personality. Overall, fabulous experience.
author: J. N.

description: Delicious to the palette and a feast for the eyes. Enjoyed the take on fesenjoon.
author: Natalie B.

description:
Food and service were very good.  Particularly the bar staff.  Excellent pours all around.

It's not traditional Persian, but their take on the classics is very innovative and brings out the flavors.

Be careful where you park though, my friends car was broken into on the street right outside the restaurant.  Not their fault but still, be careful...
author: Chris D.

description:
I only came for the bar bites and the drinks. The Mediterranean fare was a delicious happy-hour treat, though we didn't go too adventurous: just some meatballs, baba ghanoush, a couple of cocktails, and little bit of wine.

It's really pretty in here, and the bartender was super nice and chill. After overhearing about how 2/4 of our group had never been to Hawaii (yeah, yeah), she had the kitchen throw in some Hawaiian flavor into one of our dishes. I've admittedly forgotten what that flavor *was*, but I really appreciated the sentiment and the spontaneity. 

Will maybe come back for dinner-dinner, but my at-the-bar experience was so nice, I might just keep it to that.
author: Tara R.

description:
I came to Zare really looking forward to the vegetarian kufteh. Unfortunately, Zare has recently changed their menu and hasn't caught up yet with vegetarian options (unlike the menu set up on the website, there is no separate vegetarian menu). Don't worry, I've got you covered, in order to avoid disappointment, I ended up sharing all of the vegetarian choices with another one of my dining companions so can give a little guidance  with the new choices. The real stand out was the mushroom cake that was accompanied with raw kohlrabi. The cake is a strong savory, mushroomy goodness topped with kohlrabi pesto. The soup of the day was quite good but I can't promise  they'll repeat that one so I'll move on to the next best option, the eggplant, which is roasted to a creamy deliciousness. The salad had a nice mix of fruits (e.g., orange, cranberry seeds). I thought that the saffron rice, which is fried into little rice paddies, was the least impressive of the choices. As the only vegetarian entree I'd suggest sticking with the appetizers and piecing together a little vegetarian sampler.

Of note, the ambiance in Zare was quite boisterous, we had 6 at our table and the noise level made it difficult to talk even amongst our party. A nice place if you're looking for great food and a lively atmosphere but not the perfect place to carry on a conversation. I was also disappointed that the website isn't up to date what they're actually serving. I have no problem with their experimenting with a new menu but take down the old one and just let us know that things are in flux.
author: Stephen S.

description:
The weekend of Valentine's Day. This place was busy but the lovely host was very considerate and informative about the fact if we wanted to dine in the dining room we would have to be done before 9pm due to reservations or we could sit at the bar. We decided to sit at the bar.

The bar did not disappoint, they serve the full menu and we got their full attention throughout our meal. The bartender gave his best recommendations and I decided to try the ostrich carpaccio instead of the beet salad because I think he was pretty serious when he asked "are you sure about the beets? can you handle that much beets?" lol I had to laugh but ostrich definitely was more interesting and surprisingly appetizing.

- We tried various cocktails drinks (cardamom, lemon drop) which were very good not too much vodka or tequila overpowering

- Had a taste of my bf's 'Yesterday's Soup' and I wasn't too impressed which is a reason why I never get any soup. 

- The lamb shank was delicious, meat falling off the bone and medium salt/pepper. I would've liked more flavor but they want you to pair the lamb with their prepared sauces which were for me on the sour side.

- The salmon was grilled perfectly with plenty of smokiness. A well balanced and light fish dinner.

Service was amazing (at the bar) and therefore I will definitely be coming back for more of the pizazz and friendly atmosphere at Zare's. I'm definitely trapped!
author: Donna C.

description: Best hospitality ever! Chef Hos treated us like queens! Great ambiance along with fantastic yet creative dishes that made your pallet go nuts :) I live in Oakland but I have every intention of making the trip out to The Fly Trap over and over again. Thank you for making the evening so memorable for us!
author: Her opinion T.

description:
Excellent and innovative Mediterranean fusion concept, superb gin martini.  (-entirely not the original Fly Trap of 100 years ago!)

Lovely little semi-private nook at the back, non-echo area  -for our party of 7.

Superb mastery of preparation and presentation, each bite a sparkly surprise for the taste buds.

MOST Pleasant and attentive wait staff, top to bottom.

NO NO ::  lukewarm food, unheated plates, uber LAME.  making repeat visit very very iffy.  -prapps when the weather warms up a bit?

[What I shulla done was go directly to the K to C Chef Z, as I've been known 2 do at other restaurants.  They need 2 know 1st hand.]

Please stay tuned.
author: Clifford L.

description:
I had dinner here this past Friday night with Hue L. and our NYF for our monthly dinner.  Although, technically, our last monthly dinner was in January, so maybe they are now our quarterly dinners?

Anyway, our reservations were at 8:15pm and most of the tables were occupied.  We had to wait a few minutes once we walked into the restaurant for someone to notice and seat us, but it was fairly busy, so we didn't really mind.

We started off with the Grilled Lamb Sausage with Roasted Squash, Grilled Fennel, & Mint and the Pistachio Meatballs with Harissa Honey Pomegrante Glaze.  They were both tasty, but nothing spectacular.

For my entree, I had the Lamb "Abgoosht Koobideh." It did not look at all how I expected, but it had a good combination of spices that made it quite tasty.  Hue L. had the Duck "Fessenjoon" and our NYF had the Beef Short Rib "Ghormeh Sabzi".

We had also ordered a side of the Crispy Brussel Sprouts, but they didn't bring them out so we ended up having to ask our waitress about them.  She was very apologetic and brought them up very quickly and even took the item off our bill.  Great customer service there!

As for dessert, we split the Goat Cheese Cheesecake and the Fried Milk.  

My favorite of the night has to be the Goat Cheese Cheesecake.  Order that.  Seriously.

Our bill including tax + tip was about $150.  So, not the cheapest spot in town, but it was fairly good and the service was pretty spot on.
author: Kris L.

description:
I can not say enough good things about this place. A real gem, every time I've been there, it's been a memorable & delicious experience.

Amazing food, beautiful setting, perfect spot to romance the special someone in your life... or just yourself. I've resorted to going here alone because it's so great.
Monday night features the awesome 2 lbs meatball that always sells out.
The faloodeh dessert + tequila is a treat. 
The lamb burger is scrumptious..... just writing this is starting to make my mouth water... guess I have to go there for dinner tonight.
You should go too :)
author: Yasmin M.

description:
It's as if I'm learning to move an appendage on it's own accord, again. Unsure if I should should take it easy and experience the feeling again or say, "to the hell with it!". Balls meet wall!

What is "it"?

A Yelp review!!

My first attempt at a second go-round at making myself famous on the Internet via Yelp! Or at least just to get back into elite events..

Zare at Fly Trap definitely deserves a review that needs caressing and finessing. A review that will, in hopes, offer the readers (if any) my own experiences and biases of this jewel box of a restaurant. How, over a course of 3 years, I have come to know those who make Zare...well, Zare and will always make & take every opportunity to visit Hoss' lair!

Well...now that I've sat here and caressed and finessed, I can only come up with a few things that I can only hope will bring you into Fly Trap!

- happy hour with ANY 'tender...they're all grand and happy and amazing!

- Hoss and his BOH staff consistently put great food in front of me..I've never walked away..nay, stumbled away from Zare at Fly Trap wishing I hadn't ordered that or that...

- As said above..this place is a jewel box and has such a warm and inviting atmosphere...to me..that words do no justice..

- Restrooms are shared with neighboring Mehfil...some Yelpers...I'm assuming would offer a star demotion for this, but not I...

So..all in all..I HEART Zare!

Go...

Don't go...


I DON'T CARE!

Just make sure to leave me a stool at the bar!
author: Andy F.

description:
My wife and I have eaten at Zare a couple of times.  A couple of times a few years back, first with some friends who intro ducted us to the place and later a friend who was in town, and more recently just last week.  I remembered liking this place from our first visits there are so we were eager to give go back.

I think the layout of this restaurant.  The main room, with the bar, is quite lively and has a nice look to it.  There is a smaller back room with 3 or 4 tables (and presumably used for groups when they have them).  We were in the main room the first few times and in the back room (much quieter) this time.

For dinner this most recent time around, we started with cocktails and then both had the porcini mushroom soup.  This turned out to be a bit salty for our tastes, so that was a bit disappointing.  My wife had the local cod, which was good but also a bit too salty for her tastes.  I had the saffron polenta, which I quite liked.  It came with three fried polenta cakes as well as a nice collection of vegetables (abalone mushrooms, collards).

Overall it was a pleasant meal.  Not quite as good in our more recent trip as  I remembered it, so only giving it three stars.  It's pretty close to where we live and I'm sure we'll go back.
author: Richard M.

description:
I have always been a big fan of Zare and when he closed the original spot to the new location I was not dissappinted, the food was good, and the service was excellent. I rememberd this place very well because the actual chef/owner actually walks around to check on every person, and sometimes even helps serves the food! 

The lamb was what I had and it just melted off the bone cooked perfectly.
author: madi b.

description:
I grew up in a Persian household in which family members scoffed at the notion of eating "out", denying any chef could reproduce the simple complexity of Persian cuisine...until the Persian clan dined at Zare. 

The lamb shank melts off the bone and into your mouth it's that good.
author: Shireen T.

description:
The fly trap is one of the best restaurants I have visited in SF. We started with meatballs and as entree I had the Lam steak. I also tried Abgoosht and that was great too. The only thing I didn't like was my faloodeh. I missed real thin and long pieces of faloodeh. Fly Trap's faloodeh was bit too icy. It would have been 5-stars if faloodeh was done well. 

The Fly Trap has something unique compared to other restaurants and that is mastering flavors. You get to taste all the ingredients that are in your dish. Every bite is a surprise. I would definitely go there next time but just order a different dessert.
author: Rez L.

description: What a delightful experience! My friend got the lamb, it was cooked to perfection. Now, I got the Saturday special the koofteh (Persian meatball), and my god it was the best piece of meat I'd eaten in a long time, including the broth that it was served in. The super amicable chef came out and narrated a brief history behind this dish. What a wonderful host . Our server, Gabriel was incredibly helpful, informative, and friendly. I've been here before for happy hour which wasn't bad at all with the Belhaven porter - a more than decent Porter selection - but we were blown away by the dinner. What a wonderful night and a wonderful place!
author: Ash T.

description: Been meaning to write this review for a while. I am a big fan of this place. I call it one of the most unique dining experiences you can get in the city. It has a beautiful ambience and the food is fantastic. I had my birthday dinner here recently and it was a memorable experience for all my guests. Thank you Zare!
author: Farah S.

description: Mediocre food. Tried a couple signature appetizers and three different drinks before leaving
author: Tango N.

description:
I ate with some Twitter folks here because SOMA is kind of a culinary wasteland until recently. Zare's famous pistachio meat balls lured me into a dinner group. 

It's definitely not an everyday dinner night. If the prices came down a little bit more, the entrees and the appetizers were DELIGHT. Check it: 

- Spice-roasted bone marrow. DERP EAT. 
- Duck = fat birds always win. 
- Wood-grilled, feta-infused filet mignon. Ship it. 

As for the famous meatballs, the pistachio doesn't come out that much actually, but it's a delightful dish. Overall, a great addition to the SOMA district in providing a classy Mediterranean restaurant with a Persian touch to everything. 

Just brace yourselves for that "$$$" sign. Spare no expense.
author: Abel L.

description:
Beautiful, classy restaurant. Major props to our waitress for being so sweet and attentive while dealing with our sometimes-obnoxious party of 14.

I was told the lamb shank was their signature dish, and it didn't disappoint. It was falling off the bone flavorful goodness swimming in delicious sauce. The vegetarians in the party loved their eggplant-based dishes, and the carnivores were waxing poetic about their flat iron steak.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Why would you take away one of the best selling items on your menu? Everyone on Yelp was raving about the Lamb Shank, but alas, I went to Zare a week ago to rip apart this huge chunk of meat as others on Yelp had described it, only to find that they have exchanged it on the menu for some other lamb concoction! What gives?!

Anyway, I tried this other lamb concoction, which basically tasted like pulled lamb done two ways, and was fairly mediocre. 

Pistachio meatballs were also a bit dry, they were ok but I wouldn't get them again.

My friends had several other plates, but nothing in general would live up to a 4-star rating on Yelp.

The waitress was awesome though, super friendly and made the experience (well, the bottles of wine may have had something to do with that as well) great.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
So, I ate here 2x over the holidays. First, I was brought by a friend who says this is one of the only decent persian restaurants he's been to (yes, he's persian). 2nd time met a bunch of friends there. Both times, the food was very good and consistent. This is a good place to eat if you want something other than the usual upper end california fusion fare.

It has a nice large bar if you're going to meet someone while waiting for your table. Overall, cozy atmosphere.

Food:
Kind of hard to describe all the food I ate (tried pretty much everything between both visits.) However, they did not have a heavy hand with the spices, just enough to really appreciate the authenticity and flavorful (my friend said the lamb abgoosht was as good, if not a bit better than his mom's).

Def recommend eating here if you're looking for a nice alternative to the usual fare. Don't be shy, just order and enjoy.
author: Eugene P.

description:
I was sooo excited when I made reservations to eat at Zare for a party of 4 on a Thursday night.  I spent the whole day going over their menu trying to decide what I was going to order.  Everything sounded sooo delicious!

We started off with the pistachio meatballs, some mussels, and a pita/toast with two types of spread that I don't completely remember, 'cept that they were both great accompaniments.  I think one was a black olive spread.  The meatballs were delicious with their sauce, and I loved the the pomegranate arils that garnished it.  Mussels were delicious in their wine sauce, perfectly cooked.

For dinner we had the duck fessenjoon, lamb shank abgusht, beed short rib ghormeh sabzi, and the lamb burger.  My friends and I shared everything.  Everything was so tender and flavorful.  When I return, I'll have the hardest time deciding what to get, but I'm pretty sure I should just try something new.

For drinks I had the anar daiguiri, which was good, but a little too tart for me.  My bf got the persian breakfast cocktail, a little weird, but refreshing.  My friend got the minted memory and that was definitely my favorite!

The staff there was fantastic, always there when you needed them, and never there when you didn't want them.

The ambiance was great.  Intimate and sociable.  Looks like there is a small private room that seats about 20 - 40 ppl maybe? Didn't want to stare and impose. :)
author: Roenna N.

description:
I've been planning to dine here for a year now and it finally happened the day I was terribly sick with the flue!
I walked in paralyzed by the flue and had Hoss's special chicken soup plus a magical cocktail of brandy+cinnamon+lime juice+Chef's special ingredient (love;) and by the time I walked out I was ready to party till morning!
Can't wait to go back!
author: Maryam M.

description: The food here is great! The restaurant isn't very large so it's very cozy. The humus plate and chips were delicious and I highly recommend. We also ordered ther meatballs to start but they were kind of dry. I had the seafood and cous cous in a tomato sauce which was good but I wish I got the black cod,  my friend got it and it was cooked to perfection.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
I almost forgot about The Fly Trap, but when I used Yelp to find a restaurant to eat in downtown on my recent trip to San Francisco, this restaurant popped back onto my radar screen. Lucky me! It was just as tasty as when I ate there four years ago. The amosphere is charming, and they were able to take a last-minute reservation for two on a Thursday night.

I ordered the eggplant again, and it was still delicious. My husband (the pickiest eater in the world) didn't enjoy dinner as much as I did because there was very little on the menu for him, but even he enjoyed the delicious hummus trio (the green one -- not sure what the flavor was -- was my favorite.) I also ordered the beet salad, which was light and refreshing -- not revolutionary, but very good.

Now I just have to try not to forget this place in four more years the next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Rebecca K.

description:
After my meal here last night, I feel like I need to go back and reduce every review I've ever written for any other restaurant by one star.

It was just that good - everything else pales in comparison.

The meal, the service, the drinks ... everything was perfect. And there is no way you can find another restaurant with this level of consistency, these rich flavors, a room as pleasant - for such an excellent price. The value is amazing - we had a feast! Almost 2/3 of the menu ordered, 7 people, cocktails and dessert, ended up about $50 per person - and that included a 20% tip, which was very well-earned by our server, bartender, and of course Hoss himself who was kind enough to come out and spend a little bit of time with us.

It's only a matter of time before they have their Michelin star, at which point you won't be able to make reservations so easily; go now while you still can!
author: Moses H.

description: Small portions and overpriced! Can't believe not many people have complained about this. This place charges an arm and a leg for mediocre plates (I tried three different plates and none were amazing) and the service is awful when they're busy. Food was undercooked and the waitress did not bat an eye. Chef apparently says I was wrong and he was right. That's great customer service right? The food genre is way too confusing. It's what yuppies think middle eastern food should be. If you're into authentic places, don't go here. Major rip off. Would give it no stars.
author: Cassandra T.

description:
My problem with the food was that it lacked developed, interesting flavors; it was painfully bland.  The entree (lamb) had a watery sauce with unflavored vegetables to accompany the meat.  I wished I had brought some fresh, flavorful chimichurri from home to fix the lamb.  A restaurant that thinks it is as nice as Zare thinks it is should know that protein + starch/grain + vegetable does not equal an entree.  The sauce and the seasonings are what make the dish. 

Consider going for dessert only, the goat cheesecake is good.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Rosie from the Wedding Singer* would love Meatball Mondays.

Can't say enough good things about the five star meatballs. Two pounds of chicken and lamb mixed together. Split as an appetizer but almost could have shared as an entree. Unique and exceptionally flavorful. We were lucky to go on a Monday otherwise we'd never have known.

Great if a few notches below exceptional:

-  Vegetarian kkufteh tabrizi. Reminded me of a very, very good vegetarian burger. Avocado salsa complements nicely.

- Braised eggplant with yogurt. Gone in less than a minute. Surprised we didn't fight for the last delicious bite.

- Grilled wild salmon on a bed of fregola (pasta) and peas. Liked the salmon. Loved everything underneath. Chef Hoss really delivers on the vegetarian selection.

- Crispy brussels sprouts with a yogurt tartar. Sinfully good. Beware.

A very enjoyable meal in a space that feels genuine, warm and inviting. Dinner was not quite as memorable as lunch, but still highly recommend.

And I recommend you go on a Monday.

*http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AY1hndoLGg4
author: Jason B.

description:
This review is for their lunch service, since I haven't tried dinner.  I was there the first day they started serving lunch in April and have been back several  times. I've had the wraps, the salmon salad, the chickpea salad, fries, soup, and today the baklava!  The amazingly tasty and healthy (no guilt for feeling full!) food, the friendly service, classy ambiance, and the general experience of feeling very 'civilized' for not a lot of cash at lunch on a work day is priceless.  I've brought 3 people from work so far and all of them were stunned by this hidden lunchtime gem.

Highly recommend!
author: Kathryn F.

description: I really wanted to love this place, the owner is extremely nice. They have a good wine selection as well. I didn't think any of the food was really amazing by any means. Not to mention I was here on a business dinner in a suit and it was WAY too hot for that type of environment. Granted we were sitting near the kitchen, but you can't have a nice upscale eatery without proper climate control. I live in Miami and I was hot!
author: Jonah K.

description:
I can honestly say that dinner at Zare at Fly Trap this past week was one of the best dining experiences I've had in San Francisco. Great service and great food! From the get go, they were extremely accommodating and seemed dedicated to making the most of our dining experience.

1) We were a large group of 10 that became a larger group of 12. They didn't even blink at the change.

2) They were ready with alternate items and substitutes for the one gluten-free + several vegetarians at the table.

3) A few of us had to leave the group a little early, and a separate check was brought over quickly/discretely. 

If you're in a large party, expect the food to take a little longer. However, service did not waver. The food is very reasonably priced for what you get. I tried the seared scallops and the filet mignon - both fantastic! 

It's definitely a spot I would enjoy another visit or two or more. I'd love to sit at the bar with some bites and a cold beer.
author: Tinna H.

description: I'm a veggie, and this place is a goldmine. Five stars, period. Try the hummus and the fatoush salad. Brussels were amazing, too.
author: Eben P.

description:
Food 3 stars
Ambiance 4 stars
Service 4 stars

Loved:
Gin and Cardamom cocktail - just a hint of cardamon, served martini-style
Sumac Cous Cous Dungeness crab salad - not too much sumac, and I'm not a huge fan of cous cous, but the crab totally dressed it up

Liked:
Lamb Burger - juicy, served with fries. Would have been nice to have some greens and maybe some onions
Duck Fessenjean - Fessenjean is always better the 2nd day, after the flavors have had time to meld, but this one was tasty and we got a LOT of duck with it -- two large legs with partial thighs. 

Just okay:
Yogurt Panna Cotta - tasted like... yogurt. Nothing too exciting here
author: christine l.

description:
Great food, good service.  Drinks were tastly.  Recommendation from the menu:

Grilled Stuffed Calamari - stuffed with pork
Pistachio Meatballs - interesting flavor combo
Cinnamon Braised Beef Cheek - very tender and rich
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I used to drive by Fly Trap and think "who would eat at a restaurant called Fly Trap" and then a friend took me there and I fell in love.  The decor is some of the most gorgeous restaurant decor in San Francisco, the food is fantastic (was when it was French and still is now that it's Persian), the wine list is top notch, and Zare, the current chef/owner, is delightful.  

The restaurant also has an interesting history for anyone who cares to ask about it while there.

Can't say enough good things . . .
author: Kathleen M.

description:
I've been sitting on this review for a week.  That only happens when I don't know quite what to say (in other words, rarely).

All of the elements of a great dining experience were there.  Great company (hi, Natasha S.!), cool decor, interesting and innovative menu, good, informed and enthusiastic service.  Not to mention the Daily Candy and Thrillist reviews, and all of the positive Yelps...I was sure we were going to LOVE it.

The food was off for us, with every single dish.  We shared the Menage a Foie as a starter, which was a foreshadowing of the meal to come.  The dish is made up of 3 livers in 3 preparations:  foie, sheep's liver, and chicken liver.  An omnivore's delight, right?  No.  There was just too much going on in the dish, too many flavors, and they just didn't mesh well.

For my entree, I chose the Pappadam-crusted Wild Alaskan Salmon.  The fish was cooked nicely, but the grapefruit reduction was way too sharp for the dish, and again, the flavors didn't mesh well.  The avocado gnocchi - interesting, but not with those other elements.  

We decided to try the desserts, because just like everything else, they sounded amazing!  Again, we were disappointed.  We shared the Goat Cheese cheesecake and the Rocky Road.  The cheese taste in the dessert was overpowering, and the deconstructed Rocky Road was beautiful to look at, but didn't come together as you were eating it.  Soy salted caramel - interesting!  innovative!  But not that good...sigh.

I'll be keeping my eyes open for future reviews of Zare, and if I continue to read good things, I may be tempted to go back.  Kudos for a really appealing menu, but I am hoping for some refinement in the flavors for my next visit.  I originally gave this a 2 star, but I am moving it up to a hopeful 3.
author: Liz S.

description:
Went for dinner here on a Friday night with a party of 4.  We had a very tasty meal and great service.  The room is a bit dark, so we found the flashlight apps on our iPhones came in handy when it was time to read the menu!  We ordered:

Appetizers:
Grilled Spiced Naan and Summer Spread - yummy, full of flavors and easy to share
Crispy Brussels Sprouts (from the side dish section) - as advertised, delicious

Mains:
Lamb burger with fries - very juicy and flavorful, the fries were perfect and shared by all
Braised lamb stew - very tender and full of delicious and new flavors to us, a big hit
Seafood stew (daily special) - full of high quality seafood, flavorful broth but my hubby who ordered it would have preferred something more highly seasoned, like a cioppino
Chicken pasta (special) - loved loved loved, again full of so many flavors, many of them unexpected, but well married together.  Leftovers were just as good the next day

In short, this is a great place to come for flavor combinations that you don't get here every day, in a lovely and lively environment.  Beware, it gets pretty loud for a normal level of conversation after about 8pm, if you eat at one of the tables that shares space with the bar.
author: Virginia K.

description:
Zaré at Fly Trap offers memorable, satisfying Mediterranean cuisine with a Persian influence. The food presentation and decor are both nice, but where Zaré really shines is with its ability to take familiar ingredients (filet mignon, lamb, french fries) and create complex, inventive flavor profiles.

For starters, my date and I shared the braised italian eggplant topped with sun-dried yogurt, walnuts, and crispy onions for a crunchy side. We also had sardines over a puree and crostini, and the fantastically seasoned french fries with a can't-stop-eating-this saffron aioli. 

I had the filet mignon for my main course, complemented by gorgonzola, a pomegranate (?) glaze, and sweet dates. The meat was cooked to perfection. My boyfriend had the lamb shank with black eyed peas, tomatoes, and torshi (pickled vegetables), surrounded by a flavorful broth. 

The dessert was equally impressive - saffron-marinated quince with pistachio cakes, orange blossom ice cream, and a champagne glaze, paired with a digestif. 

The cocktails and wines are decently priced; the food a bit expensive but well worth it by the end of the meal. The decor was lounge-y with warm vermilion walls and dimmed lighting. My only complaint perhaps was the noise level, which did cause us to raise our voices across an already small table. 

I would definitely recommend Zaré at Fly Trap to people looking for a nice evening out - with the creative flavors you'll want to talk about the next day and without the fuss of most fine dining establishments.
author: Britt M.

description:
3.5 stars

Came in on a Thurs night around 830 without reservations and were seated within a couple of minutes.  Bartender was attentive and asked if we needed drinks while we waited.

Ordered our drinks after we were seated.  I got the cardamom my dear and my friend got the minted memory.  My drink was definitely way too tart and sweet.  It's the type of sweetness that makes your throat kinda scratchy.  The minted memory was definitely more my type of drink.  Should've gotten that instead.

Got the eggplant for the app and although tasty, it's not very sexy.  It's a big piece of eggplant cut length-wise covered with some fried veggie chip and sauce plopped over three pieces of crusty bread.  So you have to cut up the eggplant yourself.  Maybe I'm a messy eater but because everything was sort of falling off the bread, my plate looked as if a toddler had been eating on it.  Tasty though, I'll give it that.

I got the salmon and my friend got the saffron rice.  I guess the saffron rice was good because his plate was clean.  It's three pieces of fried rice...like literally deep fried.  My salmon was a let down because it was super fishy.  I have no issues eating fish skin, but it didn't smell right. 

It's a cozy restaurant with the right amount of lighting.  It would be a really great date spot if it wasn't so noisy.  It was hard to hear the server and each other.  Overall, it was a nice meal, but that's mostly due to the company.  I wouldn't oppose to coming back again.
author: Sally T.

description:
Yum!
1 Yelp star for the pistachio meatballs appetizer with delicious pomegranate sauce

1 Yelp star for the delicious sea bass entree with chick peas and greens

1 Yelp star for the terrific service

and of course 1 Yelp star for the ambiance. I love the cozy entrance way and the bench outside. The restaurant can get alittle noisy which makes it difficult to hear conversations but overall a great place. I will definitely come back and make sure to sit outdoors!
author: Helen Y.

description:
I've passed this place plenty of times and finally got to stop in tonight for dinner. We ordered a round of drinks first: persian breakfast, an absinthe frappe and an Affligem Blond Belgium beer. First time having this beer and I liked it. It was light enough to drink during dinner.The absinthe frappe has some sort of licorice flavor.

We then started off with kashk bademjan, pistachio meatballs, and spice-roasted bone marrow. The meatballs were really tender including the pistachio. I hardly noticed the nuts in it and it came with this pomegranate juice that just compliments it well. The kashk wasn't as great. The eggplant was a little hard.

I then ordered the "jeweled" duck while my boyfriend got the lamb neck. Both were absolutely fabulous and tender and juicy. The lamb neck also came with a big lamb chop. The juiciest meat ever. The duck was also perfectly seasoned and deliciously tender. The candied toppings were a little weird, but it went well with the dish.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Lovely decor.  Exceptional service, with friendly staff.  Enjoyed the specialty drinks and eggplant appetizer. I had meatballs and my friend had the salmon they were both delicious.
author: Sue S.

description:
I was excited to try Zare at Flytrap after reading a bunch of press about it, specifically Daily Candy a few weeks back. He definitely impresses...and his bartenders were super nice when we first showed up and had a drink at the bar.

We were an intimate table of 7, seated in the back where we could enjoy our conversation. Our server was very nice and when he couldn't help too much with dietary needs at the table (mine) he invited the chef to come out. He was so so so friendly and completely accommodated me with no air about it. Now, THAT is service. I had the rib eye (incredible) and butter lettuce salad (anything butter lettuce rules in my book). The wine menu is impressive as is the dessert menu, but we had to miss that as we had dessert waiting for us later at a party. The pistachio meatballs and sardines appetizers were supposedly the hit of the table.

I will definitely be back when I am back to my normal self and can eat a more variety of foods.
author: Meredith R.

description:
One of my go-to restaurants in the city. Have yet to be disappointed, except when they removed menage-a-foie gras from the menu :-)
ALTERNATIVE MUST TRY ITEMS: LAMB SHANK ABGUSHT and CARDAMOM MY DEAREST COCKTAIL
author: aj s.

description:
The happy hour was satisfactory.  $3 glass of Blanche de Chambly, and a $5 appetizer.  I got the sourdough, lavash, pesto, and tapenade.  The tapenade was really something different from what I'm used to in tapenade, creamy, sweet, and delicious.  The bread & lavash were serviceable.

The bartender was friendly, and didn't mind me coming in looking like Night of the Living Dead (I had been apartment hunting all day and it was hot) and even brought me extra tapenade after I scarfed down the first modest serving.

Now that I think about it, I'm pretty sure they undercharged me, cuz the bill was like $10.

All in all a pretty good experience.
author: Dann D.

description:
This is one of those restaurants where I felt the "signature" dishes were overhyped but the ones under the radar made up for it.

The pistachio meatballs that Yelpers seemed to rave about were, in my opinion, rather dry and somewhat bland.  And the pomenegrate glaze was too sweet for my liking.  On the other hand, the kashk' bademjan (braised Italian eggplant) was really tasty with a unique presentation served with yogurt and walnuts.  The heirloom tomato special appetizer was also quite nice.

For entrees, our server was so fervently recommending the lamb 'abgoosht' that most of us went with that dish.  The pulled lamb with potato and garbanzo beans, while perfectly fine, did seem to vaguely resemble corned beef hash.  And in comparison, the duck 'fessenjoon' served with wild rice was so tender and juicy that most of us looked on in envy at the one friend who went with that dish.

The fly trap martini (with hangar 1, sour grapes, cherry tomato and a pickle) was just ok.
author: F. P.

description:
Good performance, but nothing dynamo...Cool decor and vibe though - I'd come back for drinks.

Food:
-Butter lettuce salad - tasty
-Bone marrow on toast - neutral
-Gormeh Sabzi (herb stew with rice and short rib) - tasty but not quite right
-Cauliflower w/ pine nuts - not caramelized/roasted enough, meh

Service is friendly, a bit on the slow side.
author: Priscilla T.

description:
Came here the other day with my co-workers, we had a EARLY dinner before a POP show and I must say it was DELICIOUS! :) They opened at 4pm and our reservations were at 4, but I don't think they were quite ready so we sat at the large tables by the bar. And I must say the whole restaurant is cutely designed and decorated. 

We got appetizers and we shared some entrees; the Short rib was mouth watering and my co-workers Trout salad was also stand-out! Overall it was great experience, I want to come back, maybe on a hot date or something. haha. Another plus was that they had a vegetarian menu, so one of my co-workers had a large selection to choose from. Will come back again!
author: Michelle Y.

description: We've made many visits. Great date place whether you are married or single. Wonderful ambience. Consistently delicious meals and cocktails. Staff very attentive and genuinely nice.
author: tureg u.

description:
I had dinner here on a Friday night. I had a reservation for two and we were seated immediately. The bar was really crowded, but it wasn't overly loud or noisy in the dining area. Pretty standard noise for a Friday night in any restaurant.

Our server was friendly and accommodating. We ordered two glasses of champagne to start. I think they came close to separating an entire bottle into those two glasses. Very healthy pours.
We'd brought a bottle of red. Corkage was 20$ which, in my experience, is pretty average.

We started with the pistachio meatballs (mostly based on the Yelp reviews I'd read). They did not disappoint! Wow. I'm pretty sure I've had a few dreams about them lately. That good.

For dinner I had the special - prosciutto and brie (?...I can't actually remember what the cheese was) stuffed chicken breast. My guest had the lamb. Both were amazing and I'd recommend to anyone. Great portion size as well.

I'll definitely return for dinner in the future.
author: Jasmine S.

description: Where do I start! A group of 4 of us went here on a Tues night for dinner. We ordered the Trio of Hummus which came with roasted squash, roasted beet, herbed yogurt, and crispy lavash - delish! The presentation was to die for, the pitas were soft and warm and all 3 flavors of hummus were distinct in flavor. The Pistachio Meatballs had red harissa, honey, and pomegranate - were a medium size and very flavorful. Must try for meatball lovers. The Orange and Wild Arugula Salad came with arugula, fennel, leeks, mint, cilantro, manouri cheese, walnut oil and pomegranate dressing - another nice and light starter with very fresh ingredients. The 2 lamb dishes for dinner were Grilled Lamb Sirloin and the Zaré Lamb Burger with french fries. The lamb was cooked to perfect - not chewy and not pink, as we requested. The burger was actually better than the sirloin. For a chicken item, we ordered the Marinated Chicken Breast Jerusalem which was also very juicy and flavorful. Definitely would go back for a special occasion or take people from out of town here as the staff was very friendly, the location had easy parking and the food was remarkable.
author: Shikha S.

description:
They make a great sidecar.

Bar is a nice setting for meeting a friend or a date, as it's pretty quiet. Attentive bartenders and the foods smells pretty good - can't wait to come back for dinner.
author: Alita M.

description:
This place has it all, great decor, friendly service, a menu just for vegetarians (extra bonus), farmer's market fresh ingredients and even the owner/chef comes out every now and then to serve food to the patrons.   Everything about this place is classy and inviting.  Yes its a little pretentious and the people who dine there might be as well, but if you want good quality Persian fusion food at moderate price this is your spot. 

Notable dishes are the heirloom tomato/cowgirl creamery cheese which is a great way to start the meal because of its freshly delicate taste.  My personal fav the vegetarian kufteh tabrizi, which taste more like a falafel than a meatball is filled w/ Bulgar, beans and veggies. It was nicely served and very delicious. Oh and the avocado salsa that was served with it compliments very nicely. 

To end the meal I highly recommend the goat cheese cheesecake.  It was the creamiest most delicate cheesecake I think I've tasted.  My only complaint was the dates were kinda just set on the plate almost like an after thought.  Although I can see why putting them on the side might more appealing to people who don't like dates.  Nevertheless, I love the concept as well as the food!
author: Molly M.

description:
Came in on a Sat evening around 8:40PM. Place was going, wasn't too loud, prob around 85% capacity.

Buddy and I stood around waiting for several minutes just to be even acknowledged by the staff even though they were walking by us. That was the first negative. Next was the drinks. That took another 5~10 minutes just to have someone come by and ask if we wanted anything. 

Finally got to ordering around 9:05ish. Appetizer, the eggplant w/ lamb, came out about 15 minutes later. They were TOUGH. Definitely not typical eggplant. I forget what type it was, but I've had Chinese, Italian, Filipino, and Japanese varieties, and when cooked well, they aren't TOUGH. Flavor was pretty good.

After that, our entrees arrived at about 9:45. 

Edit:  I couldn't remember what I had exactly, so I went to the website to check out the menu, but apparently it changes often. I got a skirt steak though. It was cooked well, lots of flavor, and tender, but there just wasn't enough of it for the price. Again, I felt the wait was way too long. 

It too forever to get the check (notice the trend?). Was hard to flag down the waitress. I mentioned the eggplant was really tough, and they were nice enough to knock it off our bill.  We tipped the standard amount, but we thought it was too much for the mediocre service.

Overall, food was decent, service not so good with the long wait times, hence the 3/5 stars.
author: yule t.

description:
Interesting cocktails - a different take on some classics and some new concoctions. I will be back to try the cardamom one. 
Everything was wonderful...
Pistachio meatballs - order these, you will not regret it!!
Sumac couscous salad w/crab - a lighter appetizer 
Lamb burger - yum yum yum
Pulled lamb gemelli - apparently it was good, bf ate all of it before i could try it
An interesting take on fusion.
author: Sara P.

description:
Vegetarian menu??? I had such high hopes!

Alas, I wasn't crazy about this place. We tried pretty much all of the veggie menu (and some other items) since we went for my birthday earlier this year and only the eggplant stuck out as particularly delicious. I think this place is excellent for drinks and appetizers given the amazing ambiance and fun drinks, just didn't satisfy the dinner craving.
author: Raina B.

description:
The food was great! We got 3 appetizers (it was so hard to choose!): the koofteh tabrizi, the steak + lavash, and the lamb sausage. All three were DELICIOUS, beyond imagination! We had two martinis, anar daiquiri and persian breakfast, again WONDERFUL! I could not believe that a martini with egg white could be so delicious :D anar daiquiri is on the sour side, and the persian breakfast on the sweeter side. 
For food we had scallops and lamb burger, both were delicious. I loved the barberries in the pasta (in the scallop dish), and the spices that were used in the pasta, absolutely heavenly! 
Unfortunately we didn't leave enough space for dessert, so that means that we will definitely come back. And I would love to try the pistachio meatballs! 
Best of all, Chef Zare' was very attentive and visited every table personally to make sure everything is ok and interact with the guests. :)
author: Arezou K.

description: Love the service here first of all!  The owner and bartender are awesome; they take the time to chat with you and even remember your favorite drink order.  They make fantastic food (highly recommend the meatballs and the eggplant dish!).  I love the atmosphere both for all sorts of occasions - drink after work, nice dinner, etc!
author: Jessica J.

description:
3 1/2 stars 5 stars for the appitizers

date nite sure, good spot for couples, first dates, blind dates, u get picture date spot. haha

the appitizers here i thought were excellent the entree's though I didn't think were the best they could do, came here for my wifes bday celebration, no large groups just me and her reconnecting after long day of work. reservation was for 8 got there early cuz in this area parking is notoriously always difficult to find, so arrived a 7:20 got seated at 7:40 got one of there hungarian ales that they had on tap, delicious tasted like a mix of stella and mix of hef without the full feeling after drinking it. the wife had a martini she like it so much i think she order 3 total, haha lush i know haha

appitizers here is what we ventured in trying:

-pistachio meatballs total of like 3 regular sized meatballs covered in a bbq type sauce, it was good but not really $12 good, I could of got a bag at IKEA for that cost haha
- bone marrow i know it doesnt sound that great but hey if your a guy and you love vietnamese soups that have this or any soups that have this, usually filipino soups like sinagang or da biet soups offered at your local pho spots beef tendon if not marrow is wut you look for. they offered this marrow still in the bone, with thin sliced croquetes and baby pickes with a bit of sweet but spicy, for the most part these made appreciate all the other food that was gonna come out haha. my wife does not like marrow but she described it like this it is like butter but with a hint of meat meshed smeared on a croquete with sweet salsa and a tiny pickled pickle what in that sentence is not to like haha.

entree 
- wifed got the filet mingnon - tender, lil juice, med-rare, for a meat guy like me didn't make the grade for steak it got a C+ grade. here is why for taste, portion, juiciness didn't hit high marks only presentation gave it the +, wife also ordered side of fries it came with saffron and mayo is wut it tasted like, hahah can't go wrong with saffron and mayo or fries for that matter.
- I ordered the lamb shank ok it was good here are the props I give for what they made me, juicy, tender, portion, presentation all A's the taste though fell short, there was a sauce on top and around it but it was bland, no salt shaker on the side to spice it up, again everything in regards to the lamb was good except the taste if that is not there then ur kinda eating a bland slab of meat. = (

desserts
- ricotta balls donut holes with two dipping sauces one like honeyish the other thick chocolate cream
- goat cheese cheesecake - I love cheesecake so I had to try it, unless you love, and i mean really love goat cheese, do not order this cheesecake, once in you can taste it for days literally days!!!

I would recommend this place to dating couples definite must try, I would stay away from the entree's and just order appitizers and drinks, If I do head back they offer a oxtail pasta this alone would be a come back visit just for that plate and the bone marrow appitizer of course haha

food *** 1/2 appitizers bone marrow is 5 stars, pistachio meat balls were good but not $ 12 good, skip the entree's stick with the appitizers and drinks
price $$$ appitizers $12 and under, entree $40 and under, drinks beer on tap $5 martini $ 5.50 desserts pass they are about $9 each if not more
author: Clarence A.

description:
I LOVE brussel sprouts, and if you do, too, you have to check out their crispy brussel sprouts.  DELISH!  Makes my taste buds do their happy dance.

Checked this place out with 4 of my friendies last night, and I'd definitely go back.  The vibe of this place was warm, friendly, and cozy.  Actually, the temperature was also warm inside, which was nice because SF was nippy!  Our waiter was 5 stars - gave us impeccable service.

In addition to the yummy brussel sprouts, I also had the Fly Trap Martini and the Pan-Roasted Alaskan True Cod.  Liked my meal - pretty tasty.  Three of us ordered cocktails and the consensus was 'pace yourself'.  Definitely sippy drinks.  The vodka martini was STRONG - like on steroids, throwing a piano into a second story room from the ground floor strong.  They used Hangar 1 vodka, though, and that wins points with me.  

I'd go back, but I'd probably get a glass of wine (I know...I'm a big baby).
author: Ashley D.

description:
I'm always a little intimated when going to a fancier restaurant than I'm used to, but I'm glad we decided to dine here. Yes, it was pricey, but we all enjoyed our dishes. All of the dishes had such interesting ingredients and flavors. 

I had the pistachio meatballs with a side of garlic fries and it was yummy. My friends ordered a duck dish and a lamb dish. And for dessert we had baklavah (not quite sure how to spell that). For the most part the service was friendly.

My only big complaint was when we were leaving it was pouring outside and we are not from the area, so we asked the host to call us a cab and he said it would be better if we caught one down the street. It was pouring....i didn't mind the wait but he wouldn't call. So we had to run to the Marriott a block down in the rain to catch one : /
author: Danielle R.

description:
Been here multiple times and am a big fan.  They do outstanding craft cocktails here.  

Every dish I've ordered or sampled has been absolutely delicious.  They do a great job of adding interesting little twists on common dishes that give them that little edge.
author: Jason T.

description:
When I first moved to the city I always wanted to give this place a try.  (With a name like the fly trap, it had to be good!)  Too bad I waited forever and a couple days to finally make a reservation.  An outstanding restaurant where the chef/owner and the staff enjoy surprising guests with inventive, flavorful and imaginative dishes.  

The ostrich carpaccio and the pistachio meatball appetizers were awesome.  Cocktails were above average (except for the breakfast cocktail they had, which was amazingly plain).  Entrees (Lamb Shank and Halibut) were also very tasty.  The highlight of the meal, though was the deconstructed lemon meringue pie, which was seriously good.

Service was also outstanding.
author: Nobody M.

description: My wife and I visited Zare during a recent trip to San Fran and based on the recommendations of our fellow Yelp'ers decided to check it out.  We were very glad we did.  Perhaps we looked a bit lost, because Valen (female bartender) took us under her amazing "wing" and took care of us all night at the bar.  She concocted a few fabulous drinks and then started bringing out various small plates for us to sample.  We tried the meatballs (exquisite and unique), the bone marrow (a real treat), the smoked trout (excellent) and the Kashk Bademjan (an eggplant dish that we would travel back to California for).  We topped it all off with a bit of deconstructed Baklava.  It was a wonderful experience and a memorable evening.  Valen rocks it, and she knows it, but it was just what we wanted (needed?) that night.  Check it out, I don't think you will be sorry.
author: Dave Y.

description:
Great happy hour. Very friendly bartender. Choose between two quality beers for $3 a pint. Can't beat that in that area. I believe there are other specials as well for wine and well drinks but I haven't explored that part of the menu yet.

The selection of alcohol there is top notch as well.
author: Rich S.

description: I want to like this restaurant. The atmosphere was just so relaxing but upscale. It was just so pretty. The beets were sliced and I preferred mine to be thicker or chunks of beets. After eating the beets, I was excited for the entrees. The short ribs were fall of the bones goodness but there was not enough salt. The duck was tender and flavorful but not enough salt. There was a kinda weird maybe burnt taste to the rice. The entrees had potential but it missed because of the lack of salt. I guess someone stole the salt shaker.
author: Eve C.

description:
This was a very hit-and-miss experience for me.  My bf and I came here to celebrate our anniversary, as it was right across the street from the hotel where we were staying.  No problem getting a table at 7pm on a Monday night.  I really liked the ambience - it wasn't too noisy, the decor was tasteful, etc.  

First, I ordered the lime-cardamom-gin cocktail.  Usually, when I order a drink like this, I ask ahead of time how sweet it is.  On the menu, however, it didn't say anything about this drink having simple syrup or other sweeteners, and I'm not a big fan of super-sweet drinks.  (Seriously, it said lime juice, gin, cardamom.  That doesn't sound sweet to me!)  I took one sip and it was like drinking  limeade that was made with not enough water.  Extremely sweet, and extremely tart.  I could not taste the gin or the cardamom at all - just this cloying, sweet lime juice.  I didn't want to be difficult, so I tried a few more small sips before deciding there was no way I could drink this thing.  

So when the waiter came back, I asked him if there was something the bartender could do to make the drink less sweet.  He suggested more lime juice, which I thought was not the best idea given how tart the drink already was.  So then he suggested taking the drink away and bringing the menu so I could order a different one with his recommendations for something less sweet.  I went with this and he took away my almost-full drink and brought me this dry martini that he recommended.  I am not a big martini drinker and I didn't read the description carefully, so it was my fault that I picked a standard martini.  This isn't really my favorite beverage but at least it was drinkable.  And since I had already sent something back, I didn't want to do it again.  Moving on...
