It's a good place to go if you want a traditional meal (starter, entree, dessert), but it was also great for splitting small plates. I hear their meat entrees are delicious, but I didn't try any myself.

The cocktails are really good. I'm looking forward to returning and trying others. The beer list was also extensive and varied. Service was also excellent. Given the number of small plates we ordered, our server was kind and asked us in what order we wanted them, and waited until we were done with each set before bringing out the next. Uh yeah, we pigged out.
author: Pop L.

description: Decided to try this place because it was right next to Mefil (see my other review). Food was ok, but expensive. They're going for an old SF supper club feel, but they fail to pull it off. There was a live piano player, but when he took a break the silence was deafening. Service was good, but there was no one in the restaurant. Bathroom was dumpy. There are better places to drop $80 on a meal.
author: Jeremy S.

description: This place has fantastic ambiance.  They have several tucked away rooms in the back which is great for business lunches.  A dimly lit bar with strong drinks, perfect for after-work drinks.  I remember really enjoying their food...although, I think it *may* be pricey (gotta love agency/client lunches).  I miss working in SOMA :(
author: Helen F.

description:
Service: Excellent. Came back constantly to check on us and see if we were satisfied with the food. Refilled our water constantly.  The chef seated us when we went in and came out during dessert to make sure we enjoyed the food and to show us how to eat the 'not your grandma's pie'. He was very nice.
Price: Not cheap. 210 for 4 people.
Food: 
Appetizers:
- Mushroom Cake: One mushroom cake for 12 bucks. Pretty expensive. But the sauce, the texture, everything about it was delicious.
- Eggplant: This one didn't really taste like your difficult eggplant dish. It was very flavorful, tender, and delicious.
Entree:
We each got a different entree and sampled each other's.
- Salmon: Salmon was eh...I'm not too big on salmon so i guess it didn't impress me too much.
- Pork: The pork came with a nice amount of fat. it was quite tasty but a little bit too greasy for me..
- Chicken: The chicken came in a broth. it was quite flavorful but just ok.
- Filet Mignon: this was the best dish. The meat was cooked just right, very tender, and flavorful. The side of potatoes and salad was delicious as well. 
Dessert:
- Not Your Grandma's Pie: What a catchy name, right? The pie came in three parts...crumbs, filling,and whipped cream. What you do is swoop the spoon through all the ingredients and make your own little pie. Very creative, unique, and tasty.
- chocolate mousse cake: It wasn't too sweet but had just enough chocolate in it. It had a caramel/beer sauce. I got it with a chocolate sauce instead because I can't have alcohol right now. It was just as good. ;)
Drinks:
- Mint Memory (virgin): I was a little skeptical as I have never had this drink, but it was delicious. It had a hint of lime, cucumber, and lemon.
author: Pika C.

description: This is a must try. The goat cheese cheesecake is so interesting- in a really good way.
author: Amy B.

description: Best burger in SF!  I love this place, the ambiance...oh la la! :) Will be back again!
author: Nazli P.

description: Zaré at Fly Trap Mediterranean and Persian cuisine is delicious, very nice presentation and the service is great with a nice atmosphere. We had appetizers and for main course filet mignon and lamb, the dessert was pretty unique. They have a good selection of European wines.
author: Gigi W.

description:
A first class experience at a great price. Every member of staff knows their stuff from wine's, beers, coctails to the fabulous food. Ask their advise/opinion they have extensive knowledge and make the whole experience complete. Bring your taste buds and explore the cullinary delites that Hoss produces. 

Thank you Hoss, Meg, Valen, Fernado, Mia plus others for making every visit special, including happy hour.
author: Keith H.

description: Cool place... very nice to get a taste of Iranian food. Our waitress was awesome. She was a vegetarian - and so is my girlfriend - so she helped her find some good soup that we'd never heard of. My girlfriend loved it, and she's a HUGE soup-snob (in a good way). She tried to find a similar soup on the Internet, and no one had ever heard of it. Needless to say the Chef behind that kitchen is a mastermind in cooking. My lamb that I got could have used a BIT of salt, but I love salt on everything. Other than that, the place was great. I'd for sure come back. It had a soothing atmosphere that was much needed after a crazy day at work.
author: Ward A.

description:
Bar and Bread Review only. 

. A cozy escape from the dreary July wind and fog routine (+1)
. A much-needed cocktail, for $3.50 before 6:30pm (+1)
. A basket load of free bread when we asked (+1)

Beyond that, maybe it's just not my scene. A mismatch of customers -- some trying to enjoy a quiet meal, others yelling about Java programming (in my ear, no less). I might be back to try the food, but I'll hold out until I can get work to foot the bill.
author: Erin M.

description: I liked the romantic ambiance here. But the food was hit or miss. The menage a foie liver dish had only one hit, the foie.  The wines were okay, but the cocktails are creative and refreshing.
author: Derrick V.

description:
Had dinner w/ a friend here on a Tuesday night at 8:30p.

The service was impeccable and the food was even better.  Staff was incredibly attentive and very obliging.  Made my steak perfect!!  Friend's review of salmon was excellent.

Started w/ the carpaccio (great!) and ended w/ fresh fruit for dessert.  Fruit was obviously fresh.  Chose a great glass of red which complimented my steak wonderfully.

Will definitely be coming back!!  And would love to try the HH...meet ya there Rada...
author: Ninja H.

description:
...for the happy hour

$3 vodka drinks and $1 fresh oysters sitting in own liquor

very happy hour indeed.
author: Ed L.

description:
This was an odd place to find ourselves after the Cubs v. Giants game.  It was even odder that we headed in with the couple that we met at the game for another beer.  It was completely random (as is the Fly Trap) which I think made it that much more fun.  

It's an old dark place with old not so dark people...  The bartender, Chris, was great.  Funny & attentive without being too overbearing.  What started out as one round of drinks turned into like five.  We quickly took over the bar.  We then ordered most of their appetizers and they were damn good.  It wasn't cheap... but it was yummy.  As a substitute for dinner, it was a good call.  The crab cake, carpaccio and smoked salmon were my favorite.  I could definitely see why folks like this place for lunch....
author: Christine M.

description: I really want to love this place.  It is right in my neighborhood and we need more places open in soma on the weekends.  I've tried 3 times and each time is mediocre.  Wait staff is great, wine is good, but unimpressed with the food.
author: Katie A.

description:
A random Saturday night in San Francisco (best foodie city ever) a few friends and I were looking for a bite to eat. We weren't picky and were about to settle for a random union square dinner when someone suggested we go to Zare. I was cold and cranky but agreed. And WOW...what a wonderful surprise!

This place was amazing. The decor inside was very inviting and cute with french wallpaper. The service was great. The owner, Hossein, personally served us. And most importantly the food was incredible. Hands down the most original modern fusion rendition of persian classics I've ever tasted. A few of my personal favorites: ghormeh sabzi with fish, tabrizi meatballs, goat cheese cheesecake (!), faloudeh (persian ice dessert) with rose and tequila. I can't wait to go back, I am drooling just writing this review! Highly recommend for a date or a feast with good friends. Do not forget to order dessert.
author: Asa A.

description:
I had a New Years eve get together with my family. I ordered last minute at this place, since the Outback had a blackout..BOO HOO.

Anyhoo, I ended up calling 6 hours before the New Year and ordered:

Crab Cakes - Very excellent quality crabmeat - 5 stars
Crab Agnollotti (think crab ravioli in a cream sauce) Creamy, lots of crab meat - 5 stars
Oysters Rockerfeller - 10 stars...oysters baked with pernod, cream spinach, garlic, parmesan cheese and spices
New York Strip steak - medium, nice and flavorful
Side Salads - crisp and refreshing
Creme Brulee-Pefect way to end the meal

The staff were very friendly when I went there to pick up the order.
They offered us a complimentary drink and were very efficient in
a) making sure my order was correct and everything was there
b) gave alot of bread and butter
c) asked if we wanted utensils or not
d) thanked us and wished us a happy new year

The food was consumed while watching the twilight zone marathon. We really had a nice time. This was a very pleasant experience...great food, great family, and great day.

Ooooh. Make sure if you pick up you have someone driving around since there is no frickin parking at Folsom and 2nd street. UGH
author: Charlene C.

description:
Yay for the yummy food and the adorable bartender.  This bar makes me feel like I should be a character in American Psycho, very posh.  I can't wait to go back and booze it up with vodka martini's after work again.  

We only had bar food, the oysters and the mozzerella salad were both delicious and satisfying.  Oh, and even though I already mentioned the martini's, they were HUGE!
author: Dana M.

description:
Service - Excellent
Food - Delicious
Atmosphere - Suffocated

This place is great. I went here for lunch with some co workers to celebrate our BIG proposal that we won. Since it was a special occasion so we wanted to go all out. We order a bottle of champagne and some escargot as appetizers. This was my first time eating escargot and it was scrumptious. For the main dish I had Pan Seared Sole, it's a thin sliced breaded fish. We each ordered a different dessert dish and shared with each other. The waiter was funny and upbeat. I also noticed that the majority of the people here was an older crowd.
author: Don and Regina S.

description:
I'd never been to Zare's previous establishment, so this was my first experience at one of his restaurants. The space was pretty nice and had an antique feeling that had just been renovated, overall I liked it. 

The dinner on the other hand was so so. For starters I had the Smoked trout with roe and cucumber "fettuccini". It was cool and refreshing, but the cucumber fettuccini was too creamy for my taste. My main was the Slow-roasted monkfish, and was definitely the fattiest monkfish these lips have ever tasted. It was good, but for some reason the fish just didn't seem like the best cut. My date's salmon actually tasted much better in my opinion, and I would've ordered that in retrospect. The dessert was probably the biggest highlight for me - we had peach and mango sorbet and the mango in particular was excellently fruity and fresh. 

I realize this is a new restaurant, so I should maybe cut it some more slack than typical, but given that Zare has a good amount of experience in the industry, maybe I was just expecting more?
author: Keyvan R.

description:
I miss the old FlyTrap.  Went in mid-afternoon for a business cocktail and some snacks. There were only a few other parties in there and service was slow. (Nice, but slow).

The food had potential but was trying too had to be different.

The grilled eggplant was not what we expected. Instead of an Italian-like broiled/grilled eggplant, this was more mashed into a mustard-colored puree. "It smells like my mom's old Asian medicinal recipes," Maggie said. 

Meatballs - one of them was too rare in the middle. They did not offer to take it back or take it off the tab.

Breadsticks/bread was extra. (A little tacky considering the prices they charged for other things...why not spread the cost out?)
author: Liz K.

description: Cool staff (sharp waitresses (ouch)), refined atmosphere - they used to be on Haight. Perfect Ceasear Salad which is difficult to get correct. Recomended.
author: Niall M.

description: This is really an exceptional restaurant, in terms of food, atmosphere, and warmth, mostly as a result of the chef/owner Hoss.  Last night I attended a special Persian Pub Grub feast of fine food with matching wines and beers...and we had to decide whether or not the chosen beer or wine was the better match.  In most cases, it was a difficult choice since both were handled so expertly.  In any case, the food was exceptional.  Of course, all of this is tongue-in-cheek since there is no such thing as Persian Pub Grub...and alcohol is not part of Persian culture.  Go and expect to be very well treated and fed!
author: Jim T.

description: Who knew this yummy place has been hiding out in SF as I've driven by many times. The inside is chill but classy with its very interesting decor....and the food was SUPERB! Everything from the pistachio meatballs....to the Lamb burgers and on to the delicious dessert...a whole new twist on Middle Eastern...a very exciting and enticing experience to say the least!
author: Lee M.

description:
My husband and I went here last night for dinner.  We ordered the mussels and clams (clams were sweet), escargot, crab ravioli, brie with honey and apples, and the sour creme chocolate cake.  Everything was pretty rich and creamy but delicious.  I would definitely come back here for the food.  

My only complaint was that I wish I could see the piano from where I was sitting.  If you sit at the bar, you'll get a better view but who would want to sit there for dinner.
author: Anna S.

description:
Overall, a very good experience at the Fly Trap -- the food was really quite good. Thanks to all the yelpers who steered us to the crab ravioli (agnolotti?) and the chicken jerusalem!! (Although I had to put up with my partner and our friend making "chicken jerusalem" jokes all the way to the restaurant...don't even ask...)

It was a little loud since we were right by the piano and jazz singer, but that was okay because the maitre'd warned us when we called in our reservation (there were 2 big parties there that night). They were incredibly friendly when we got there, but some of the waiters seemed a little harried. It was all with good intention to serve us well though, so we were cool with it. Nice ambiance -- cozy and romantic (just don't sit RIGHT by the piano...).

I'd be willing to go back for that crab ravioli...
author: Gray C.

description:
The best thing about Fly Trap for me is the ambiance.  You walk in and it just doesn't feel like San Francisco anymore, which depending on your mood, could be a really nice change up.  Every inch of the small room has been decorated and it really sets an upscale tone... probably one more geared for your parents, but hey I liked it.  I recently celebrated a friend's birthday here and the plush atmosphere, pianist, and singer were a great touch for the evening.

For me the major setback however was the food.  It wasn't bad, it just didn't meet my expectations after walking in.  It was pretty simple and the flavor was decent.  Nothing bad, but definitely nothing worth paying approximately $19 - 25 per entree for.  I tried the salmon which was cooked nicely, but paired with some rather boring mash potatoes and a simple salad.  I also tasted the pork chop which was a little tough but came with a good sauce.  The bar, however, provided great drinks to make up for things.

The other setback was the service.  It was extremely SLOW and my water glass was completely empty for about 85% of the evening.  The wait staff was just NOT attentive at all.  Even while I was waiting at the bar until my party arrived, I had to get up from my barstool to go flag down the bartender after waiting 15 minutes at a half empty bar just so I could place a drink order.

If the food could get a little more interesting I might be able to overlook the poor service in light of the charming decor.
author: Dubs W.

description:
First, let me say that I have been going to the "fly" for almost 7 years. My first year in the city, I went there with my bosses, as we worked across the street. This was the first bar that ever servered me in SF and where i proceeded to get so drunk I was spewing my guts out by the tree on Hawthorne Lane. So I have a strong affiliation to the flytrap. It brings up many memories and good times...

Went there last night for a friend of a friend's bday, and while I cant really stand the bday girl, the booze was free, and so was the cake. I also appriciated the free, homemade ruffle chips that are warm and crunchy! Now I am not giving them 4 stars bc of the free goods, but it does help. The bartender was really nice, refilled promptly, and the risotto was yummy. I will always consider this place a staple.
author: Sara A.

description:
5 Stars to J the bar-tender.  He was our waiter the first time we went and mixes a mean cocktail - old school with a twist.  Seriously, go down there and have this man make you a drink.

Last time we were there, a patron was telling us the Fly Trap is going under new management, and sure enough a few days later there was a City notice in the window.  I'm worried.  This restaurant is classic - old wood, antique prints completely covering the walls with gilt frames.  You feel like you're stepping back in time.  There are plenty of places in SoMa that are "the club."  Let's hope this doesn't become one of them
author: Tullia F.

description:
Update:

Just went there again and found it was sold to new owners.  My favorite pasta dish was no longer even offered as they were waiting to use up all the ingredients in the kitchen before the new owners were to take over.

So, the jury is out... .who knows what the new owners will bring.
author: Grace S.

description:
I just came here yesterday for a work function, the food was amazing! i ordered the market fish, which was served over risotto and 3 different kinds of mushroom. it was absolutely delicious. i ordered a cab/syrah bottle of wine under the "peace in the middle east" header, which was also a good choice. We had a few appetizers, the fois gras consisted of goose, sheep and chicken...i loved the goose and not so much the sheep so i didn't try the chicken! but the eggplant was great. it had a great curry-yogurt like sauce to it. 

The place seemed pretty small, but it was well-lit so it was nice. The only thing is we were sitting pretty close to the bar, so it was quite loud and hard to hear. overall, though, the food was great!
author: Natalie J.

description: I love this place.  The california food with persian flare is very distinctive...  I haven't been to another place in the city that compares.  Also, the staff is friendly and service is great!
author: W W.

description: The salmon was tiny and FAR FAR too pricey.  We ended up eating @ McDonald's five minutes later.  Everyone was still hungry, but now also broke.
author: Daniel C.

description: I really wanted to like this place. Unfortunately, the food was boring. I expected the lamb to be more fragrant and have umami. It was acceptable, but unexciting.
author: Jerry O.

description: Went here with 3 others a few weeks ago and we tried a wide range of dishes.  The vegetarian selection was why we came, since one of our party is vegetarian.  She had the mushroom cake and said it was great.  I got the beet salad and a half order of pasta, which turned out to be a fairly large portion.  We all liked the chocolate mousse and faloodeh for dessert.  All in all, I thought it was a little expensive, but a good spot for a special occasion.  We also heard their happy hour specials are decent, so I would consider coming back for that.
author: Marienna M.

description: What a delightful find this restaurant was.  I met a friend here and we are both foodies and thoroughly enjoyed our experience.  Each dish was unique, flavorful and delicious.  We also loved the wine that was recommended to us, and our waitress Nina from South Africa was the perfect server - there when we needed her but not overbearing.  If you go, you must try the Baklava for dessert - very different from the baklava you are used to, unique and absolutely to-die-for.  I look forward to going back to this restaurant!
author: S. T.

description:
WOW. What an incredible experience I had here last night. First walked in to discover how underdressed I was for this place and feeling awkward about that, and we were able to be seated a half hour earlier than our original reservation- which was pretty great! We first split the "menage a foie" which was DELICIOUS and rich and flavourful. The foie gras with the huckleberry sauce was especially good as well as the lamb with the tomato. Mmm. He got the famous lamb shank plate which with the torshi, which really adds a lot to the meat. The shank just fell off the bone. So damn good. I got the daily special risotto which had fava beans, pulled lamb neck or something?, and it was so rich I could barely put a dent in it but I was stuffed nonetheless. We decided to split the "Not Your Grandmother's Key Lime Pie" which has all the components for key lime pie in little piles (graham crust crumbs, lemon curd, coconut meringue and preserved lime) and you just sweep a fork along each one and it tastes just like pie. mmmm.

Also, the waiter was really great at suggesting wines to compliment our meals and that was a big help because although he admitted to being there just two weeks- he was so well versed in the menu and very very helpful! I appreciated that. Also, Hoss Zare comes out and talks to the various tables asking about the meals and how they are going. It's a rare occasion that I see this happen and I thought it helped with the whole ambiance of this place.

This place may just become one of my favourite places here in the city, hands down.

Real talk.
author: Lauren S.

description:
The food was delicious- pricey, but memorable. Service was good too.
There was a huge, obnoxious business party there that took away from the whole dining experience, so instead of being really enjoyable it felt like eating great food in a high school cafeteria.
author: MG H.

description:
I have to say up front that the food for me was probably more like a 4 or a 4.5, but the service and setting were stellar.

Overall the food was exactly what I was hoping for, Californian cuisine without the overblown intensity that I sometime associate with Mediterranean/ Middle Eastern-inspirations. Courses were steeped in quality ingredients and careful preparation.

My favorites were the pistachio meatballs and the filet mignon with gorgonzola. The dessert brioche with rose-water chocolate milk was super original, and tasty to boot. I personally would not order the fried mozzarella with anchovies again.

The service, from accommodating our last-minute reservation with smiles, to our friendly + attentive server and floor staff, was excellent. Chef Zare could be seen working the floor too, and he even checked in on our table and later presented us with a complimentary chevre cheesecake on shortbread cookie. Delicious.

Handsome space- attractive and tailored without being stuffy. The elements at Zare were soothing and comforting.

Great night and my visiting mother, sister and friend were very happy. I'm coming back and trying the lamb burger!
author: Matt T.

description: YUMMY!  Love this place - the food, decor and ambience.  I always get the fried brussel sprouts with yogurt dip - delicious.  Other favorites:  salmon, lamb burger, mushroom cakes.
author: amy b.

description:
After today's visit I am reducing my rating.  The place was mostly empty, which makes me wonder If we are not alone.  The Salmon was WAY under cooked, and the Mahi Mahi was recommended to me, yet is was so fishy I could not even eat it.  Plus, the pretty hostess was not even there.  I will give it another try, but right now, I can not recommend it.


At one time, this was my least favorite place in the city.  Under new management though, they have really kicked it up a notch.  The food is good, the prices are high, but if you are looking for a nice place to take a client to lunch in the area, this is the place.  Reservations are recommended for lunch.  The Bathrooms are shared with Mefil, and are as you would expect a shared bathroom to be.  The Hostess and her sisteer are Russian bombshells, that are worth the trip alone.
author: Pele N.

description:
Love this place!  Went to dinner here this week, spent almost three hours chatting with my girls, drinking wine and eating yummy food.  I had a splendid time and would go back in a heart beat!

Overall, a little expensive but worth every single dime!  Delicious food, comfy atmosphere, rose petals on the table are a lovely touch and the bartender is cute too!  What more could a girl ask for?
author: Allison G.

description:
This place is actually pretty good. We went here with some friends from the south bay, and quite thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The food was good, and well worth the price (about 30 dollars a plate for a good New York strip). The only complaint, and I swear its the only reason docked a star from this place: the bartender apparently either doesn't know how to make a COLD martini. 

"Kettle One, the barest hint of Vermouth, Shaken extra cold." doesn't usually mean room lukewarm.
author: Eric P.

description: We enjoyed dinner here last night with friends. Started with a mean dirty Ketel martini which was so good we never switched to wine with dinner - we couldn't resist ordering a couple more dirties instead. The boys enjoyed the beer selection and tried a few. We opted for family style and shared the sausage, steak kabobs and meatballs to start. The sausage was our favorite, it had a good kick. Liked building lavosh wraps with the kabobs. The meatballs had a nice pomegranate sauce. For our mains we shared the filet, the lamb and the black cod. All were delicious and we finished all 3. The chef comped a dessert for us, a sorbet that we poured tequila over, nice flavor combination. Unique dining options in a warm setting with great service, recommended!
author: Sarah R.

description: Came here for happy hour with co-workers after work. Really cute decorations and a dark, intimate ambiance. We only ordered appetizers but their food was delicious - not too salty or oily, with appropriate portions. Definitely want to come back here and try dinner!
author: Janie Y.

description: This is deffinately one of my favourite fusion places in SF. They had the best food. Their wine was amazing. We had a few different italian cabernets that were great and went along with the mahi mahi. Speaking of their mahi it was awesome. I have never really liked mahi mahi but theirs was seriously the bomb! Also, I had their goat cheese cheese cake...innitially I thought that would be not so good....but to my shock it was indescribably amazing. I will be going back for sure in the future when I am back in the bay area!
author: Hassan A.

description: i love this place so much. i've been here a few times and i am never disappointed. chef Hoss Zare is so cool too. the last time i was here, i celebrated my birthday (i celebrated my birthday about 10 times this year haha), and it was such a treat! my absolute favorite thing on the menu is the faloodeh with pisco...best faloodeh ever. AND the pistachio meatballs with honey pomegranate glaze..mmmmmmmmm...i have had the salmon, lamb abgoosht, duck fesenjoon, short rib ghormeh sabzi, crispy brussel sprouts (changed my mind about them, love them now), bone marrow, etc. the list goes on...Hoss brought out a few special things for my birthday and it made the night that much better. love this place
author: Sheeva G.

description:
I had been meaning to try Fly Trap for some time and for some reason had never made it. Well, this last Monday I found myself within a few blocks of the restaurant and decided it was finally time to actually try it out. Overall, couldn't have been happier with the service and food.

We ate at the bar which was very pleasant. The bartender was very nice, attentive, and interesting to speak with. As far as the food, we ordered the pistachio meatballs (the special meatballs they make on monday's were all sold out!) and the smoked trout. Both were delicious but I was really impressed by the trout. The presentation was great and the flavors were amazing. After our apps, we ordered the sourdough bread & lavash, yogurt marinated flat iron steak kebob, and fried buffalo mozzarella. Everything was tasty but I particularly liked the kebob. The yogurt was refreshing with the bread the steak was well prepared.
And finally for dessert we ordered a deconstructed cake...can't remember what it was called. I'd never seen a dessert presented like this before. The cake was broken out into its components -  from the meringue to the sauce etc. etc. It was very good but the best part was you could eat more of the section of the cake you like. 

We had the pleasure to meet the chef at the end of our meal. Very nice and approachable. He was kind enough to offer us a glass of Muscat which was phenomenal and a great way to finish off a fantastic meal.
I was impressed by the food, the chef, and the overall service. Definitely plan on coming back, especially on a Monday so I can try some of their meatballs :)
author: shadi m.

description: Love this place! Great service and the food.....let's just say one of the best Salmon dishes I've had! Tried my wife's Filet Mignon,....so soft the knife would just fall through it! Everything here from the buffalo mozzarella appetizer to the goat cheesecake dessert was delicious. Highly recommend this place.
author: Amit V.

description: love the feeling/decorations in here...dim lighting, classy vibe, and comfortable. for appetizers i'd recommend the pistachio meatballs...DELICIOUS and complex flavors and a great dish for sharing (3 meatballs). for all my fellow eggplant lovers, get their eggplant dish that's basically a huge piece of eggplant on top of sourdough bread with dried fig chips on top. i'd skip on the bone marrow...it's not much for the money and i really didn't taste much flavor there. for my entree i got the roasted chicken which was pretty dry unless i ate it together with the sauce and couscous served underneath it. i wasn't blown away by my dinner but it was still a really pleasant experience, especially with the great service and comfortable, classy atmosphere. i'll probably come back here again to give some more dishes a try.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Great first restaurant meal of 2010. My husband and I ordered the meatballs as an appetizer and they were unexpectedly delicious!  I think I crave them now.  The dinner portions were of a good size - for dinner we had the salmon and the ghormeh sabzi, which were both superb.  The salmon was cooked perfectly and the meat in the curry just fell off the bone.  Everything about this meal was great.  We didn't have a reservation and they made sure to accodomate us.
author: Rise G.

description: I booked this restaurant for my birthday party, and really enjoyed the wide variety of food. It was a Mediterranean themed restaurant with a Persian/Indian twist. I'm a vegetarian, so I wanted to make sure I would be accommodated without compromising on flavor...and i was!!! I got the Kufteh Tabrizi, and the Mushroom Kabobs. Mario, the GM was very helpful in taking care of our large party. And the Chef performed his best for our loud party. BTW, the drinks were delish too! Esp. the Minted Memory! YUM! They even made us our own drinks if we provided a recipe. They also brought out a wonderful "Chocolate Torte" and another desert called fried milk torrijas. We ended up staying from 7-11 pm for a full night of fun. Parking was a breeze, and we could even walk over to Temple NightClub afterwards. Thank you so much for a wonderful evening!!
author: Palak K.

description: What a nice place - terrific happy hour with nice snacks and great wine.  Love the atmosphere and decor.  Great place for a quick after work drink.
author: Sallye M.

description: We were delighted with every bite.  The ample and succulent portions of fish, lamb, vegetables and lentils each presented a medley of unique flavors. The bartender has recreated a version of the original martini, a  savory concoction called the Martinez.  An elegant setting, with tables spaced well enough that we could actually conduct a conversation; but still gracious:  we arrived early after a day downtown, and were offered a table and a wireless code to get online.  Glad to see this update on a classic SF restaurant.
author: Ellen S.

description:
While I might try a regular dinner there in the future,as I have been to every one of Chef Zare's restaurants and loved them in the past, I was very disappointed in the large private party they hosted for us for a birthday. We had a guest list of 35-40 people, and no one at the restaurant told us that was going  be a HUGE squeeze in the private room. There wasn't room for most people to sit, and it was hotter than you-know-what with no air after a relatively short time. (yeah I should have seen the room before hand but they PROMISED me it would be no problem. I see now that  they have changed their website about that) 

I also made clear I wanted to have PLENTY of food (I'm Italian ,after all) and I wanted plenty of appetizers and snacks. The party manager, Mario, refused to  give me any numbers or guidelines of what or how much to  order - which I found bizarre. Hey I don't know how big your apps are, I'm not a chef or party host, YOU tell ME how much to order , isn't that how it works. I tried every which way to ask the question, and finally asked if I could pay a set amount per person for all the food we could eat - even it it was a high price per person at least I'd know  the food was enough. Mario said the chef "wasn't comfortable with that." Fine, I probably wouldn't be either, but then give me some guidelines. Especially as the apps were per piece and not per person. Mario finally said "8 -10 pieces should be plenty for the appetizers" so I ordered 10 pieces per person AND french fries AND the birthday cakes. 

SO we get to the party, only 28 people show up so I figure there'll be plenty right? NO. I had to order several more platters because people were still hungry (as was I) I was really embarrassed. I made it clear the money was not the issue, I wanted people to have plenty and they didn't even after the extra food. 

The other point I'd mention is that Mario was VERY hard to get a hold of, once I'd signed the contract. He kept saying my cell phone didn't work or the number was wrong,  when I gave him the number several times, and called  myself to make sure it was working. He stopped responding to emails and didn't even confirm the menu till I called the restaurant several times. 

And after reading all the notes about  how friendly Chef Zare was, and how he comes out to meet people - he didn't even stop by our party to say hello to us. I spent almost $2000 on the evening, and we did have a good time with friends  and family,  but when I sent a note mentioning these items,  I didn't even get a response till I called the restaurant several times. And Mario's response was "Did you expect something from us about this? in a really rude way.

 I think they took on the party for financial reasons,  and don't really want to do them. 
 .
author: Roberta D.

description: This is a fabulous restaurant. Great food and service. The wine list is top notch. Very high end establishment but a good price/value. Very romantic setting. Nice bar scene with live music. Reservations recommended.
author: Christopher S.

description:
i learned two things last night:

1) it doesn't hurt to go to a restaurant with a persian person, if said restaurant has a persian chef/owner
2) a pheasant is a bird, and NOT a mammal

yeah, maybe i'm not too bright.  the food was really good.  meatballs where fantastic.  the risotto was creamy goodness, with shroomies and duck confit.  the lavash and spreads were decent.  the pheasant dish was tender and awesome!  the couscous salad was tasty, and i don't normally even like couscous that much.  the deconstructed key lime pie was awesome!  although i'm not entirely sure of the whole "deconstructed" concept, since you end up shoveling everything together anyway...so maybe it's a visual thing?  maybe i'm just not very sophisticated.  the profiteroles with chocolate ice cream was really tasty too...but i was all about the pie....and the totally cute waitress....call me, waitress who is a photography major....hehehe...okay, that was totally lame....

this place has a cool vibe, and very attentive service....
author: Miss P.

description: I have been here a few times and have always been a huge fan.  However, this time I found the koofteh special to be inedible.  Also, the Shiraz salad was seemingly pre-prepared and refrigerated, as the tomatoes were soggy and the temperature was ice cold.  Not sure I want to spend my hard-earned money here again.
author: Yasmin F.

description: I LOVE this place.  My husband and I were on the fence about where to spend our first anniversary and settled on Zare, as I've been curious about it for a while.   The food was GREAT and the service was even better.  It's a really great setting-- small-ish and cozy, with just enough modern/ funky decor.  We had a perfect evening and it was probably half the price you'd pay for less food at a stuffy high end restaurant.
author: Amy W.

description:
I went with five other girlfriends on a Friday night, and it was a fantastic experience. The ambiance was lovely and intimate, with just the right amount of lighting: dim, but not too dim so you can't see the person across the table. It isn't too personal that if you aren't there on a date you don't feel out of place. The service was wonderful and so attentive--the server checked on us multiple times without being intrusive, and even Chef Hoss Zare came by twice to see how we were doing. 

Now the most important bit--the food! And my, was it delicious. A few of us split the pistachio meatballs, which were excellent: the sweetness of the pomegranate/honey glaze complemented the nutty meatiness. The smoked pheasant salad was fresh and quite good. I especially appreciated the combination of figs and the pleasantly smoky but not too gamy pheasant. For the main course, most of us went for the risotto of the day with lamb neck. The risotto was stuffed in a cute pumpkin shaped green squash with some type of green onion. The cheesy-but-not-too-cheesy risotto played very well with the bittersweetness of the onion and the fresh firmness of the squash. Because we were splurging, we all split the goat cheese cheesecake, and it was fabulous. I've made quite a few cheesecakes in my time, and this one was particularly fluffy from the goat cheese and not too sweet. It almost melted on your tongue, and thankfully not really dense like some cheesecakes can be. A great end to a great meal.
author: Nora M.

description: Came to Fly Trap for a work happy hour.  Never knew this place existed even though it's kitty corner from our office.  Was pleasantly surprised.  Very trendy bar to grab a drink at.  Had a pomegranate beer--very subtle taste.  Pretty good.  The bar bites were pretty good too.  Would be willing to come back with friends to try a meal perhaps too.
author: Christopher W.

description:
Had a great long dinner here.  Cool place.  Service was top notch, impeccable really.  Appetizers were amazing.  The main course was above average.

I highly recommend it.
author: Tom T.

description: Hands down my favorite place in San Francisco. The food by itself is 5 stars, but the chef/owner, Hoss Zare, makes every experience at the flytrap memorable. The appetizers are for me the highlight of the Zare experience; the bone marrow, fois gras, kebabs, meatballs, and short ribs are all exquisite. As for main courses, I would heavily recommend the lamb shank and the lamb burger as well as the fish. Desserts are very creative and delicious: the best is probably the yogurt with honey or the deconstructed cake (just get it!), but the goat cheese cheesecake and the profiteroles are close runners-up. definitely try out the cocktails, especially the Persian Breakfast...you won't be disappointed, guaranteed. Parking is easy, decor is classy, and the clientele are sf-sophisticates.
author: Rob G.

description: everything was delicious . from the salad  to the lamb ....  i was noticing how the chef was actually delivering the food and was on point with everything that came out of his kitchen .....  i work in the hotel industry , and we get hotel guests asking us for restaurants on a daily basis . i will be sending our guest to flytrap .
author: eric d.

description: Ambiance is so cool - great for catching up with friends at the bar or my favorite, group dinner at the long countertable by the window. Came here with a group of 12 and we were seated right away - on a Friday night at that. The food was yummy, particularly the crab cous cous salad, lamb skewers, pistachio meat balls, but do beware of the geleto/tequila/rice noodle/pudding type dessert. That tasted "interesting." Really good place overall though!
author: Chihee K.

description: Zare at Fly Trap gets 5 starts for customer service. I showed up last week to meet a friend for dinner and was immediately seated. After waiting about 20 minutes, I decided to order a drink and some appetizers. The waiter recommended possibly the best white wine I have ever had in my life: a Tajinaste listan blanco. I also had the chick peas. Well, my friend got stuck on the Bay Bridge and had to cancel, and while I felt awful about leaving, the host and the waiter were incredibly understanding. I will definitely return again (with a friend!) to try the entrees.
author: Deirdre P.

description: We had our wedding reception here a few weeks ago and it was amazing! Everyone there was so incredibly helpful and put in all of their effort to help us throw a really fun party. The food and cocktails are delicious and got rave reviews from all of our guests. This was the perfect place for our reception and we couldn't be more pleased with how everything turned out!
author: Cee B.

description:
Old school San Francisco - you can almost feel Herb Caen smiling down at you approvingly...

haven't been for dinner in a few years but can attest to its reliability as a lunch place - probably 60%+ business crowd these days as the large law firms are gradually dirtying their white shoes as they migrate from 94104 to SOMA.

Classic menu items are fish, liver & hangtown fries.  A friend always has the pasta that he attests is the best...

Very dependable.
author: David P.

description:
I miss the jazz!  The pianist and signer were such a lovely addition to our many many meals in the past (when it was just "Fly Trap").  We would actually crave items on the old menu...the salads, the soups, the desserts, the veal, the steak, the Stag's Leap Petite Syrah...all fabulous.

So to be honest when we walked in to the newly redecorated restaurant with a new menu I was a bit disappointed.  We decided to stay and eat.  Everything was lovely.  The food seasoning was subtle and delicious.  The wine list is eclectic and affordable.  The service was the best I have ever had at any restaurant in SF...absolutely impeccable.

I would give it 5 stars if only the pianist and signer were still in the back corner.
author: Mackenzie O.

description:
Just simply amazing food; great service.   I reluctantly made the choice to go there. 7x7 magazine was right on the ball on this place; and we were amazed.  The food, just simply amazing.  Don't know how else to explain it.  The bar tender very helpful.  When my wife wasn't sure which wine she wanted, the bar tender showed up with samples for all the wines by the glass.

Must tries:  
- Their Anar Daiquiri 5-star.  On the tart side pomegranate drink   
- Pistachio meatballs out of this world.  
- Their saffron aioli fries (it comes after dinner, and a really good way to top off the meal)

I hear really good stuff about their Meatball Mondays, and planing on making it there on Monday.

My wife and I can't wait to go back.
author: Adam L.

description: Just had dinner at Zare at Fly Trap last night and I've got to say it was wonderful.  The service was attentive but not intrusive, the food was delicious and the cocktails were interesting and powerful (the perfect combination).  I would recommend it to any of my friends, and plan on returning soon.
author: Mark H.

description:
I loved the old Fly Trap & want to love the new one - I loved the old Zare on Sacramento

However this is not that kind of place

I had a drink here at the bar - one, no food

The bartender made an overly-anise-y sazerac, tried to serve it up & was pissy when I asked for it in a lowball as is standard

The real surprise came with the check - she had added tax to my single drink - & it was $16.25

Guess how much the tip was? Yes, math fans - .75!

This is not the kind of bar where you can charge $16 for a drink that's not even that great

I will maybe give it another go as they do have a pretty solid stock of liquor & the food looks good (if a bit small for the price), but I won't be rushing back
author: Rachel O.

description:
mm - if this review was just based on the side dish of sourdough/lavash with feta walnut spread and caspian tapenade, this place would get a 5.

these spreads are so tasty and at such a great value it's worth coming back again just for it! Both spreads had excellent flavor, balance, and spreadability. Bread + lavash were also fresh and yummy.

Since the appetizers here all looked exciting, decided to make a meal out of it. Had both the pistachio meatballs and the braised eggplant. Both were tasty in a unique kind of way, but not as good as the side mentioned above. 

i did miss out on the dessert on this trip though=( i guess i'll have to go back! perhaps make a meal out of a side and a dessert?
author: Fuzzysaurus L.

description:
I truly loved this place.

The atmosphere is great. The lighting, the chairs, the decoration; all serves the purpose to put you in a good, relaxed mood.

The cocktails that my husband and I ordered were delicious, so were the two glasses of wine (very good and reasonably priced wine list by the way).

I love the smoked trout with dill and cucumber linguine. And the meatballs were just out of this wold. I would come back just for this appetizer.

The entrees didnt disappoint us either. Both the fish and the ribs were prepared to perfection.

If you go to this restaurant, dont forget to order their homemade yogurt. They serve it as a dessert and it is delicious.

The service is impeccable.
author: Leona B.

description: Fantastic Persian/Mediterranean food.  We shared the mussels and clams appetizer which was awesome, as well as the giant sardines.  My lamb shank was the best I've ever had - moist, melt-off-the-bone tender and perfectly flavorful.
author: Bryan V.

description: Came here for a friend's bday dinner and was surprised.  I thought it was going to be another "wanna-be" high end restaurant serving mediocre food at inflated prices.  Instead, I was very impressed by the food.  The pistachio meatballs were good and the black cod and salmon dishes were both equally amazing.  To top it off, the service was top notch.  I hear the happy hour's good so i'll have to make it a point to come back and check it out.
author: Toby C.

description: Just home from dinner for 6 and if I could give Zare 10 stars I would.  The drinks were delicious (one Mai Tai had me buzzed), food was fabulous and our server, Fernando, was just wonderful.  I had the fried mozzarella and my devotion to all things fried was justly rewarded.  Followed this with the mahi mahi which was divine and finished things up with the fried milk (yeah for frying!) which has to be one of the best things I've ever eaten.  I was completely delighted and hope to be back soon.
author: Shelly R.

description:
you can see zare's hand in everything from the excellent service, food and plating.  from the time you are greeted or when the bill is served with little fly chocolates.  

you'll also see zare coming out and overseeing his staff, greeting patrons and he made sure that i got my to-go bag.

the california wine list is not great especially for sf but the choices from other countries were good.

the yesterday's soup is not served yesterday.  it's a slow cooked soup that just tastes better the following day when all the spices are really soaked in.

that night it was a mushroom soup - thick and savory with bits of garlic croutons and grilled shitake mushrooms peppered on top.
all the plating was done on white tableware.  the soup bowl was whimsical with it being over sized and tilted to the eater.

the dungeness crab linguine was mouthwatering with large chunks of delicious crab with grilled shrimp.  

the zare nicoise had seared ahi tuna - the tuna was an excellent grade and cut.  the quail eggs were beautifully integrated and not overwhelming at all.  another winner.

the signature lamb meatballs or burger were both tasty.

but save room for dessert.  if you think the savory dishes are good, they are known for wonderful desserts.

the goat chese cake was superb!  it had a creamy texture and with the sweet crust and bits of pistachios sprinked on top...

it was a perfect way to end a wonderful evening.
author: Anh V.

description: The food is very good and unique.  I went with friends and got the fillet menigon, and I loved it.  Others tried the duck and fish, and their food was great too.  In contrast to other higher-end restaurants, we didn't have to wait for too long to get the great food.  The only drawback is that it is a bit pricey, so I won't be able to go every week :-(
author: Tanya R.

description: This place is so elegant and classy. I loved the food. My husband and I ordered the filet mignon and the lamb shank....YUM!!!!!! The chef came out and greeted us as well. The wine was delicious too and looking around everyone seemed very happy with their meals. I cant wait to come back.
author: MG G.

description: A continued five stars for Zare!  I have been a regular now for almost a year, and always, always feel at home.  The service and the food are always top-notch.  Hoss, the owner, does a wonderful job of making you feel like you are an honored guest in his home, and feeds you wonderful food.  You can't ask for more than that.  The really interesting thing is that you can have many different experiences at Zare - happy hour, drinks and dinner at the bar, or a wonderful dinner seated at a table.  The staff are amazing as well.  You simply can't go wrong here - I give it my highest recommendation.
author: Sienna L.

description: Never having had Persian food especially with a twist, I was intrigued by the red awning off Second street and Folsom during my adventures around the beautiful city of San Francisco and came across "Fly Trap".  I felt a calling to one day come to know what this place was all about.  By chance, thanks through a suggestion from the world of social media I was connected to the infamous Chef at "Fly Trap" and knew that one day I would step foot in this artistic and welcoming restaurant that enveloped me with a warm embrace from its comfort food and inviting hospitality.  A place that echos history and culture yet with a hip-happy and classy ambiance, we started off with a creative cocktail "Anar Daiquiri" with a pistachio salted rim and settled into our first appetizer that was sure to refresh our senses. We had the pleasure of our rock star chef to graciously describe what our taste buds were about to experience.  Continued with several distinctive appetizers while my mouth watered as I savored the most amazing eggplant. What a treat when were introduced to the fried brussel sprouts and the "Minted Memory" Cocktail to wash down the last of our final dishes and our tantalizing desserts.  If you have not made the trip to "Fly Trap" wait no more!  I cant wait to go back and see what else is added to the menu!
author: Veronica C.

description: LOVED this place.  Our server was incredibly nice, and our appetizers were brought out by the chef himself.  Great food - the beef skewers and the moroccan salmon were to die for.  My new favourite place in the 'hood!
author: Mary H.

description: A good place to grab a drink.  Yummy cocktails, helpful bartenders, nice bar area.
author: Melinda C.

description: My boyfriend LOVES this place. He has had nothing but friendly service and good food. Now, that I've been there, I totally agree with him. I will go back there anytime. We sat at the bar, had several appetizers and we finished with dessert. Don't leave the place without trying Falodeh (dessert - it is a must have). The staff, are very pleasant and knowledgeable. I really liked the idea that the owner was out, talking to customers and making sure that everyone was welcome.
author: nita s.

description: roasted beet salad, marinated chick peas, & the torshi (pickled vegetable condiment) were exceptional.  Several of the other items were good- not great, but still nice flavor- only one real dog.  Good service.
author: grace s.

description: One of the best new restaurants I've been to in SF - great decor (feels like being in a Parisian bistro), all organic food, creative and delicious dishes and most of all really personalized attention. The host, the chef and the manager all individually stopped by to check on us. Highly recommended.
author: Aydin S.

description: Had reservations at 11:30 on a Saturday night.  Place had a good vibe to it..  There were quite a few people dining at that time. Started with an Anar Daiquiri which was a perfect 10 as far a cocktails go.  Also had a bottle of Sky Zinfandel was a light jammy Zin.  The cauliflower apple soup was very good, loved it.  Roasted beet salad was very good. Butter Nut squash orzo was good; personally I would have liked more of the squash and less of the orzo.  My friend was happy with the lamb burger.  We decided to have the goat cheese cheesecake and a side of the lemon curd.  Both were amazingly tasty.  This place worked for that night.  I would recommend if in the area..great late night dining spot. One more thing, the server (female) was very attentive and knowledgeable.
author: Stacy C.

description:
We are ecstatic to hear Chef Hoss Zare is back in San Francisco.

We met him at his last restaurant (Zare) on Sacramento street about 6 or 7 years ago and sort of became "groupies".  We followed him to Napa, but we all agreed that Fly Trap seems like a natural fit for his talents.
Any time you have a meal by Chef Zare, the world takes on a rosy hue for a few hours afterward, this is food as therapy, who needs Prozac!

The Fly Trap restaurant itself is beautiful inside, warm gold and red hues, pleasantly upscale decor without any typical SF snobbishness, comfortable table arrangements, and best of all, very friendly host and wait staff. 
Chef Hoss Zare brings that infamously warm Persian hospitality to this restaurant.  He is very "hands on" in the dining room, I am always amazed how many patrons personally seek him out to thank him...I think I hugged him twice last night!
The food, where should I begin?
The chef's creativity is showcased in the Mediterranean/Persian/Californian menu, including things like pistachio meatballs and a bone marrow appetizer (it doesn't sound good, but it is amazingly tasty and rich).  Everyone at the table was overwhelmed with the flavors...I had the Salmon and it was excellent...the grapefruit reduction and the raspberries gave it such a unique flavor. 
We shared the blueberry pie served with a wonderful lemon basil gelato and the Rocky Road desserts between the three of us.  The portions are perfect, dainty but rich and satisfying. 
We already made a reservation for our next visit. So should you.
author: Nilu r.

description: When I first saw they had bone marrow on their appetizer. I needed to ordered it, unfortunately It was a bit underseasoned so that's a minus, but I did have their soup of the day. I am not sure what was in the soup, but the waiter was so nice to explain it to us, which turns out to be a really good hearty soup. My friend had the Wild Salmon...I didnt taste it but from what he says it was pretty good. The lighting is a little dark for me. And there was no a/c inside the back. I was sweating while having my dinner. The good part of the dinner was the lemon pie, which is called, not my grandma's pie...its a deconstructed dish of a classic lemon pie. However or whatever they want to do with it, I love it. I finished it off in two seconds...The timing is a little off from apps to main entree. There is quite a wait, and the check took forever to come, but i give it a four stars cause the food was tasty, and to me...it's all about the food.
author: Jenny W.

description: Oh my goodness, was that a great meal at Zare at Fly Trap!  Very reasonable, too - about $300 for 6 people, and we all ate and drank until we could eat & drink no more!  Of the appetizers, the butternut squash with risotto was delicious, as was the mushroom skewer with a tangy salad.  I had the dinner special Monday Meatball, which I highly recommend, but my friend's mahi mahi special was also fantastic.  had the sorbet for dessert and it was also delicious.  Everyone loved their meals and I think we'd all go back there again.
author: Susan L.

description:
We started our meal with pisco sours which were really excellent. I would come back here just for the drinks based on that pisco sour. 
I had the pistachio meatballs for my appetizer, and my husband had a salad. The pistachio meatballs were great. They're a little sweet and tangy due to the pomegranate molasses sauce, which was a very nice contrast to the lamb. Yum. My husband seemed to enjoy his salad, but it was pretty standard stuff: greens, shaved parm, you know the drill. 
I had the salmon with israeli couscous and charmoula for my entree, and although I loved the couscous and charmoula, the salmon had a bit too much charring going on. It had been charred on the grill, but the result was that you tasted mostly char, and couldn't actually taste the fish. Husband really enjoyed his lamb burger, although he thought the bun could be improved upon. I enjoyed the one wee little bite he let me have. The fried brioche and chocolate dessert was pretty decent, a lot like a churro with chocolate. 
We both really liked the interior, and the service. 
Overall, I think this place is a great addition to the neighborhood and I would certainly come back, but I do think there is some room for improvement for the food in terms of execution.
author: Michelle A.

description: Great! I loved there tangy pistachio meatballs! It was definitely a kid friendly place, their lamb burger was exceptionally juicy...  great for kids! Chef Hoss Zare was a very nice man... in other words he knows how to please his guests!
author: Henry P.

description: I had a pretty good experience here for dinner on a Friday night.!  It wasn't packed at 8:30 (it got busier as the night progressed) and we were seated immediately.  The ambiance is dark and romantic and there was plenty of space between the tables, though I still felt that the room was very noisy.  The service was pretty good, and the food was tasty.  I had the cod with gnocchi and I can't get over how light and soft the gnocchi were! I LOVED them and wished they gave more than 5 pieces :( My man had the bone marrow appetizer and the lamb with pasta, which were  very sizable portions and tasty also.  For dessert, we had the "not your grandma's pie", which was a deconstructed lime curd pie, consisting of graham cracker crumbs, a puddle of lime curd, a dollop of meringue, and a teeny time ball of coconut sorbet.  I wasn't a fan of the deconstruction, but they had a number of interesting desserts that I'll try next time I go.
author: Grace M.

description:
Sat at the bar and ordered the pistachio meatballs- nice texture, not over seasoned and nicely browned. Sauce was good but a bit too think and may have needed some salt to bring out the flavors. The meatballs had a great presentation and was served hot with beautiful pomegranate seeds. 
The 1/2 duck was nice with candied citrus rind and rice. The thigh and leg were nicely braised, fork tender and the meat fell off the bone. The breast was equally as nice. The rice was nothing special but the sauce and flavors of the duck were all there so the rice made it nice to balance the dish. 
Service was outstanding, the bar tender was friendly and the server was prompt and attentive. 
There was a bus boy who really impressed and I actually wanted to tell the owner about. I was on my way to the restroom were headed in the same area and although his hands were completely full of plates, he backed up and insisted I go before him. This is something I always appreciate. Note to owners: please pass this praise on to him, you know who he is.
author: Scott L.

description: Just stopped in for some drinks after work, but the appetizers were definitely intriguing. The bartender was great and she went out of her way to come from behind the bar to serve us at the large communal table. While not cheap, the drinks were good and the atmosphere is very nice...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I am sorry.  I dominate this neighborhood, hit up all the spots, try to get a consistent rotation.  Liked Hoss Zare's food in the past, but this Meatball Monday thing is a disaster!  First, a very mushy, mildly flavored giant meatball, second a quail inside.  The entire thing fell apart on first bite, required salt, pepper and chili flakes to bring it back to life and even then wasn't good at all.  Gimmiicky.
author: Nick S.

description: I love this place, the food is good and the staff is so nice. Some of my favorite dishes are the Veggie Koofteh, the grilled eggplant dish, Beef Skewers, and everything on the dessert menu.
author: Ess M.

description:
the husband and i just had a fanstic date nite meal here. and i have to say, everything about this place impressed me. 

it's a warm, bistro-y type place with low lighting and tones of rich red and golden yellows. totally the kind of place you'd want to hole up in on a rainy nite. anyway, our waiter took excellent care of us. he was very attentive and made sure we approved of everything he brought for us. 

we shared the pisatachio meatballs to start. i think they were lamb and the sweetness of the meat was accentuated by a delicious honey harissa sauce. these were really yummy, moist, chewy, juicy. everything a meatball should be. 

i went on to have the fish of the day, which was scallops--perfectly grilled and served atop a lovely mushroom risotto with shaved parmesan. those mushrooms were a standout, super flavorful. and the rissotto wasn't too heavy or overly creamy. the portion size wasn't huge, but it ended up being just right for me. the husband had the pappadam-crusted salmon served ona bed of grains, similar to coucous, but larger with great texture. his dish dish had very bright, tangy flavors. so good with the salmon.  

we finished with the fried milk tojillas, cause i am a sucker for anything remotely beignet-like. they came with rose infused hot cocoa for dipping. seriously. these were delicious. 

not only did our waiter check on us, but so did the manager and the chef. i got the feeling they were seriosuly invested in your happiness here. i'd love to come back.
author: rachel p.

description: Great happy hour bar! There isn't much room for a group, but if it's just a couple of us, it's the perfect place. The drinks are very good. I especially like the cosmos. Oh, and how can you resist the potato chips?
author: Jan Z.

description:
Our executives used to eat here when it was the Fly Trap, and they grilled me a bit when I booked an important luncheon for 10. The experience surpassed everyone's expectations.
Interior - tasteful, immaculate, and the combination of flowers inside and also in the window boxes reflected in the mirrors made me feel as if I had been transported out of the city. The music is about right, and you can hear each other to hold a conversation.
Service - without being fussy or intrusive, we had our orders taken quickly, tap vs fizzy water sorted out, and I appreciated the fact that we didn't have to listen to a litany about the specials of the day.
Food - really exceptional. I had the cauliflower soup and a side of green beans with feta. I am an expert at soup, and the addition of apples, bacon, and an undertone of Mediterranean spice was better than my recipe. My young, male co-workers raved about the vegetables - I'm not making this up! The beef entrees were cooked exactly as ordered, and the Ahi salad Nicoise stole the show. Beautiful olives. Very nice little touches like small pots of ketchup on the side for fries and bottle of water on the table to help ourselves.
When we finished, the waiter brought out both the manager and the chef for introductions. Kudos!
This is a place we will continue to book for company meals and events. Maybe a bit too pricey for everyday lunch, but you've got to treat yourself now and again.
author: OffToRio B.

description:
If you are looking for authentic Middle Eastern flavors that really jump off your palate, this is a restaurant that you need to discover.

Zare had a very warm interior and ambiance, filled with reds, golds, and dark woods.  The decor was very appropriate to the character of the food and the restaurant.

For a starter, I couldn't resist the cauliflower apple soup.  The soup itself was velvety smooth- as it should be- and I could tell that the chef had strained it carefully to achieve the texture.  In terms of the flavors, it was very well-balanced and surprising; you get a taste of the cauliflower, the apple, and the bacon with every bite.  It was a fatastic way to begin the meal.

For an entree, I had the flat-iron steak with the taro root mash; it was fantastic!  The steak was crusted in bleu cheese and cooked perfectly- most restaurants won't serve me a proper rare steak; the chef at Zare wasn't afraid to serve it to me black and blue.  I had a opportunity to sample the other two entrees at my table as well, and both the lamb shank and the salmon were superb.  I don't even like salmon, but I loved this dish.  Very creative and a great summer dish.

For dessert we had the blueberry cake and the rocky road.  I could have done without the blueberry cake- the balance between the tartness and sweetness was a little off.  The rocky road, however, was phenomenal.  Excellent flavors and a very creative spin on a classic flavor profile.

All in all, this is a restaurant worth experiencing.  If you consider yourself at all a foodie, give Zare at Fly Trap a try.
author: Jason B.

description:
A well thought out wine list, great ambiance and good service. Zare has an eye as well as a great palate. Now that he is back to his roots he appears ready to be more playful with his flavors. Even at Cafe Zare on Polk, many years ago, one could count on whimsical touches to the spice of even a simple tomato sauce. Now he's taking this to the next level.

If you don't like to be challenged by assertive flavors, make sure to ask the staff, since dishes like salmon in a pink grapefruit reduction have strong and occasionally shocking flavors. If you can go with them, they are delicious..If not, well the hangar steak with blue cheese is probably more your style.

Make no mistake. This is not Middle Eastern food. Nor is it Fusion, California or the same old same old SF Med/French/Brasserie/Whatever.
It's just Zare. Zare takes what he knows and recombines it with his audience in mind. It's all good and it's all interesting, but it can be aback taking at times.
author: Otto S.

description:
I am so excited that flytrap is now under the guise of one of my favorite chefs in town, Hoss Zare.  As much as I have loved Flytrap over the years, it had become tired and in need of makeover...and that is exactly what Hoss gave it.
The new orange accents liven up the interior, and the art and flowered plants give the place soul.  The staff is excellent--(we love Bridget!) very attentive and friendly.  And the menu is just so beautiful and creative.
We started with some shared appetizers; cucumber fettucini with smoked trout, salmon roe and creme fresh--was so refreshing and a perfect light starter.  we then had the meatballs--you should not miss these meatballs!!  next, the wild mushroom soup--OK, i am still thinking of this soup...it comes in two parts.  first, the server places a bowl of composed porcini mushrooms, diced butternut squash, celery leaves and a poached egg, then they pour wild mushroom broth over it table side...the celery leaves give the most amazing aroma and the whole dish combines textures and flavors so unique together...truly memorable.  After the soup, we treid the beet carpacio--which was think yellow beets toped with chunks of red beets, feta cheese and frissee.  it was beautiful and fresh.  
the wine list is so creative i just loved it...one of the most creative lists i have seen with whites from greece, sicily, spain and reds to match--they even have a vertical of my favorite wine in the world--Chateau Musar!
This is my new SOMA favorite...for anyone in this neighborhoos who loves Local Kitchen, this is a new spot for you!
author: rebecca m.

description:
This restaurant has a very interesting menu.  The menu is not boring like many other restaurants that I've been to.  We tried the lamb tongue appetizer and loved it.  I should warn that it's probably not suitable for everyone's taste but if your taste is more towards the exotic side then you'll definitely love it.  The mushroom consonme was just okay for me though.  I had monk fish as my entree and it tasted good.  My friend had lamb shank as entree and it was a huge portion and was tender and tasted good.

Didn't have time for dessert.
author: bubu s.

description:
A friend and I went to dinner at Fly Trap last night on the recommendtation of another foodie friend.  We were NOT disappointed! The interior is swanky, but comfortable.  Our server "Katie" was super awesome!  EVERYTHING on the menu sounded amazing and we were having a hard time deciding on what to order.  Katie answered all of our ridiculous questions and described the food to exact detail and even helped us pick out which dishes to get.  We decided to split some small plates so we could try more things and save room for dessert  (as any self respecting foodie would do, right?)  We started with the pheasant salad which was sooooo good!  Usually when you go to a nice restaurant and order something like this there is one tiny little piece of meat on top... but there was actually a pretty good amount, so I didn't have to sneakily snag it all before my friend noticed it was there.  YAY for sharing!  I wont tell you what the other dishes we got because I am confidant that EVERYTHING on the menu is just as good as all of the things we ordered... and it was ALL amazing. When you go to fly trap (and you should!)  have Katie or who ever your server is, help you pick out with the perfect dishes for your group, cause this girl really knew her stuff and I'm guessing all of the staff does.   

five stars for food!
five stars for service!
five stars for having chairs that were actually comfortable to sit in!  
can I give the dessert six stars? please?

I'll be back here for fancy date night with my boyfriend, after shopping dinner with the girls, a cocktail after work... pretty much any excuse I can make up.
author: marisa p.

description: Love this restaurant!  The owner/chef is so personable- he delivers his dishes to your table.  Love the fresh herbs and spices he uses.  Pistachio meatballs , lamb sausage and flat iron steak are a few of his best dishes!
author: Michelle G.

description: Had my 21st birthday dinner here. They have a very nice ambiance, with a grand piano at one of the corners with live music playing. Beautiful. Everyone was really friendly and patient. Food was great.  For appetizers we had the fresh oysters, crab cake, and escargot!! For my entree, I had  the salmon. Cooked perfectly. I had a great time  and  would probably go again.
author: Jenny K.

description: I adore this place.  It has the aura of a hidden restaurant in Rome with the convenience of being near 2nd street.  Their menu is broad enough to please everyone and even includes home-made pasta.  Definitely a romantic and cozy date place, but would be overkill for a first date.
author: Zuzzi E.

description:
we needed a place to grab a bite before heading to the airport yesterday and yelp and urbanspoon pointed to this being close and worthy of inspection. 

they found us a table, took care of our luggage and served up a great meal.  the drunken chicken for me hit the spot and there were rave reviews for the balance of the meal.  

service was attentive and prompt and even though we told them that we'd be taking off at 8:30 prompt and stayed a little long (sorry, got engrossed in the conversation)  they didn't harass us.  definitely worth coming back to.

the gin selection is a bit on the thin side, but the decor and the ambiance are great.  definitely coming back the next time i'm in SOMA.
author: Steve U.

description: This place is great.  I'm out here from Chicago for work and we were recommended to try this place from our Concierge.  She was dead on.  The food was incredible, the service amazing and the over all experience was wonderful especially for the group of 10 I was with.  We asked the waiter for suggestions and he was right on with his suggestions.  The atmosphere was great with a live piano player and fantastic singer.  If I ever make it back out here, totally a place I'm going to again.
author: Melissa K.

description: fried risotto balls? yes please. i have dreams about those suckers! (not a joke.) first of all, the risotto is made with perfect finesse, it's FRIED (mmm) and served with marinara dipping sauce...honestly my mouth is watering just typing about them. AND SPEAKING of mouth watering, have the goat cheese cheesecake...which i know sounds questionable but just go with it. really just go to zare at fly trap. you won't regret it.
author: Ami V.

description: 3 other friends & I stopped in for dinner on a Saturday night at the Fly Trap not too long ago. The restaurant itself is a bit on the upscale side where most of the diners appeared to be there for a special occasion. The chicken coq au vin  I had was delicious: juicy & flavorful. The waiter also did a good job pairing a pair pinot noir (I don't recall the name of the wine exactly) with it. I definitely enjoyed myself and would go back in a heart beat.
author: Catherine L.

description: Great romantic little hidden spot in SOMA, everything was great, not really exceptional, but creative. I'm giving just four because the food timing wasn't quite good, but we sat at the bar, so we didn't worry much about it. Hostess was really sweet and the piano...Hmmm..
author: Marta K.

description:
We picked this restaurant based on reviews here on Yelp... it did not deliver.
We had a party of 7 and all of us agreed that we won't be back.  We started with some drinks from the bar and then moved to our table.  Once there we placed our drink orders and apps.  The two plates of bread with spreads for the table never arrived.  I ordered the roasted baby eggplant and it was blah, and i love eggplant.  the fried onions on the plate were good though.  Our dinners were the worst.  My husband and I both ordered the drunken chicken- bland, bland, bland.  The chicken was just- chicken, and it was sitting on a very bland white cream sauce, with no flavor.  I tasted like pure half and half.  At one point when a server came to refill my husband's coffee the carafe 'sputtered' and sprayed/ spewed all over my husband and I.  The guy apologized, but nothing more was done.  Luckily I wasn't wearing white.  I ordered a dessert since I was still hungry.  I ordered the "not your mother's pie" it was deconstructed lemon meringue, and several of us agreed it was the best thing that arrived at the table all day.  The white wine we had, an Albarinho was also quite good.  After we received the bill we payed and continued to sit and chat.  The waiter asked if he could take the bill, and we said yes.  After a little while they came back and said they forgot to add our original bar tab, so they gave us a second bill to pay.  The company was fabulous, but the food and service - horrible.
author: Nica W.

description: I dream of the duck legs and deconstructed lemon pie daily. I love this place so much. Thank baby J, it's only 1 block away from my house.
author: Ana F.

description: The lamb burger is to die for. Just perfectly done. The servers are very friendly. I hear their lamb shank is awesome too. Definitely one of the best places to eat in soma.
author: Vman V.

description:
Thanksgiving night. Reservations were made for 8 pm. We walk into the restaurant and stand there for about 8 minutes. Not a soul greets us, not even the servers or bussers acknowledge our presence in the hostess' behalf. Finally the hostess comes and tells us there will be a little bit of a wait, why not wait at their bar...sure, that's alright by me...but the thing is the bar was full and there was no where to even stand by the bar, until some people eventually get seated...then, once again, the bartender just does not seem to mind anyone even if the bar finally had some open space (we were not the only ones neglected)...after trying my patience even more (I used to work in a restaurant, and so I know how it can be...but this was ridiculous!!!), I walked over to her and politely asked her to take our order of drinks. She then paid attention. ...told myself I would let it go....then about 45 minutes pass. Not once did anyone even communicate with us if we wanted more drinks, that they were sorry we had to wait so long, or offer any bread ....anything! We stuck around because, where else were we to go on this evening? Finally, we sat and I told myself to make the most of the evening. 

To be fair, the food was fantastic and absolutely delicious (although I did ask for some olive oil and balsamic vinegar for my bread, and the busser brought a bottle of olive oil that had barely any! Not even enough for a piece of bread!!).... the food came pretty fast as well. The kitchen/back-of-the-house crew did a fantastic job!! BRAVO! As for our server, it was very obvious it was just a job to him...

Fly Trap had a great ambience and the food was spectacular, and although this was the case,our experience and moods had already changed into a non-festive dissapointment.......the front-of-the-house crew that evening do not belong in the restaurant/hospitality industry. They made our Thanksgiving experience horrible. The worst customer service I have ever experienced. They were not rude, but they were just doing nothing at all. No greeting, no communication, no warmth...no nothing. I did look for a manager, and there seemed to have been none that evening.
